loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Monserrate pertenece a la ciudad de Montecristi en la provincia costera Manabí. 
La señora Cristina es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, ella se dedica al comercio ambulante desde hace 24 años, vende escapularios, llaveros, reliquias, velas todo lo que va relacionado con las imágenes católicas, tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa también los días domingos sale a vender en las afuera de la iglesia de Montecristi, además en las fiestas parroquiales de otros cantones ella viaja y época de navidad vende juguetes, fantasías (accesorios de mujeres) entre otros productos.

 La señora Cristina el dinero que esta solicitando es para incrementar mas su negocio ella viaja a la ciudad de Guayaquil para realizar sus compras como, lasos, zapatillas, estampas para arreglar los cuartos, de todo un poco, en cada compra que realiza invierte desde 800 a 1500 dólares, su esposo y su hijo le ayudan con el negocio , ella ha sido socia desde hace 24 años  ella ingreso al bankito por midió de unos extranjeros que llegaron a motivar a las personas de bajos recursos económicos dándoles a conocer que podían hacer prestamos a la Fundación Espoir para así poder iniciar sus negocios  cuenta que estos señores les daban las charlas de motivación y así fue que se animó y desde entonces es socia, tiene como recuerdo que su primer crédito lo recibió cuando la moneda era en sucre.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank María Monserrate belongs to the city of Montecristi in the coastal province of Manabí.

Mrs. Cristina is married and has 4 children. She has been a street vendor for over 24 years; she sells scapulars, key rings, relics, candles and everything relating to catholic iconography. She also has a small business in her home. On Sundays, she sells her items outside of the Montecristi church. Besides selling her items during the festivities of other churches, Cristina travels and during the Christmas season she sells toys, costume jewelry (accessories for women) among other products.

Mrs. Cristina needs the money to expand her business; she travels to the city of Guayaquil to buy things like twine, slippers, and prints to decorate the rooms, a little bit of everything. With each purchase that she does, she spends between 800 and 1500 dollars, her husband and son help her with the business. She has been a member for some 24 years, she joined the bank because some foreigners came to motivate people of low income by letting them know that they could make loans with Espoir Foundation (Kiva’s field partner) and they could start their businesses. She tells us that these people gave them motivational talks and because of them she was encouraged and ever since then she has been a member. Mrs. Cristina remembers that her first loan she received was when the currency was in sucres.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy twine, slippers, and prints.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.pt:
Ernesto M. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província de Maputo, fronteira com a Suazilândia tem 40 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos de 16, 12 e 06 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 6ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Namaacha para Boane em missão de serviço, mais tarde formou seu lar e fixou sua residência em Boane. Trabalha como docente ha mais de 10 anos, para além de seu emprego possui um negócio próprio que lhe auxilia nas suas despesas de casa. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.500.00mt, mais cerca de 3.000.00mt provenientes do seu negócio que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (cerveja, refrescos, açúcar, arroz, vinho e outros) para aumentar e diversificar ainda mais a sua mercadoria.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para compra de uma viatura como forma de solucionar as dificuldades de transporte que enfrenta no transporte da sua mercadoria.
texts.en:
Ernesto M. was born in Namaacha District, which is in Maputo Province on the border with Swaziland. He is 40 years old, married and the father of three children, ages 16, 12 and 6 years. They all go to school. Ernesto only finished sixth grade. He did not continue school due to financial difficulties. He lives in his own house with his family and does not support anyone else. He left Namaacha for Boane on a service mission; later he set up his home and established residence in Boane. He has worked as a teacher for more than 10 years, and in addition to his job he has his own business, which helps him with household expenses. He earns about 3,500 meticais, with about 3,000 more coming from his business. He uses the money to cover household expenses and also manages to save some in his bank account. Ernesto has never taken out loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers of this institution. This is his first loan. He is asking for 20,000 meticais to buy products (beer, soft drinks, sugar, rice, wine and other products) to increase and diversify his inventory. He promises to pay off this loan on time so he can take out others. In the future, he would like to ask for more loans to buy a vehicle and solve the transportation problems he faces while transporting his merchandise.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products (beer, soft drinks, sugar, rice, wine and others)

loans.name: Onyinyechi

texts.en:
Onyinyechi own a shop where she sells foodstuffs like garri, beans, rice, melon, stock fish and more. She has been in the business for over 7 years. 
She is married with 2 children and she is 27 years old. Her husband is business man and they lives in Lagos. With the proceeds from the business, she could support her husband in taking care of the children needs like clothing, feeding, and more. 

Onyinyechi wants to stock up her shop with more foodstuffs and she needs the loan of NGN50, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell to her numerous costumers as this will increase her sales and boost her profit. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Albertha

texts.es:
Alberta es una mujer que lucha día a día por salir adelante, a sus 48 años es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, trabaja con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desde hace 11 años, se dedica  al reciclaje de cartón, botellas, fierros, cobre, desde hace 10 años, además realiza trabajos de limpieza en una universidad, se inicio en este negocio por la necesidad que había en su hogar, ya que su esposo se quedo sin empleo y no tenían ningún ingreso, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado la construcción de su vivienda y la educación de sus hijos.
El gran sueño de Alberta, es comprar un local para utilizarlo como depósito para su mercadería. El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido en la compra de una balanza para pesar la mercadería que recicla. Alberta se encuentra muy agradecida por todo el apoyo brindado, porque le ha ayudado  a mejorar su calidad de vida y el de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alberta is a woman who strives, day after day, to pull herself up. She is 48 years old and partnered with 3 grown children. She has worked with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for 11 years. She has operated a business recycling paper, bottles, metal, copper, etc. for 10 years. She also works as a cleaner at the university. She started working because she needed to pay the family's bills when her husband was out of work. Her efforts have paid off and she has managed to build a house and educate her children. Alberta's dream is to buy a space where she can keep her stocks. She will use the most recent loan to buy a scale for weighing the products that she recycles. Alberta is very grateful for the support she's been given because it has helped her to improve her quality of life and her children's.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a scale for recycling business

loans.name: Emere Pa Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Comfort describes herself as very determined. She is 42 years old and she is the leader of the “Emere pa” (translated as 'good time') borrower group. Comfort lives in Safwi and has been selling porridge and donuts for the past 6 years. Porridge known as ‘koko’ is a local food popularly enjoyed as breakfast. It is prepared with corn dough or millet grains, boiled with a lot of water to make it semi-liquid and eaten hot with sugar, milk, and bread. It can also be eaten with 'kosse', a tasty donut-like food prepared from milled beans mixed with spices and fried in oil. Comfort is excited to be taking out this loan, which she will use to purchase bags of flour, sugar, maize and other food ingredients to improve the quality of her food.

She wants to use the extra profits she anticipates as a result of this loan to open more porridge-selling eateries.

She is married to a farmer and together they have six children. Comfort hopes to make more savings to be able to provide quality education for all of her children, hopefully through university level.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients like maize, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher B., from the village of Mandulog Iligan City, is 39 years old, married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Christopher owns and operates a business providing motorcycle services to local community members. Engaged in his business for over three years, he earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Christopher joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase materials needed to provide service, and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Mrs. Bun M. has spent her whole life cultivating crops on her own five hectares of farmland. She has used this skill to earn a living since she was young. She is now married and has a young school-aged child. Her husband frequently works in the farm fields alongside her. Growing crops is an activity with which she has had great success for several years. She is able to plant crops at least twice a year following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for growing, but Bun M. does not have enough capital to use on her farm. So Bun M. is looking for a loan to purchase farm supplies to support her farming activity.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Sokky

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokky S. (pictured above), and her husband, Mr. Sok-An Chheng, live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1990 and have four children: one son and three daughters. 

Sokky has been a silk weaver since she was fourteen years old. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a policeman for more than twenty years. She is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es casada y tiene 6 hijos D. los cuales 2 estudian, Luisa tiene un puesto en el mercado Magdalena en donD. venD. comida, actividad que inicia a las 5 D. la mañana hasta las 10 D. la mañana, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda D. sus hijos.
Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal Lila y solicita un préstamo D. 1000 soles para la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite por sacos.
Los sueños D. Luisa es mejorar su casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Luisa is married and has 6 children two of whom are in school. She has a stand in the Magdalena Market where she sells food starting at 5am and going until 10am; her children help out. Luisa is a member of the “Lila” (Lilac) communal bank and is asking for a 100 sol loan to buy sacks of rice and sugar and to buy cooking oil. Luisa’s dream is to make improvements to her home and to expand her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice and sugar; to buy cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying manure and fertilizers for his fields

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa C. is from the city of Carig Highway, Tuguegarao City. She is 32 years old and single. To make a living, Luisa owns and operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Luisa has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP per month from these activities.
Luisa joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase rice to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase rice to expand product offering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To complete his necessities of the shop.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a forty-year-old married man with three children, living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family dream is to have a better standard of living in future. He owns a retail shop, restaurant, tea plantation, and for the last ten years, he has seen them grow fairly well, but this has not stopped him from hoping for better results in his businesses than they are now. The purpose of the loan is to buy fertilizers for his tea plantation so as to realize increased production.

loans.use: Buying fertilizers for his tea plantation

loans.name: Zulaikhan's Group

texts.en:
Zulaikhan is a resident of Depalpur, an ancient city of Pakistan. She lives there in an area named 38 D with her family. 
 
Her husband, M. Y., is a salesman by profession and sells bakery products. He is the only breadwinner of the family. He sells different products such as bread, cakes and biscuits to different bakeries and stores to good profit. He has been doing this business for over 10 years. 

She is the mother of two daughters and a son. All of them are getting their education from a local school. Zulaikhan is an uneducated lady but she is aware of the importance of education that’s why she wants for her children to complete their education and become successful in life.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy bakery products like bread, cakes and biscuits in bulk quantity and increase his sales. She is hopeful that this investment will bring positive outcomes for her husband’s business and their living standard will become better.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible client who paid her installments on time and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy bakery products for selling

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOC RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Consuelo; tiene 57 años de edad, y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de confección de ropa y también atiende kiosco escolar, la ropa lo vende de forma independiente y luego los distribuye diferentes tiendas, la socia quiere ampliar. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para confeccionar la ropa.

La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Consuelo is a member of the “Mosoc Runa” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Consuelo is 57 years old.  She is single and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her dressmaking business.  She also serve in a school kiosk.  She sells the clothes independently and then different stores distribute them.  She would like to expand her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy materials for making clothes.

She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy materials for making clothes

loans.name: Fatima Argentina

texts.es:
la señora Fatima Argentina Y. F. tiene 37 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos.
Fatima se dedica a la venta de mercaderia como ser zapatos, ropa, perfumes, sandalias, carteras y accesorios para  el hogar como ventiladores, termos, juego de ollas. 
este negocio lo tiene desde hace unos ocho años, tiene casa propia y desea superarse cada dia mas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia ya que se aproxima la epoca de navidad en donde vende bastante y desea tener surtido su negocio.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatima Argentina Y. F. is 37 years old, married, with two children.  Fatima works selling merchandise such as shoes, clothing, perfume, sandals, wallets, and accessories for the home such as fans, thermoses, and cookware.

She has had this business for about 8 years.  She has her own house and wants to improve herself every day.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise, since the Christmas season is approaching where she sells a lot and she wants her business to be well-supplied.  She needs the income to cover her living expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of wallets, clothing, and shoes.

loans.name: Kasem

texts.en: Kasem is a 36-year-old man from Nabatieh. He has worked in construction for the past ten years. He is requesting a loan from A. majmoua to buy materials for his business specializing in cement. He will also use a portion of the loan to pay for some of his wedding expenses. Kasem is a man of honor: he is honest and hard-working in the eyes of his neighbors, clients, and relatives. He hopes to expand his business and build his dream house in the future.

loans.use: To buy materials for cement business

loans.name: Munoru

texts.en:
Munoru K. is 60 years old and married to Rachael, who contributes to the family income through farming.  He has been running his dairy farm for a period of ten years with an income of Kshs.10,000 per month.

This is his third loan from KADET LTD. He successfully repaid the previous loans.  He plans to use this loan to buy animal feed. He hopes to venture into greenhouse farming and be a leading farmer. His goal is to give his children a quality education and improve their living standard.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio M. is from the village of Tonggo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 25 years old. Bonifacio is married and has one infant-aged children. To make a living, Bonifacio owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motorcycle transport services. Bonifacio has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Bonifacio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bonifacio is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Bonifacio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 35-year-old married man with four children. He lives in his house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He stays in a rented house and his dream is to build his own permanent house in the next four years. 

For six years, he has been in motorcycle transport. He started as an employee, but later bought his own motorcycle. His ambition is to buy a car for a taxi business. Fred intends to use the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: Buying a motorcycle

loans.name: Las Orgullosas Group

texts.es: EL Banco D. emprendimiento LAS ORGULLOSAS, es un banco nuevo formado por 8 integrantes 7 mujeres y un varon, se dedican a distintas actividades, ellas se dedican a la venta D. productos como: cosméticos ollas en aluminio ,atención en su tienda, venta D. frutas, verduras y otros y la Sra. SUSANA es una D. las socias mas antiguas que anteriormente trabajo con otro banco y ella ocupa el cargo D. presidenta la Sra. se dedica a la venta D. zapatillas en la feria D. Viacha y también hace compra y venta D. arena para la construcción en la urbe paceña  y con el préstamo comprara mercadería en cantidad, zapatos por docenas y también si para el  mantenimiento D. su carro y tiene un hijo, y la Sra. CINTIA ocupa  el cargo D. secretaria y ella se dedica a la venta D. productos cosméticos y es una persona joven con muchos deseo D. salir adelante y con el préstamo comprara mercadería  para  poner en oferta sus productos en variedades, todas las socias están muy agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The entrepreneurs group called "Las Orgullosas" is a new group composed of 8 members, 7 women and one man, who have different businesses, but all work selling products such as: cosmetics, aluminum pots, fruits, vegetables, and other goods. Susana is one of the longest-standing members, who previously worked with another loan group and is now president of this group. She sells shoes in the market at Viacha and also buys and sells sand for construction in the city of La Paz. She will use the loan to buy merchandise in bulk, shoes by the dozen, and also for the maintenance of her car. And she has a son. Cintia is the secretary of the group and she sells cosmetics and is a young person with lots of will to succeed. She will use the loan to buy merchandise to offer for sale. All the members are very grateful to the institution of the support offered to them.

loans.use: To purchase shoes in bulk

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en:
Ursula is from the village of Maribojoc, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old, married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Ursula runs a business raising livestock in the local community.

Ursula has been engaged in her business for three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. Ursula joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional pigs to sell.

Ursula is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use for working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ursula from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Kelly Elizabeth

texts.es:
Kelly, de 29 años de edad, es originaria del departamento de Estelí, esta casada , es madre de 3 hijos , se dedica a atender una pulpería de la cual ella es la dueña lleva año y medio en este negocio. Primeramente la pulpería era de su madre y después se la dejo a ella para que trabajara, anterior a este trabajo, ella era administradora de una disco móvil pero después decido independizarse y tener su propio negocio, el cual se encuentra localizado en el barrio donde habita ella. Ella vende productos tales como pan, tortilla, arroz, azúcar, etc. En la pulpería la apoya su esposo quien le ayuda a realizar las compras y atender a los clientes. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite y otros productos perecederos, también desea comprar gas para vender. Este crédito le ayudara a incrementar sus ventas al comprar más producto para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, obtener nueva clientela y aumentar sus ganancias para invertir en el negocio. 
Sus planes futuros son preparar a sus hijos para que estudien una carrera profesional ya que tiene a dos de sus hijos en la secundaria y al menor en tercer grado de primaria eso es primordial en su vida. Una de sus metas  es poner un puesto de gas butano.
texts.en:
Kelly is 29 and lives in Estelí.  She is married, the mother of three children, and has maintained a small food store for the past year and a half. The store had been run by her mother but Kelly now manages it full time, having left her job as manager of a discoteque.  The store is located in her neighborhood and sells basic products such as bread, tortillas, rice, sugar, etc.  Her husband helps her with the day to day tasks of the business. 
Kelly is seeking a loan to purchase additional inventory of food items as well as cooking gas.  This credit will allow her to expand her sales, meet increasing demand by clients for food products and will allow her to invest more profits into growing the business.  Her future plans include providing an education for her children, two of which are in high school and the youngest is in third grade.  Another goal of hers is to begin selling butane gas.

loans.use: To buy inventory of basic food items such as rice, sugar, cooking oil and others

loans.name: Benilda

texts.es: Benilda Isabel F. se dedica al comercio D. perfumes, cosméticos, útiles escolares  y prendas D. vestir especialmente, porque en su negocio venD. D. todo un poco, D. acuerdo con lo que solicitan sus clientes. Su experiencia data desD. hace 14 años cuando iniciò y sus  primeros pasos fueron pocos productos repartidos entre amigas muy cercanas, hasta que en el año 2009 iniciò formalmente aprovechando el aumento D. su mercado, por el importante nùmero D. referìdos  que hoy forman parte D. su clientela. Su éxito radica en la oferta D. calidad que hace D. sus productos, el otorgamiento D. plazos adecuados a sus clientes, a lo cual agrega su amable atenciòn la cual sostien a sus compradores  como firmes voceros D. su negocio.  Otra D. sus fortalezas en su  negocio es que  està ubicado en un esquina vehicular muy transitada por el pùblico, y las buenas relaciones que sostien con sus 4 proveedores, a quienes les compra los productos que ofrece mediante guias especializadas, aunque  tambien venD. otras mercancias que las revistas no tienen y que ella sabe que a sus clientes les gusta comprar. Su meta mas adelante es continuar aprovechando su ubicaciòn para vender bolis(bebidas congeladas a base D. frutas naturales) helados y refrescos. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprarà al por mayor perfumes, labiales, desodorantes, cuadernos, lápices, sacapuntas y variedades; inversiòn que tendrà alta probabilidad D. èxito por que esta fundamentada en pedidos con plazos adecuados para sus permanentes clientes.
texts.en:
Benilda Isabel F. has a business selling perfumes, cosmetics, school supplies and clothes.  In her business she sells a bit of everything, according to what her customers ask her for.  She has 14 years experience and her first steps in this business were selling a few products to her very close friends.  In 2009 she started selling formally, taking advantage of the increase in her market, owing to the large number of referrals that now form part of her customer base.

Benilda's success is due to the quality of the products that she sells and the payment terms that she offers her customers.  Added to this is the kind service that she provides which enables her to keep her customers and also turns them into keen spokespeople for her business.  Another of her strengths is that her business is located on a very busy corner.  She also maintains good relations with her 4 suppliers from whom she buys her products through specialized catalogs.  However, she also sells merchandise that the catalogs don't have which she knows her customers like to buy.

Benilda's goal for the future is to continue taking advantage of her location in order to start selling 'bolis' (frozen drinks maD. from natural fruits), ice creams and soft drinks.  This Kiva loan is her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy perfumes, lipsticks, deodorants, exercise books, pencils, pencil sharpeners and other products wholesale.  This investment is very likely to be successful because it is based on orders, with appropriate repayment terms, from her permanent customers.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lipsticks, deodorants, exercise books, pencils, pencil sharpeners and other products wholesale

loans.name: Crucero De San Vicente 1 Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Crucero D. San Vicente, porque esta ubicado exactamente en un cruce carretero D. L. comunidad D. San vicente en el estado D. México, en México. El grupo esta conformado por nueve integrantes y es L. segunda vez que solicita un prestamo. L. señora Eleuteria H. H. es L. tesorera del grupo. Tiene 44 años y solo termino L. primaria. ElL. se dedica al comercio D. estambres para costuras que inicio ase 8 años. Tiene dos hijos en total (una mujer y un varon). Solicita el prestamo para surtir su negocio y cubrir los pedidos que tiene por cumplir. Al momento D. solicitar este prestamo se siente a gusto con el grupo ya que planea a corto plazo el crcimiento D. su negocio y posteriormente emprender otro negocio D. papeleria con el fin D. mejorar L. calidad D. vida D. sus hijos y continuar dandoles educación para que logren una carrera profesional.
texts.en: This group is called “Crucero D. San Vicente” because it’s located on the crossroads of San Vincente in the state of Mexico.  The group is maD. up of nine members and this will be their second loan.  Eleuteria H. H is the treasurer.  She is 44 years old and only completed elementary school.  She sells fine wool articles and has been doing so for eight years.  She has two children (a son and daughter).  She is asking for this loan in order to stock her business and fill some orders that she has received.  She is happy with the group and plans to grow her business in the short term and eventually open a store to improve the quality of life for her children.  She wants to give them an education so that they can attain professional careers.

loans.use: to buy supplies to stock her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to outfit her house

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a resident of Nkubu in Central Kenya and is married with four children between 18 and 8 years old. All of her children attend school. She has been farming for 10 years, producing maize, beans, and coffee and selling all these to the local market.

Lucy is making a second loan request amounting to 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to expand her maize farming acreage. She says this will improve the family income generation and standard of living and ensure the education of the children. She says it will supplement the income from her dairy, too.

Lucy says the challenge is always occasioned by prolonged drought but remains hopeful the business will pay back.

loans.use: To expand her acreage for farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have the spool in his mill repaired and to buy paint for his vehicle workshop

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en: Battsetseg, 49, is a widow living with her three sons in a house in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She manages a grocery trading business in her town, which she began six months ago. Even within this short period of time, she has been able to manage her store successfully. She is a polite woman who is planning to expand her business. She says, "I want to increase my business sales." She is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase more goods for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her store.

loans.name: Jose Neftali

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la venta de accesorios eléctricos, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 15, 12 y 9 años de edad, tiene casa propia, y administra el negocio desde hace 8 años, lo heredo de un tío quien le enseño a realizar el trabajo. 
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales eléctricos, como cables de todo tamaño con estradas y salidas, tomas de corriente, y más productos que son necesarios para él, con esta inversión estará cumpliendo con uno de sus objetivos que es surtir el negocio y ser competente.
El segundo objetivo es atraer a clientes, ofreciéndole lo mejor en electrónica y de esta manera mejorar su condición de  vida.
texts.en:
Jose sells electrical accessories.  He lives with his wife and three children, ages 15, 12 and 9, in his own house.  For eight years he has been managing the business that he inherited from his uncle who taught him the trade.

He is requesting a loan to buy electrical materials such as cables in assorted sizes and with different connectors, electrical plugs and other products he needs.  With this investment he will be meeting one of his goals of stocking his business to be competitive.  His second goal is to attract customers by offering them the best in electronics, so he can improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy electrical materials such as cables in assorted sizes and different connectors.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.pt:
Natural  de Vilanculos, povincia de Inhambane ao sul de Mocambique solteira e mãe de 5 filhos de idades entre 11 e 22 anos de idade. Fez a 4ª classe e parou por falta de condicoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a cunhada e o neto que vivem com ela.
Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo com o marido que estava a cumprir o serviço militar obrigatorio, e negociante a mais de 10 anos e tem um rendimento de 7.000.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem sao clientes desta instituiçao e este e os seu quinto emprestimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos de venda (roupas, sapatos, e outros)os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 10.000.00mt,  12.000.00mt, 4.000.00mt, e 8.500.00mt.
texts.en:
Fatima is from Vilanculos in the province of Inhambane in southern Mozambique.  She is a single mother of 5 children who range in age from 11 to 22.  She finished through the fourth grade and stopped due to the lack of financial resources.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports her sister-in-law and grandson who live with her.

She left Inhambane for Maputo with her husband who was fulfilling his mandatory military service. She has had her own business for more than 10 years, and she makes 7,000 meticals per month that she puts towards her home's expenses and also saves some in her bank account at the BIM bank.

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through friends that are also clients of the institution.  This is her fifth loan in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she will use to buy products to sell (clothing, shoes, etc.).  Her previous loans were for:  10,000, 12,000, 4,000, and 8,500 meticals.

loans.use: to buy products to sell (clothing, shoes, etc.)

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse, age 40, is a Rwandan entrepreneur who started a small business some time ago and now it has grown into a general store. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase more items to offer for sale in his shop so he can meet the growing demand of his business. This loan will allow him to buy additional rice, cooking oil, matches, salt, sugar, and tomatoes to sell to his customers.

With the profits from this business, Alphonse hopes to renovate his house and to accumulate savings for himself and his family. He is divorced and has three children between the ages of 20 and 24. His ex-wife is unemployed.

loans.use: to buy such items as rice, cooking oil, matches, salt, sugar, and tomatoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Brenda Jeacqueline

texts.es:
Brenda, se dedica a la venta D. ropa nueva, mochilas escolares y vive con su esposo y tres hijos D. 22, 20 y 18 años D. edad, solamente uno D. sus hijos depenD. D. ella, Brenda inicio el negocio por una amiga quien le enseño a vender, sale D. su vivienda a las 5:00am y regresa a las 3:00pm, este es su horario más normal.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para surtir el negocio, en compra D. ropa como blusas, faldas y mochilas escolares, esta compra le ayudara para mejorar el inventario en su negocio, para ofrecer mayor variedad a los clientes.
Su aspiración es tener un negocio propio, terminar D. pagar las deudas y solventar las necesidades D. su familia.
texts.en:
Brenda sells new clothes and school backpacks.  She lives with her husband and three children who are 22, 20 and 18 years of age.  Only one of her children still depends on her.  Brenda started the business thanks to a girl friend who taught her how to sell.  She leaves home at 5am and returns at 3pm; this is her most normal schedule.

At present, she needs a loan to stock her business buying clothes like blouses and skirts and school backpacks.  This purchase will help her improve inventory in her business to offer greater variety to customers.

Her goal is to have a business of her own, to finish paying off her debts and to meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Tesla Nubia

texts.es: Tesla Nubia, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Rubí, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hijas, y reside en la Colonia 25 de Febrero. Su esposo trabaja como transportista en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa y sus hijas están estudiando. Tesla inició su actividad comercial en el 2002, con una venta de paletas de leche, charamuscas y chocobananos. Con el tiempo vio que le iba bien, así que un año después decidió instalar en una parte de su casa una venta de  productos de la canasta básica y solicito su primer préstamo en FAMA. A Tesla le encantaría poder ampliar el local de su negocio porque es muy pequeño y también poder surtirlo de más y variados productos. Su meta es seguir trabajando cada día para hacer crecer su negocio y de esa manera tener dinero para poder ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la familia y con el pago de los estudios de sus hijas, ya que para ellos es muy importante que se lleguen a realizar como profesionales. El préstamo que solicita lo necesita para comprar un frízer, ya que el que tenía se le daño. Con el apoyo del préstamo podrá comprar un nuevo frízer y ya no perderá de vender, pues hasta ahora lo ha dejado de hacer porque no tiene donde almacenar las carnes y los productos lácteos.  Tesla tiene 36 ciclos en FAMA y hasta la actualidad no ha tenido problemas de pago, y los préstamos recibidos le han ayudado mucho porque ahora ella y su familia tienen un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Tesla Nubia is a member of the Rubí Communal Bank.  She is 39 years old, married and has three daughters.  She lives in the 25 de Febrero neighborhood.  Her husband works in transportation in the city of Tegucigalpa and her children are in school.  Tesla started her business in 2002 by selling milk popsicles, charamusca (flavored ice in a bag), and frozen chocolate-covered bananas.  She saw that she did well over time, so she decided to set up a store in her house a year later to sell basic food items and she requested her first loan with FAMA.  Tesla would love to be able to expand her small place of business, as well as stock it with a variety of products.  Her goal is to continue working each day so that her business will grow and she will have money to help her husband support their family and pay for their daughters’ education, as it is very important for them that they become professionals.  She needs the loan requested to buy a new freezer and not lose sales.  She has stopped selling them for the time being because she doesn’t have a place to store meat and dairy products.  Tesla has completed 36 loan cycles with FAMA and has not had any problems with payment thus far.  The loans she has received have helped her greatly because she and her family now have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a freezer to store meat and dairy products.

loans.name: C13004 Abadahemuka Group

texts.en:
Solange is 37 years old and is married with 15 children. Her business is well-organized and is well known in this business of selling charcoal. Solange is the team leader of this group which is called "ABADAHEMUKA" in the local language. In the picture, Solange is the second person on the left. Her business hours are from 6am until 8pm every day except on the weekend. 

Solange and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their businesses by buying more sacks of charcoal for sale. With any profits, they will reinvest in their businesses and save for their future.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a hardworking business man aged 38. He is married and blessed with four children. For the last five years, he has been operating a motorbike transport business to earn a living. He has another source of income in dairy farming.  In the next five years, he wants to buy a van. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings for servicing his motorbike.

loans.use: To service his motorbike.

loans.name: Cristhian

texts.es:
Cristhian  es un señor de 20 años de edad que vive con su esposa y su hijo en una comunidad llamada Cimarrón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago. Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y la agricultura. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. Cimarrón se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias.

Desde hace varios años que Cristhian ha querido mejorar su lechería, el cuenta en estos momentos con el local para llevar a cabo su actividad, pero le falta lo principal para que su negocio surja, su propósito es vender sus productos a los vecinos de su comunidad. El proyecto le es muy interesante.

Actualmente Cristhian está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢400.000 (cuatrocientos mil colones) para la compra de una vaca. Con esto el espera hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia. 

Cristhian es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Cristhian is a 20 year old man who lives with his wife and his son in a community called Cimarrón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba in the Cartago province. This is a small rural community of approximately two thousand inhabitants. Its people work in milk production and agriculture. The terrain is irregular and much of it is tropical, humid woods. Cimarron is located approximately an hour and a half by bus from Turrialba, the closest shopping center. Of course, at various times throughout the year the road becomes impassable due to the rain.

For several years Cristhian has wanted to improve his dairy.  At this time he has a place to carry out his business activity, but he lacks the capital to develop his business.  His intention is to sell his products to the neighbors in his community.  The project is very interesting to him.

Cristhian is currently requesting a small loan for 400,000 colones in order to buy a cow.  With this he hopes to make his business grow and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Cristhian is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Nuevas Esperanzas for Cimarrón, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan, and with it he hopes to continue growing personally and economically, as well as participating actively in his community's loan organization.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es: En la localidad de Kennedy, Sandra compró un consultorio odontológico, ella está motivada a ser independiente porque requiere pasar mayor tiempo con sus hijos y trabajando para una empresa no lo lograba. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual hará adecuaciones a su infraestructura locativa, quiere cambir la división , comprar canecas para el manejo de residuos y además tener impreso el protocolo que requiere la secretaría de salud para su buen funcionamiento. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que planea su crecimiento poco a poco. En su consultorio ofrece servicios odontologicos a la comunidad que la rodea, espera que prestando un servicio de calidad, a precios atractivos y un servicio de calidez humana logre impactar su clientela objeto y posicionamiento de  este mercado que necesita conquistar.
texts.en:
In the town of Kennedy, Sandra bought a dental practice. She is motivated to become independent because she wants to spend more time with her children and was not able to get a job with a company. Sandra is currently applying for a Kiva loan so that she can make structural renovations, change the room division layout, and buy medical waste bins that have the proper protocol printed on them as required by the health department.

This Kiva loan is her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, the organization that will assist her with her gradual growth. In her office, she provides dental services to the surrounding community. Sandra hopes to provide a quality service, affordable prices, and warm treatment to impact her target audience. This will help her gain position in the market that she needs to conquer.

loans.use: to make structural renovations, change the room division layout of her office, and buy medical waste bins that have the proper protocol printed on them.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a twenty-six-year-old married woman with three school-going children. Her husband Safari is a masonry who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She has a house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Rehema has operated a "queen cake" and porridge-selling business for the past two years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transporting her stock to her place of business. She dreams of establishing a cafe in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour and porridge flour for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it gives good repayment installment periods that are convenient for small-scale business operators.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour and porridge flour for her business.

loans.name: Jocylin

texts.en: Jocylin is 40 years old and is a married woman with four children. They are from one to twenty-two years old. She has been in the business of raising hogs for eight years. Jocylin plans to use her loan to purchase piglets, feed, and vitamins. Each month, Jocylin earns 10,000 PHP with her business. Jocylin hopes for her business to be progressive. She also wishes for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 25 and married with three children between 9 and 2. 

She has been practicing farming in Kitale in Western Kenya for the last two years, producing and selling milk and maize for the local market, and she employs one farmhand. She also runs a grocery business within the local market.

Christine has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a motorcycle for a transport business. She says she wants to use the income from the transport business to expand her farm acreage by buying more land. She adds the new businesses will also improve the living standards of her family.

Christine laments of animal diseases and unreliable rainfall as the major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly de 24 años, convive con Edgar, su pareja, con quien tiene 3 hijos de 8, 6 y 5 años. Esta joven familia vive en la comunidad nativa de San Pablo en el distrito de Pichanaki. Kelly y Edgar, se dedican a la agricultura con la siembra de plátanos en un lote de 15 por 20 metros; y café en otro terreno de la misma magnitud. La cosecha de los plátanos son cada quince días, por ello, kelly es más constante con sus cuidados. Por su parte el café requiere de mayor inversión en abonos y contrata de personal. Así también trabaja en terrenos ajenos como jornalera, ganando de 20 a 25 soles diariamente. “En los días de cosecha me pagan hasta 30 soles, si me conviene esta actividad”, menciona. Sus inicios, en las siembras fueron precoces, por falta de capital para las compras de abonos y semillas. Ahora sus metas son claras, piensa arrendar otros terrenos y expandir sus sembríos mejorando su producción. De esa manera logrará otorgar a sus menores hijos el sustento adecuado. Es la primera vez que Kelly accedería a un crédito de MFP, se muestra ilusionada por la experiencia de pertenecer a su banco comunal, por eso promete ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas y colaboradora. De concretarse el préstamo, destinará el dinero en la contrata de personal para el cultivo de las plantaciones de plátanos. En al limpieza de la mala yerba específicamente.
texts.en:
Kelly is 24 years old and lives with her partner Edgar. They have three children (ages 8, 6, and 5). This young family lives in the native community of San Pablo in the District of Pichanaki. Kelly and Edgar are farmers who grow bananas on a plot of land that is 15 x 20 meters. They grow coffee on another plot of land that is of the same size. The bananas are harvested every 15 days. For this reason, Kelly must constantly monitor her crops. The coffee requires a great investment of fertilizers and manual labor. Kelly also works on other farms as a laborer and earns between 20 and 25 PEN each day. “On harvest days, I get paid 30 PEN if I choose to work during that time,” she mentions. When she started planting crops, Kelly lacked the capital to buy fertilizers and seeds. Now her goals are clear. She plans to rent other plots of land so that she can expand her plantings and improve her production. Working in this manner will help her to provide adequate sustenance for her young children.

This is the first time Kelly has acquired a loan from MFP. She is excited about being part of her Communal Bank. For this reason, she promises to be punctual with her loan payments and cooperate with the other members. Upon receiving this loan, Kelly will use the money to hire workers to maintain her banana crops. Specifically, they will be charged with removing weeds.

loans.use: to hire workers.

loans.name: Silan

texts.en:
Silan, 35, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Silan sells kitchen utensils and her husband is a teacher at the public school. 

Silan is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more kitchen utensils to resell. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income.
 
In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more kitchen utensils to resell.

loans.name: Sichinikhi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sichinikhi Group in Western Kenya! Leah is the facilitator of the Sichinikhi group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Leah takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Leah had a very good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Leah was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Leah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Leah will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sichinikhi group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Leah with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 49 years old and married to Abel. She runs a retail shop, which has been in operation for a period of about 10 years and has a monthly income of about 24,400 Kenyan shillings. 

This is her eighth loan from KADET LTD, after having been introduced to the lending agency by a member of the credit staff. She hopes to increase her business stock with more cereals, which she seems to be running low on. 

She hopes to have a capital base of one million Kenya shillings to supply large scale consumers like schools and give her children a quality education.

loans.use: to buy more cereals for her retail shop.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba sells fabric and cloth in Akotokyire. She has been in this business for 25 years. 

Araba is a single parent and has four children. She feeds, clothes and pays the fees of her children with her income. 

She will use her loan to purchase more fabrics and cloth for sale. With the new profit, Araba will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fabrics for sale.

loans.name: Doria

texts.en: Doria is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. Doria has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Doria has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Doria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is a married woman with 2 children who attend school. Her husband who is employed also contributes to the provision of basic family needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Hidaya has operated a clothes selling business for the past 3 years; her potential clients are the local area ladies. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of female clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of female clothes for resale.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 37-year-old single mother living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She earns a monthly salary with the non-governmental organization Baylor Uganda, which offers services transporting patients to hospitals for quicker treatment. 

Margret complains of a low salary. And because she has to pay a very large single instalment for school fees, her salary alone cannot cover the cost.

Margret has therefore requested a loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice aged 33 years. She is married with four children aged between 3 and 12 years.  2 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 5 years. Also her husband is a farmer and he is the one who stands behind of Mediatrice. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to increase her welfare. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Dorcas wants to buy animal feeds.

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en: Vidadi J. owns a small shop of household items in the small town of Devechi, just south of Khachmaz, located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Vidadi is looking for funding so that he can increase the variety of his inventory in order to attract more customers.

loans.use: To increase Quality and Quantity of store inventory

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio makes backpacks. He began his business after seeing the need to employ himself after being left jobless. At the beginning he made the backpacks by hand and selling them to friends and through his neighborhood. Now he sells the same product as well as school suppplies. He would use the loan to invest in material and to buy an industrial machine so that he could increase his earnings. He has faith that with this loan he will be able to improve his quality of living and will be able to help his business grow. Antonio is 30, married and has 3 children. He is sure that with this loan he will be able to improve his quality of life and be able to save for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Antonio se dedica a la elaboración de mochilas (backpacks). Antonio empezó su negocio viendo la necesidad que tenia ya que se encontraba desempleado. Al principio confeccionaba las mochilas a mano vendiéndolas a sus amistades y por el sector. Ahora vende este mismo producto junto con útiles escolares. El usara este préstamo para invertir en material y poder comprar una maquina industrial y así obtener mejores ingresos. El tiene la fe que con este préstamo mejorara su calidad de vida y tendrá crecimiento en su negocio. Antonio tiene 30 años esta unido y tiene tres hijos el esta seguro que con este préstamo mejorara su calidad de vida y podrá ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: To purchase an industrial machine

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
Business Description

Daysi started her business with her own savings, along with her husband, 9 years ago, and it is located in her home. She works every day of the week from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. The products Daysi sells are rice, oil, meat, chicken, and various vegetables. She indicates to us that her business has helped her get ahead by improving her location, giving it more security. In the area where she lives, you have to be very careful.

Loan Use

Daysi indicates to us that with this loan she will buy more sacks of rice, boxes of oil, and soft drinks, and in this way meet the demand of her customers, which has increased. She indicates that greater investment means greater earning, and this will permit her to keep improving her home, which is already being remodeled.

Personal Information

Daysi has 3 children, 2 of whom are in school. Her home is made of concrete, but it is being improved. Daysi tells us that one difficulty in maintaining her business is other businesses in her area, and she knows that success means having her business well-stocked and providing good service. That's why she is requesting this capital, to continue offering her customers the variety of products they need.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Descripción del Negocio

Daysi inicio su negocio con ahorros propios junto con su esposo hace 9 años y lo tiene ubicado en su domicilio. Atiende a sus clientes todos los días de la semana desde las 6 AM a 22 PM. Los productos que Daysi vende son arroz, azúcar, aceite, carnes, pollos y legumbres varias. Ella nos indica que su negocio le ha permitido salir adelante en adecuar su local dándole mayor seguridad. En la zona donde vive tiene que tener mucho cuidado.

Uso del Préstamo

Daysi nos indica que con el préstamo comprara más quintales de arroz, caja de aceite, colas para de esta manera cumplir la demanda de sus clientes que han aumentado. Nos indica que mayor inversión mayor ganancia y esto le permitirá seguir adecuando su vivienda que aun esta en adecuación.

Información Personal

Daysi tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian. Su vivienda es de cemento, pero aun en adecuaciones. Daysi nos dice que una dificultad es mantener su negocio debido a otros negocios en el sector y sabe que el éxito es tener su negocio bien surtido y dar una buena atención. Razón por lo cual solicita un capital para seguir brindando a sus clientes variedad de productos y que estén al alcance de ellos.

loans.use: Rice, oil, soft drinks, and other products

loans.name: Luavalu

texts.en: Luavalu runs a flea market business selling handicrafts which most of them are woven by her. She is married with 4 kids and hails from the village of Taufusi. She also buy other handicrafts from women in the rural area because it gives her stall more variety for customers to select from. She just joined the Program last month when she needed help for her business. She spends most of her time at her flea market because she believes that selling handicrafts helps her family very much.

loans.use: To buy more stuff for flea market

loans.name: Modesta Hilda

texts.es:
Doña Modesta is 37 years old, comes from a humble yet very hardworking home. Since she was very young she has been involved in several activities such as street sales, crafts, and domestic service as her husband abandoned her with 2 young daughters. She became father and mother, worked very hard and tirelessly to offer them a better life quality and above all, an adequate education.

Because of her effort and dedication she now owns a small candy factory where she receives the inconditional support of her oldest daughter, Mayda.

Her wish is to purchase a device for preparing waffles and a mill to process her varied candies and in that way implement her small factory, located in her humble and warm home. Doña Modesta is asking for $350 to develop this project. The loan will enable her to purchase her working tools, improve the manufacture, and obtain higher economic benefits for her family.

"With your support and generous heart Modesta and her family may prosper with their business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Modesta tiene 37 años, proviene de un hogar humilde pero muy laborioso, desde muy jovencita se dedicó a diversas actividades como el comercio ambulatorio, la artesanía y como empleada del hogar; desde que su esposo la abandonó dejándola sola sin ningún amparo junto a sus 2 hijas menores; se convirtió en padre y madre para ellas, trabajando ardua e incansablemente para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y sobre todo una educación adecuada. Fruto de su esfuerzo y dedicación actualmente cuenta con una pequeña fábrica de dulces, siempre con el apoyo incondicional de su hija mayor Mayda. Su próximo deseo es adquirir una wafflera y un molino para procesar sus variados dulces y así implementar su pequeña fábrica ubicada en su humilde y cálido domicilio para desarrollar este proyecto está solicitando un préstamo de 350 dólares; dinero que le permitirá adquirir sus herramientas de trabajo y así poder desempeñar mejor su labor y obtener mayor beneficio económico para su familia. “Con tu apoyo y tu corazón generoso la familia de Modesta puede prosperar con este negocio”

loans.use: Purchase a device for preparing waffles and a mill to improve candy manufacture

loans.name: Teodolinda

texts.es:
Teodolinda is a courageous woman who works hard to work to prepare her croplands with the goal of obtaining excellent products. Despite her hard work, up until the last year things haven't gone well for . She usually planted potatoes, green beans, olluco (a starchy tuber similar to a potato), wheat, and oats; unfortunately, she didn’t receive the earnings she had hoped for. Now she is working more intensively at raising cows in order to stabilize her family economy, even though she now lives with only one her six children.

Teodolinda wants to get ahead and has as a firm goal of helping her son finish his studies. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy feed and also enough fertilizer to plant a part of her land. Help this woman so that she can continue forward and achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Teodolinda, es una mujer valiente que se esfuerza para labrar y preparar sus tierras de cultivo a fin de obtener excelentes productos, a pesar de su esfuerzo las cosas hasta el año pasado no le ha ido bien, ella acostumbraba sembrar papa, arveja, olluco, trigo y avena pero como desafortunadamente no obtuvo las ganancias que esperaba; ahora se viene dedicando con mayor intensidad a la crianza de vacas para estabilizar su economía a pesar de que ahora sólo vive con uno de sus seis hijos. Teodolinda desea seguir adelante con el firme propósito de ayudar a su hijo con la conclusión de sus estudios y es por ello que solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de forraje y también de abono para sembrar sólo una parte de sus tierras. Apoya a esta mujer para que siga adelante y alcance sus propósitos.

loans.use: To buy feed and also enough fertilizer to plant a part of her land.

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder and his wife Shirley are recently married, and they try to spend a lot of time together, whether it be on their farm or grazing the animals they have. Thanks to the work that they do, they can dedicate themselves to caring for their two-year-old daughter, who is very happy and extroverted. He inherited the work of being a farmer from his father, who taught him the things he had to take into account to grow potatoes and corn and to care for his animals so he could improve his products. Now, with the growth of his plantings, he needs fertilizers so he can have a good harvest. This is why Wilder is requesting a loan, with the objective of investing it in the purchase of products that he needs to obtain excellent products at the end of the season. With your contribution, the harvest for Wilder will be very prosperous.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Wilder y su esposa Shirley son recién casados y tratan de pasar el mayor tiempo juntos ya sea en su chacra o pastando los animales que tienen en casa; gracias a la actividad que tienen pueden dedicarse de cuidar a su hija de dos años quien es muy alegre y extrovertida.La labor de agricultor, la heredó de su padre, quien enseñó a Wilder las cosas que tendría que tomar en cuenta para el cultivo de papa, maíz y hasta los cuidados de sus animales, a fin de que el pueda mejorar sus productos. Ahora con el acrecentamiento de su siembra requiere de fertilizantes y abonos que hacen falta para una buena cosecha.Por esta razón Wilder solicita un préstamo, con el objetivo de invertirlos que invertirlos en la compra de los productos que le hacen falta para obtener excelentes productos al término de la temporada.Con vuestra contribución la cosecha para Wilder será muy próspera.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Saidmurod

texts.ru:
Saidmurod U. is 38 years old, has a professional degree in accounting, is married and has 4 children. Mr. U. works in the regional center for disease control. He also has a plot of land alloted to him by the farmers co-op (kolchoz) on which he plants wheat every year. He has 15 years experience with growing wheat. He is planning to use this loan to purchase wheat seeds to plant his land. After the harvest he will keep some of the grain for milling into flour and baking bread, while he will sell the rest to the local residents at a price below the market value. Local residents will be able to purchase wheat for making flour. Mr. U. is planning to pay back his loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Умаров Саидмурод, возраст – 38 лет, образование – средне-специальное, по специальности бухгалтер, женат, имеет 4 детей. Саидмурод работает в Районом центре по санитарно-эпидемическому контролю. Также он имеет участок земли выделенный ему колхозом, на которм каждый год сеет пшеницу, его опыт в этом виде деятельности 15 лет. На поолученный кредит он планирует приобрести семена пшеницы для засева земельного участка. После получения урожая, часть его он оставит для производства муки и выпечки хлеба, а другую часть реализует местным жителям по цене ниже рыночной. Местные жители будут иметь возможность приобрести пшеницу для производства муки. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of wheat seeds

loans.name: Kayi Adakou Dovi

texts.fr:
Born in 1960, Madame Kayi Adakou Dovi is married and responsible for supporting four people in her family. To make money, she sells various products ranging from soaps, plastic objects, traditional style skirts, and jewelry. With her meager finances, she was able to start this small business, but needs a loan to help augment her store and to better satisfy her customers. To do this, she would like to buy a large quantity of items in order to attract more customers. The funds from the loan will permit her to increase her revenue and finance other products on request from customers. This will also allow her to improve the standard of living of her family and above all, aid and improve the education of her children.

Translation from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née en 1960, Madame K. Dovi Adakou Kayi est mariée et supporte quatre (4) personnes. Elle a pour activité la vente des produits divers (savons, objets plastiques, pagnes, bijoux) avec ses maigres moyens financiers. Pour mieux satisfaire ses clients, elle sollicite un financement qui lui servira d’agrandir la taille de son commerce en achetant en grande quantité ses articles pour plus attirer la clientèle. Ce fonds lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus et refinancer d’autres produits selon la demande des clients. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille surtout l’éducation de ses enfants

loans.use: To purchase and sell plastic objects and other miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
By making her clothing products with great care and dedication, Judith's work has become in demand by the different education centers and the general public for uniforms and diverse clothing articles. She wishes to improve the quality of her sewing materials and set up her small shop to better serve her clients, and is requesting the loan to fulfill these goals.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Por su dedicación y esmero en la elaboración e prendas de vestir Judith es muy solicitada por los diferentes centros de estudios y publico en general para la confección de uniformes y diversas prendas.Desea incrementar la cantidad de materia prima para la confección de las prendas que le solicitan y condicionar su pequeño taller para mejor estadía de sus clientes durante sus peticiones.

loans.use: Improve her sewing shop and purchase higher quality supplies / Acondicionamiento del pequeño taller y compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima.

loans.name: Safarmo

texts.ru:
Safarmo D. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 42 years old, married and has three children. She has secondary education. She does not hold a job, but has her own piece of land which she sows with potato and other vegetables. As the sowing season has arrived, it's now time to plant potatoes, cabbage, cucumbers and tomatoes. Safarmo's family is also helping her. They work in the early morning before the sunrise and after dusk into the late night. Safarmo has a little trouble with finances at this time and this is why she turned for help. She needs a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Давлатова Сафармо живет в городе Вахдат. Возраст 42 года , замужем и имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Нигде не работает , но имеет землю, которую засеивает картофелем и другими овощами. Посевной сезон наступил, пришло время сеить картошку , капусту , огурцы и помидоры. Но занимается она не одна , ей помогает ее семья. Утром пока солнце не взошло высоко ,они на земле и вечером до ночи они все вместе работают. Сейчас Сафармо имеет небольшие проблемы с финансами, поэтомуона обратилась к нам за помощью. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить семена и удобрения. Погасить кредит она планируетв течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato seeds

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30 year-old Rachel S., who is married and has four children aged between 2 and 9. In 2005, Rachel established her poultry business and now requires a loan in order to purchase additional chicks, feed, and antibiotics. She thanks you for your support.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku, which is Swahili for 'chickens.' Raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiple naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons that raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks, feed, and antibiotics.

loans.name: Yanixia María

texts.es:
Ms. Yanixia S. is from Chinandega. She has been selling used clothing at the El Bisne market for 2 years. She has managed to improve her business space thanks to her efforts. Furthermore, she has also managed to cover the household expenses.

Ceprodel has been a pillar in the development of her business because the institution has provided her with loans that have improved it. It is important to note that she is now requesting a loan so that she can purchase clothing from her suppliers, thus allowing her to continue maintaining her household, which so needs her support to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Yanixia es originaria del departamento de Chinandega y labora en el Mercado El Bisne en su negocio de venta de ropa usada la cual posee desde hace 2 años. Ha logrado mejorar su local gracias a sus esfuerzos y además ha logrado llevar el sustento a su hogar de habitación.

Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en su desarrollo por lo que le ha proporcionado créditos para el mejoramiento de su negocio. Es necesario destacar que hoy en día solicita un crédito para comprar su mercadería a sus proveedores y así continuar manteniendo su hogar que tanto necesita de su apoyo para salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
The group “La Esperanza” (Hope) has been established for 1 year and 2 months. The group members participate in a program called Committee of Women Entrepreneurs which brings women together to carry out profitable work with the goal of increasing income and alleviating poverty.

In our country the majority of women are in charge of family finances. In addition to seeing to the education of their children, they also hold an extra job to help with household expenses.

The women belonging to this group devote themselves to various income-producing activities. They are using the loan to buy more merchandise, in some cases, or in the case of dressmakers and food vendors, to buy supplies for the manufacture of the products they sell.
