The majority of the women yearn for a better future for their children and therefore redouble their efforts to increase their income so that they will be able to offer their children the chance to study and to have better job possibilities in the future.

Today these women are asking to renew their loan in order to obtain clothes, shoes, cosmetics, fabric, thread, and cleaning products as well as food items such as meat, dairy products, fruits, vegetables, soft drinks, snacks, oil, flour, noodles, etc.

Translated by Melissa Hays, Kiva volunteer.

El comité “La Esperanza” tiene1 año y 2 meses de formación, ellas participan de un programa llamado “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras” que agrupa a mujeres que realizan una labor lucrativa con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y aliviar la pobreza.

En nuestro país la mayoría de las mujeres son las encargadas de la economía de la familia, además de atender y velar por la educación de los hijos, las mujeres también poseen un trabajo extra con el que ayudan con los ingresos de la casa.

Las señoras pertenecientes a este comité se dedican a diversas actividades productivas y utilizan el préstamo para comprar más mercaderías, en algunos casos, o insumos para la elaboración de los productos que venden como en el caso de las modistas o las señoras que venden comidas.

La mayoría de las mujeres anhela un futuro mejor para sus hijos por eso se esfuerzan el doble para generar mas ingresos y poder brindarles posibilidades de estudiar y lograr que el día de mañana mejores oportunidades laborales.

Hoy ellas solicitan un nuevo crédito con el que podrán adquirir ropas, calzados, maquillajes, telas, hilos, productos de limpieza al igual que comestibles como carnes, lácteos, frutas, verduras, gaseosas, golosinas, aceite, harina, fideos, etc.

loans.use: To obtain clothes, shoes, cosmetics, fabric, thread, and cleaning products as well as food items such as meat, dairy products, fruits, vegetables, soft drinks, snacks, oil, flour, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Guzmán is requesting a loan from Kiva in order to construct a protective wall around her house because her son and three grandchildren live with her, and the children are not well-protected. 
Mrs. Guzmán works, and her son helps with the household expenses. However, she currently does not have the funds needed for the project, which is why she now turns to the microfinance institute for help. She previously received a loan from FVP and promptly repaid it. 
 Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.
La Sra. Maria Guzmán es solicitando un préstamo a Kiva para la elaboración de una barda alrededor de su casa ya que con ella vive su hijo y tres nietos y no esta bien protegida para los niños.
La Sra. Guzmán trabajo y también su hijo le ayudan con los gastos de la  casa, por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder hacer la mejora que desea es por eso que acudió a las oficinas ya que a sido acreditad de FVP y pago puntualmente.

loans.use: Construct protective wall around house

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Gutiérrez Sánchez nació en Calamarca provincia de Julcán hace 42 años  y vive en el Pasaje San Luis Manzana Q lote 23 Semirustica el Bosque.
Carmen estudió primaria completa pero no pudo seguir estudiando porque quedó huérfana de padre a muy temprana edad.
Se separó de su esposo hace siete años y tiene de él siete hijos, actualmente dependen de ella solamente dos.
Su negocio funciona en su misma casa y también reparte mercancía a domicilio, vende papa, carne, queso, menestras. 
Con el primer préstamo que obtuvo de Manuela Ramos, de 300 soles, compró en Calamarca 315 kilogramos de papa que trajo a venderlas a  Trujillo. Ella comenta que Manuela Ramos la ha ayudado en su vida porque pudo adquirir un capital para poder depender de ella misma y poder trabajar dice  también que los temas que se tratan en las reuniones la hacen reflexionar y la ayudan para seguir adelante.
Con este préstamo de S/  1,100 soles, el mismo que cancelará en 4 cuotas, comprará 12 cajas de cerveza y 20 paquetes de gaseosa para venderlos en Calamarca y con ese capital comprar  630 kilos de papa, 2 arrobas de ñuña, 3 arrobas de maíz.
Carmen sueña con el día en que tendrá una casa grande y bonita. Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal Trabajo y Amor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen G. S. was born in Calamarca, in Julcán province 42 years ago. She currently lives on San Luis Passage on Q Block, Plot 23 in Semi-Country El Bosque. Carmen completed primary school, but could not continue her studies because her father died when she was very young. She and her husband separated seven years ago. They have seven children together, of whom only two are still dependents. She sells potatoes, meat, cheese and vegetable stews from her home; she also does home deliveries.

With this loan of 1,100 soles, which she will repay in four installments, she will buy 12 boxes of beer and 20 packs of soda, which she will sell in Calamarca. With those earnings, she will buy 630 kilos of potatoes, 50 pounds of nuna beans, and 75 pounds of corn.

Carmen dreams of the day when she will have a big, beautiful house. She belongs to the Trabajo y Amor Communal Bank (a group loan).

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beer and soda

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 54 años, vive con su esposo Hugo de 43 años, el cual es triciclista y sus dos hijos; Soledad de 18 y Anisa de 13. Se dedica a la atención de su mini billar, el cual es muy frecuentado por los jóvenes de la ciudad de Juliaca, negocio que atiende desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 u 8 de la noche, dependiendo de la clientela que a veces suele quedarse mucho más tarde, haciendo que Margarita tenga que esperar a que terminen su juego y retirándose a altas horas de la noche, luchando con el imperante frío de la ciudad. Por otra parte, la tranquilidad de su trabajo hace que éste le guste, ya que no tiene que hacer ningún tipo de esfuerzo físico, que su edad y su salud no se lo permiten.  Margarita quiere que su familia sea feliz y que la preocupación económica no sea un problema para sus deseos personales. Con el dinero del préstamo quiere refaccionar su mesa de billar, la cual está un poco desgastada. En el futuro, quiere tener muchas más mesas y un local fijo para la atención de su billar.
texts.en:
Margarita is 54 years old, lives with her 43 year old husband Hugo, a cyclist, and her two children: Soledad, 18 years old, and Anisa, 13 years old. She makes a living by offering small billiards games, visited by many young people in the city of Juliaca. Her business is open from 8 in the morning to 7 or 8 at night, depending on the clientele that sometimes stays late, making Margarita hope for the games to end so she can go to bed in the late hours of the night, while fighting the prevailing coldness of the city. On the other hand, the ease of her job is why she likes it: she does not have to make any physical effort that her age and health would not permit her. Margarita’s personal wishes are for her family to be happy and for economic worries to not be a problem. With the money from the loan, she would like to remodel the billiards table, which is a little worn out. In the future, she wants to have a lot of tables and a location that specializes in billiards.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel her billiards table that she rents for games

loans.name: Merli Estrella

texts.es:
La señora Merli pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Solteritas, ubicado en el Jr. Grau Nº 192, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 34 años de edad y es soltera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de manualidades. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad es profesora de Educación Inicial y cuenta con el mismo  negocio. En las mañanas trabaja como decente y por las tardes confecciona sus manualidades.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 10 metros de corrospú, 6 latas de terocal, un ciento de cartulinas, etc.

Merli manifiesta que todos sus logros es gracias a su esfuerzo y voluntad. Agradece a Dios por todo lo bueno que le ha pasado en la vida.
texts.en:
Merli belongs to the Community Bank "Las Solteritas" located in Jr. Grau No. 192 in the district Calleria within the province of Coronel Portillo in Ucayali. She is 34 years old and she is single. With the first loan received from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 she decided to invest in the sale of craft. She has been with the Community Bank for the past 2 years.

With this loan, amounting to S/.1000, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase 10 metres of craft foam, 6 cans of glue, 100 sheets of construction paper, etc.

Merli says that all of her accomplishments are thanks to her efforts and will power. She thanks God for all the good that has come to her life.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 10 metres of craft foam, 6 cans of glue, and 100 sheets of construction paper, etc.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthorn L., 21, and her husband, Mr. Nak Chum, 24, live in a small village across Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. The couple has been married for 6 months and they live with Chanthorn’s mother. 

Chanthorn has been a silk weaver for 5 years, a skill she learned from a neighbor. She sells her finished product to a middleman, who brings it to Phnom Penh to sell. Her husband has been raising pigs and producing rice wine for 4 years. Chanthorn is requesting for a loan of $1000 to purchase more pigs for her husband to raise.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Chadulu G Group

texts.en:
Neema owns a small food shop in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma. She currently earns an average monthly profit of 60 USD. Every day she works for 6 hours in her business. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and to save money.

Neema is 40 years old, married, has four children between the ages of four and 18. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Olipa, Tatu, and Frola. Each woman also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
La señora Hilaria es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco”, en el sector cuatro, comunidad D. Sucano, distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 47 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene tres hijos, asimismo posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (cuarto D. primaria).
Trabaja desD. hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, posee un negocio D. compra y venta D. quesos y venta D. cereales en las ferias D. Pilcuyo, Acora y en los mercados D. Tacna; su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que destinó a la venta D. sus productos en la feria D. El Altipano en Tacna.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles le servirá como capital para poder adquirir ganado vacuno para engorD., y comprar quesos para llevarlos a los mercados D. Tacna y Arequipa. Asimismo ella piensa comprar Chuño, Papa entre otros y venderlos en los mercados D. Tacna los días domingos, las ganancias D. su múltiple negocio lo viene invirtiendo en el sustento diario y la educación D. sus hijos; se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Hilaria is a member of the Las Brisas del Rio Blanco community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Puno. She is 47 years old, married and the mother of three children. Her schooling was cut short and she only completed four years of elementary school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for three years. She operates a business buying and selling cheese and selling grains at markets in Pilcuyo, Acora and Tacna. Her first loan was for S/.300 [300 Peruvian soles], a sum she used to sell her products at the El Altipano market in Tacna. This S/.3000 loan will be used to buy cattle which she will fatten and cheese that she will take to the markets in Tacna and Arequipa. She is also thinking of buying "chuno" and potatoes, among other things, and selling them in the Tacna market on Sundays. The earnings from her multiple businesses will be used for day-to-day needs and her children's schooling. She is committed to repaying the loan promptly in five monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cattle for fattening and cheese to resell.

loans.name: Soeurng

texts.en:
K. is 46 years old and a resident of Battambong Province. She is a mother of five children; three of them are attending school and the other two are still young. She is married to Pâk, 47, who is a bicycle and motorbike repairer.

K. is a vegetable seller selling potatoes, cucumbers, salad, etc. since 2006. Her business is located in a busy market; hence, K. can earn a good profit from her business. With her very old motorbike, K. gathers her products from the vegetable planters for a bargained price and stores them in her house for her to sell at the market. K. is applying for a loan of $500 to buy a motor to replace the old one and to buy more vegetables for her store. She dreams of having a good living and house, and degrees for her children.

loans.use: To buy a motor to replace the old one and to buy more vegetables for her store

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia T. owns a small parcel of land. She uses it to plant rice to support her family. Her husband, Larry T., is the one who manages the farm. To ensure a better yield, they check their farm every day; they remove the weeds and watch so the birds do not eat the rice. She is 36 years old and has three children who are students. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and herbicides. The loan will truly help her have a better yield. She is also interested in looking for some other line of business to augment their income. In that way, she believes, she could well support the needs of her children.

CEVI helps her sustain her business. Now she enjoys having credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: El señor Juan Francisco
texts.en: Mr. Juan Francisco

loans.use: Putting up a fence in front of their house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Khim C. is 29 years old and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. To earn a living, she sells groceries, roast beef, and corn. She typically makes $3 every day. Her husband sells mats and hammocks to earn approximately $6 per day. This couple has two young children and one of them is in school.

Khim C. is asking for a loan to purchase more mats and hammocks for her husband to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more mats and hammocks.

loans.name: Sebastiana Petrona

texts.es: Doña Sebastiana con residencia en la aldea de Nimasac Totonicapán  casada con sesis hijos ella tiene su pequeña tienda de consumo diario, servico de fotocopiadora,  molino de nixtamal con los ingreso que ha obtenido ha dado de comer a sus hijos ser persona profesionales y empresarios, visita las oficina de Asdir en donde solicita  un credito que lo invertira en la compra de articulos de consumo diario, papel para la fotocopiadora, hasta fecha aumentado la demanda de los producto, ya que se encuentra una escuela, cerca de la tienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sebastiana resides in the small village of Nimasac Totonicapán and is married with six children. She has a small store of daily items, photocopy services, and the grinding of hominy. With the income she has generated she has fed her children and is a professional, enterprising person. She visits the office of Asdir to ask for a loan that she will invest in the purchase of daily consumed articles and paper for the photocopier as there is increasing demand for copies since there is a school near the store.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of products

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
 Шаходат Чалолова имеет 12 летний стаж работы в сфере предпринимательской деятельности. Она очень приветливая женщина, в общении со своими клиентами вежлива. Шаходат замужем, и имеет 3 детей. старший сын женат, он работает таксистом, дочь вышла замуж и воспитывает детей. А младший сын Фариддун студент 3 курса университета. Фариддун и его отец помогают Шаходат в бизнесе. Она торгует хозяйственными товарами, необходимыми для дома и семьи.
 Сначала Шаходат привозила свой товар из Кыргызстана и продавала его оптом. Затем она покупала свой товар у поставщиков, которые привозили его из Китая. Сейчас, Шаходат планирует получить кредит и самой ездить в Китай за товаром. Привезенный товар она будет продовать оптом и в розницу. 
 Товар Шаходат подлежит продаже семь дней в неделю.
texts.en:
Shahodat C. has been an entrepreneur for 12 years. She is a very friendly woman and courteous with her clients. Shahodat is married and has 3 children. Her oldest son is married and works as a taxi driver. Shahodat’s daughter is married and raises children. Shahodat’s youngest son, Fariddun, is a third-year university student. Fariddun and his father help Shahodat with the business. She sells household products. Shahodat first brought her merchandise from Kyrgyzstan and sold it wholesale. Then, she bought the merchandise from suppliers, who brought the goods from China. Now, Shahodat plans to obtain a loan and bring merchandise from China on her own. She would sell the goods both wholesale and retail. Shahodat sells her products seven days a week.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase household products from China

loans.name: Levie

texts.en:
Levie A. is from the village of Nabbotuan Solana, Cagayan. She is married to Ricardo and they have three children, all enrolled in a public school in their community. Despite the difficulties of their life, the couple still manage to send their children to school to finish a degree course, which will someday help them get a good job for their future.

Levie runs a hog raising business, which she wants to grow progressively with help from a PHP11, 000 loan from Kiva lenders. The loan will not only assist her in improving her hog raising business but also in sending her children to school, providing them with enough school allowance and tuition fees. She believes that she will always be able to overcome the trials that her family encounters.

loans.use: Business capital to grow her hog raising business

loans.name: Pick

texts.en:
Pick O. is a 50-year-old woman with insufficient capital who lives in Takmao District in Phnom Penh City. She is currently working as internal cleaning staff for a company while her husband works in building wooden houses. The family is blessed with seven children, five of whom are working in different jobs: three are garment workers and two are in construction.

Pick O. finds it hard travelling to work or anywhere else, because she doesn’t have her own vehicle for her and her family’s traveling needs. Therefore, she would like a loan of $600 to buy a second-hand motorcycle for transportation purposes.

Pick O. was not available for the photograph, so her husband is shown in the photo instead.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle for family transportation needs

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 92659&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Inés es socia del Bancomunal  Unidas Triunfaremos.
Inés  tiene una pequeña bodega “Diana” ella atiende todo el día, ahora en su negocio vende helados  la empresa  de Donófrio le ha puesto un congelador, y aun que ahora estamos en invierno vende helados.
Los préstamos le han ayudado  a surtir su bodega y tener un capital tiene  un poco más surtida su bodega.   
Inés necesita un préstamo de 2200 soles, para la compra de saco de arroz azúcar  y  aceite, 
El sueño de Inés es que su negocio crezca cada día, tener mas ventas; que su  hijo el menor estudie una carrera que  sea un profesional, por que los demás no quisieron estudiar.
texts.en:
Inés is a member of the Village Bank Unidas Triunfaremos (United We Triumph).

Inés has a small store "Diana" which she tends to all day. Right now her business sells Donófrio brand ice cream which gave her a freezer. Even in the winter she is able to sell ice cream.

This loan will help her stock her store and give her the capital to keep a better stocked store. Inés needs a loan of 2200 soles in order to buy rice, sugar, and oil.

Inés's dream is that her business grows daily and she has more sales and that her youngest song can study for a career as a professional since her other children did not want to study.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Cora

texts.en:
Cora D. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Cora is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Cora owns and operates a business venture raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, her main source of income from the business is from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables. Cora has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cora is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cora from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: Marta Lidia A. G. reside en el municipio de Ciudad Arce en departamento de La Libertad. Marta de 52 años de edad, es madre soltera y una decidida emprendedora. Sin ninguna educación formal, Marta Lidia, maneja un negocio de tienda de abarrotes que ubicó en su propia casa. Actualmente Marta solicita un préstamo para comprar nueva mercadería y productos, para asegurarse a si misma y a su hijo un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Marta Lidia A. G. lives in the town of Ciudad Arce in the district of La Libertad. She is 52 years old, a single mother, and a determined businesswoman. Without any formal education, Marta Lidia has managed her own grocery store out of her own home.

She is requesting a loan to buy new goods and products so that she can secure a better future for herself and her child.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 41-year-old single mother of three children aged between 11 and 14 years.  All her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. Margaret resides in and owns a one-roomed house where she lives with six people. There is electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Margaret resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She works seven days a week making and selling envelopes in Mengo. She buys her raw materials from shops on Nkrumah Road and in Kampala city shops. She uses public transport to and from work.

Margaret has been with MCDT for five years and is servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials like paper and glue.

loans.use: To buy more paper and glue to make envelopes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: uso personal.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 43 years old and married with a 12-year-old daughter named Tracey. She has been running a grocery store for two years. She sells melons, pawpaw, oranges, onions, potatoes, tomatoes, garlic and other fruits and vegetables. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 40,000 to buy onions and a scale. 

Her dream is to travel through East Africa and become a wholesale supplier. She describes herself as hardworking, responsible, and dependable. 

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy onions and a scale.

loans.name: Melissa Rosario

texts.es:
La socia Melissa, pertenece al banco “ALLIN MUJU”; este banco se encuentra en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de Huanchac.

Nuestra socia tiene 27 años de edad, ella es soltera, nuestra socia alterna sus diversas actividades con el trabajo de limpieza en una agencia de viajes, ella va a hacer la limpieza general de esta empresa y sus sucursales, nuestra socia también desea estudiar turismo, por lo que solicita el préstamo para su primer pago del curso 

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Melissa belongs to the Allin Muju communal bank, which is in the city of Cuscu in the Huanchac district. She is 27 and single. She alternates her diverse activities. She does cleaning work for a travel agency. She is going to do general cleaning for this business and its branches. She also wants to study tourism. That is why she is asking for the loan; it is for the first payment of the course. She is grateful for and values the loan granted through this medium. By the same token, she promises to make all of her payments on the established timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for an educational course

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika O. M., tiene la edad de 21 años, es soltera, y no tiene hijos. Ella todavia vive con su familia, ayudando con la finca. Ella quiere comprar abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la finca. Con el crédito, el año que viene el cosecha sería mejor. Su familia siempre ha tenido cafe pero tambien trabajan en ganadería. Su familia no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una finca productiva. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Ella también tiene el deseo para tratar de tener un buen futuro para la familia. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Erika O. M. is 21 years of age, single and has no children. She still lives with her family, helping them with the farm. She wants to buy nutrients and fertilizers to improve the farm. With the loan, the coming year's harvest would be better. Her family has always had coffee but they are also raising livestock. Her family has not had problems with their property but they want it to be a productive farm. This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. The FUDECOSUR loan was more easily obtained and the interest rate is much lower. Erika also wants to try to have a good future for her family. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutrients and fertilizers.

loans.name: Kyegwisa Bakyara Group, Ibanda

texts.en: Ovia K. is 35 years old and married with 5 children all in primary and secondary schools. She has had a retail shop in the Kyegwisa trading centre for 10 years. Ovia needs a loan to be able to buy more sugar, cooking oil, paraffin, maize flourand bread to expand her shop and make more profit.  In the future, Ovia hopes to develop the shop into a wholesale enterprise as well as have all her children educated at the University.

loans.use: Buying more sugar, cooking oil, paraffin, maize flour, bread for her shop

loans.name: Coumba Laye

texts.fr:
Madame Coumba  Laye G. est une parente bénéficiaire  de 28 ans  soucieuse d’exercer une activité  génératrice  de revenu. Ainsi  elle s’est orientée  vers la vente de produits cosmétiques depuis 3 ans. Elle est mariée  et mère  de 2 enfants. Les  bénéfices  réalises  lui permettent d’assurer pour une partie du temps la dépense  quotidienne Elle  est sociétaire  de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis octobre 2007Elle habite dans la localité  de Camberene. Elle  sollicite sollicite  un crédit  de 150 000 frs pour accroitre son stock de produits cosmétiques .
Madame G. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs
texts.en:
Ms. Coumba Laye G., aged 28, is a recipient parent who wanted to operate an income-generating business.  And so she turned toward selling cosmetics three years ago. She is married and the mother of two children.  The profits realized are enabling her for part of the time to cover everyday expenses.  She has been a member of the U-IMCEC bank since October 2007.  She lives in the town of Camberene.  She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to increase her inventory of cosmetic products.  Ms. G. is a beneficiary of the agreement between U-IMCEC and the Seydina Issa Laye PDEF (Programme de développement de l'infant et de la famille), a development program for children and families. The PDEF seeks to reduce poverty within the community and especially to protect children who come from destitute families. Thanks to this cooperation, the parents of these children can take advantage of loans having more flexible terms compared to ordinary loans. Since the agreement’s start in December 2008, there have been 120 parents who received financing in amounts varying from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Augmenting funds

loans.name: María Ofelia

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, muy esforzadamente se dedica a laborar la señora María Ofelia llevando a cabo su actividad de elaboración y venta de tortillas las que son ofrecidas en el mercado a diario desde tempranas horas de la mañana.

Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 14 años y se ha apoyado de Ceprodel para obtener la materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas. Hoy en día solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de maíz y leña y es por esta razón que espera que su crédito le sea otorgado satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
María Ofelia has made and sold tortillas in Managua's Wholesale market for 14 years. Her daily work schedule starts very early in the morning. She has relied on Ceprodel to get raw materials needed in tortilla-making. She currently needs funding to buy corn and firewood so she hopes that her loan request will be granted.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 23 years old and has been operating his motorbike as a taxi for the last two years in the Mukilit area, which is on the outskirts of Naivasha town.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to buy a new motorcycle with the proceeds from the loan.  He will employ someone to run the old bike for him hence increasing his income base.

His future hopes are to buy a lorry which will be used to transport food stuff from the area to the nearby Naivasha market.  Mukulit is a very productive agricultural area and he knows that with a lorry he will have a booming business.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Abdulkhay

texts.ru: Темиров Абдулхай проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 31 год. Женат, детей не имеет. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Абдулхай более 11 лет занимается торговлей. Он продает каляски и детские кровати, колыбельнии. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота, т.е. увеличение ассортимента своего товара.
texts.en:
Abdulkhay T. lives close to Vahdat, Tajikistan. He is thirty-one years old, married with no children. His wife is a homemaker. He has been in sales for over eleven years. He sells strollers and cribs. He is asking for a loan to increase sales and expand the variety of products offered.

Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Mrs. Oeung Soung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has 12 people, who all live in Prasat village in Kandal province. Mrs. Oeung S. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members; they will use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate for supporting her family, while her husband, Mr. Oeurn Neum, is motorbike taxi driver and also a chef. 

With the rice field, this family has a problem because their field has infertile soil. Thus, in order to improve and have productive rice, Mrs. Oeung S. decided to ask for a loan to bU. fertilizers to increase the rice yield. She is the mother of a child who is a worker in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Paulita Cándida

texts.es:
La señora  Paulita Cándida F. E., tiene la edad de 75 años, vive en el Barrio La Gloria, es casada y su esposo es contador,  tienen 3 hijos adultos y de estado civil casados, ellos tienen una pulpería desde hace 4 años, la cual es su fuente principal de ingresos.

Ella logro la apertura de su negocio, gracias al apoyo de su esposo, por lo cual ahora solicita de un préstamo,  para suplir el inventario del negocio en la compra de abarrotes, cosméticos y artículos de variedad, esto les permitiría, mejores condiciones económicas, e ingresos necesarios para la inversión a nuevas fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
Sra. Paulita Cándida F. E. is 75 years old, married, and lives in the neighborhood of La Gloria. Her husband is an accountant. They have three adult children who are married. For the past four years, Paulita has been managing a store that serves as her main source of income.

She managed to open her business with the support of her husband. Paulita is now requesting a loan to restock her inventory. She plans to buy groceries, cosmetics, and a variety of other items that will allow her to improve her financial condition and generate the necessary income to invest in new sources of work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries, cosmetics, and variety of other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase and sale of pagnes and headscarves

loans.name: Osmonova Group

texts.ru:
Осмонова Зилолахон: ей 33 года. Ее супруг находится на заработках в РФ. У нее 2 детей, дочери 7 лет, сыну 5 лет. В настоящее время готовит землю к посеву хлопчатника. Также клиентка работает медсестрой в поликлинике. На этот кредит она планирует закупить семена хлопчатника и минеральные удобрения. В будущем Зилолахон планирует обучить детей в ВУЗах, отремонтировать дом и построить аптеку рядом с домом.

Улугбек, 29, женат. Супруга частная швея, занимается пошивом женских одежд и штор на заказ. Мать клиента пенсионерка получает пенсию 1300 (USD 30)сом. Отец находится на заработках в РФ, работает строителем. Улугбек подготавливает землю к посеву семян хлопчатника и занимается обработкой земли. Параллельно занимается представлением услуг общественного питания (готовит самсы, плов). На кредит планирует закупить семена хлопчатника и духовку для столовой (для выпечки и реализации самсы).

Нодирахон, 21, замужем. Супруг занимается выпечкой и реализацией лепешек на дому. В настоящее время она занимается обработкой земли для посева семян хлопчатника. 3 года назад, клиентка посадила картофель получила хороший урожай, и таким образом была заинтересована в дальнейшем развитии бизнесе.'На кредит планирует закупить семена хлопчатника и закупить муку для выпечки и реализации лепешек.
 
Якутой, 46, вдова. У нее 3 детей, дочерям 23 и 18 лет, сыну 25 лет. Дочка Ёркиной является членом крестянского хозяйства, младшая дочь практикует в районной больнице, невестка помощница в бизнесе, сын на заработках в РФ.Сейчас клиент активно занимается пошивом и реализацией национальных изделий и женских платьев.  Она планирует закупит ткань для пошива женских одежд и национальных изделий.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Zilolahon O. is 33. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. Zilolahon has 2 children: a 7 years old daughter and a 5 years old son. At present, Zilolahon prepares to sowing cotton. She also works as a nurse at an outpatient clinic. This loan Zilolahon will use to purchase cotton seeds and fertilizer. In the future Zilolahon plans to send her children to college, repair her house, and build a pharmacy near her home. Ulugbek, 29, is married. His wife is a seamstress specializing in custom-made clothing for women and curtains. Ulugbek's mother is a retiree with a pension of 1,300 som ($30). His father is a migrant construction worker in Russia. Ulugbek is a cotton farmer. He also prepares food for sale (pilaf and samsa). This loan Ulugbek will use to purchase cotton seeds and a stove for his commercial kitchen (to bake samsa). Nodirahon, 21, is married. Her husband bakes and sells lavash bread. Three years ago, Nodirahon grew potatoes and had a good harvest inspiring her to develop her farming business. Now, Nodirahon grows cotton. This Nodirahon will use to purchase cotton seeds and flour to bake lavash bread. Yakutoy, 46, is a widow. She has 3 children: 23- and 18-year-old daughters and 25 years old son. Yakutoy's older daughter is a member of a farming cooperative, the younger one works in a regional hospital, her son is a migrant worker in Russia, and Yakutoy's daughter-in-law helps her with the business. Yakutoy makes national clothing and other items. She plans to purchase fabric for her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cotton seeds, fertilizer, flour, and fabric

loans.name: Chidima

texts.en: Chidima sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business since 5 years. She is a LAPO client and she has a good repayment record. She is 40 years old, married with 6 children. Her children are doing well at school and this gives her joy as a mother. Her husband also works to support their home. She is very determined and wants to expand her business in order to make more profits. She requesting for a loan of NGN 120,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: El Cielo Group

texts.es:
Benicia Victoria, Karla Vanessa y Katia Lucia conforman el grupo el Cielo. 

Benicia Victoria, coordinadora del grupo desde hace diecinueve años instalo una pequeña venta la cual con el tiempo ha ido creciendo hasta transformarla en una pulpería. Esta señora de 56 años casada con Antonio, agricultor con el cual tiene tres hijos de 21, 24 y de la niña como ellos le dicen a su hija con síndrome de Down.

Las otras dos integrantes son Katia Lucia quien comercializa cosméticos de la marca de la Avon y Zermat y Karla Vanesa de 27 años de edad quien es desde muy joven empezó a trabajar en la rama de la belleza y estilismo y hace seis meses pudo instalar su propia sala de belleza.
 
Todas ellas necesitan contar con una reinversión para sus negocios ya sea en la compra de productos básicos como es el caso de la coordinadora o en la adquisición cosméticos, perfumes y cremas de las otras dos integrantes.
texts.en:
Benicia Victoria, Katia Lucia and Karla Vanesa are members of the El Cielo group. Benicia Victoria is the coordinator of the group: she has been running a small selling business for 19 years, a business that has grown in time up to become a general store. This 56 year-old lady is married with Antonio, a farmer, and they have three children, aged 21, 24 and a daughter with Down syndrome they call the baby. The other two members are Katia Lucia, who sells Avon and Zermat cosmetics, and Karla Vanesa, a 24 year-old woman who started working in the beauty and fashion designing business since she was very young, and who was able to open her own beauty salon 6 months ago. They all need to count on a loan for their business: the coordinator in order to buy core products, the other two members to purchase cosmetics, perfumes and creams.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different core products

loans.name: Alcira

texts.es: Alcira, de 42 años, esta casada con Belarmino (52), ambos tienen 2 hijos, pero sólo viven con uno, en la casa de un familiar. A unos kilómetros de donde vive, tiene una casa que es propia, que habitará muy pronto.Desde hace 18 años, siembra diferentes flores y maíz, junto a su esposo y su hijo. Durante  fechas festivas comercializa sus productos. Y para transportar su mercadería contrata un auto para trasladar sus productos empaquetados, que vende en el mercado central de su ciudad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es retirar la mala yerba y dejar limpios los surcos sembrados, para que sus cultivos crezcan fuertes, sin embargo, le molesta cosechar porque sus siembras a veces son muy débiles, por eso aprendió a tener paciencia, además obtiene buenas ganancias, que le permiten sacar adelante a su familia. Alcira tiene muchas metas por cumplir y una de ellas es sembrar en cantidad, además paralelamente quiere alquilar un establecimiento en su ciudad para instalar una tienda de comestibles para vender sus productos al por mayor, porque es consciente de que no siempre vivirá de la agricultura.  Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y  asegura que está feliz de trabajar en su banco comunal, porque labora con personas responsables,  puntuales y con ganas de salir adelante.Alcira tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado, en la compra de  varios sacos de abono e insecticidas para fumigar sus cultivos de alverja y flor de gladiolo.
texts.en:
Alcira, 42, is married to Belarmino, 52, and they have two children, only one of whom still lives at home with them; they live in a relative’s house. She owns a house a few kilometers from where she is currently living and will move into it soon. For the last 18 years she has farmed a variety of flowers and corn with her husband and son. She sells her products during festivals. In order to transport her merchandise she hires a car to move her packaged goods to sell at the city’s central market. What she likes best about her work is to remove the bad weeds and leave her furrows planted so that her crops will grow strong. On the other hand, harvesting sometimes annoys her because her crop yields are poor. She has therefore had to learn to be patient for she does make enough profits to support the family. Alcira has a lot of goals to strive towards one of which is to increase her plantings. She also wants to rent a space in the city to set up a grocery store so that she can sell her product at wholesale because she realizes that she won’t be able to support herself by farming her whole life. This is her 2nd loan from MFP and she assures us that she’s very happy to work with her communal bank because she works with responsible, punctual people who want to get ahead in life. Alcira plans to use the requested funds to buy several sacks of manure and insecticide to fumigate her pea and gladiola crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides for her crops.

loans.name: Virgilia Burlat Group

texts.en:
Virgilia B. is from the village of Unidos. She is 64 years-old and she is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Kiva partner PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Virgilia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Virgilia owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Virgilia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Virgilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. Virgilia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Virgilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Soch

texts.en: Pictured is Mrs. Soch P., 61, who lives in Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband make a living by planting a variety of domestic crops. They grow things like rice and some vegetables. They run their farm on their own land next to their house. They can grow twice a year and will sell their crops to buyers every two months after they begin growing them. Soch P. is taking out her loan in order to buy farm accessories to supply her in the field when the farming season comes.

loans.use: To buy farm accessories

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is 52 years old and married with two children. To earn a living, he offers transport using his van. He has been in this business for ten years.  He also does dairy farming for extra income. He previously sold spare parts for a living. He has requested 70,000 KES to complete construction of shops for rent. He believes that once the shops are complete, he will get more income. Lawrence hopes to expand his business in the future. In ten years, he wants to build rental houses.

loans.use: To complete constructing his rental shops.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia nació en la comunidad de Paylla distrito Omacha Provincia de Paruro departamento y tiene 39 años. Actualmente,  Lidia vive junto con su esposo y sus dos hijos en la asociación Puerto Rico del distrito de Poroy de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Lidia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo oveja, cuy y gallinas, ella vende de forma ambulatoria en la feria sabatina  de la avenida el ejército de la ciudad del Cusco.  Su esposo trabaja como chofer en su carro, el brida servico de mudanza y esta forma ayuda a la canasta familiar.  
 
Con su próximo préstamo, Lidia que espera recibir S/. 500 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo para comprar más animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes. 

El banco comunal “Cusi Ccoyllor de Chinchero” tiene dos años y medio de funcionamiento, Lidia pertenece desde hace dos años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. El nombre del banco comunal es un término que en quechua (el idioma autóctono) significa “Princesa Hermosa de Chichero”.
texts.en:
Lidia was born in the community of Paylla in the Omacha District, Paruro Province, Department of Cusco. She is 39 years old and currently lives with her husband and two children in the Puerto Rico Association of the Poroy District in the city of Cusco.

Lidia raises small animals such as sheep, guinea pigs, and chickens. She sells them as a street vendor at the Saturday fair at Avenida El Ejército in the city of Cusco. Her husband works as a chauffeur and provides commuter services to help contribute to the family expenses.

With this next loan, Lidia will receive 500 PEN. She plans to use the money to buy more animals, such as guinea pigs.

The Communal Bank “Cusi Ccoyllor de Chinchero” has been in existence for 2½ years. Lidia has been a member for two years and has performed very well. The name of the Communal Bank is derived from Quechua (an indigenous language) and means “Beautiful Princess of Chinchero”.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more animals, such as guinea pigs

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La Sra.Patricia, es una joven emprendedora que desde hace un tiempo atráz viene trabajando en la venta de abarrotes (sodas, cervezas, arroz, harina, aceite,etc.) y con el pasar del tiempo y a base de mucho esfuerzo a logrado surtir una respetable tienda de barrio en el dominilio de sus padres Don Valentín y Doña Adalia a los cuales ayuda y colabora en todo lo necesario, y al mismo tiempo de los cuales recibe todo el apoyo para seguir adelante. Como anteriormente se dijo Doña Patricia a venido surtiendo cada dia mejor su tienda motivo por el cual es bastante concurrida y se han visto en la necesidad de surtirla comprando refrescos y arroz, azucar,etc, razón por la cual nuevamente se acerco por nuestras instalaciones a solicitar un nuevo crédito para su tienda. Doña Patricia viene trabajando hace un tiempo atráz con nosotros y a demostrado cumplimiento en el pago de sus cuotas, por tal motivo no se le negó un nuevo crédito, ademas de aquello cuenta con domicilio conocido y cero deudas en otras Entidades Financieras.
texts.en:
Patricia is an enterprising young person who some time ago was working selling groceries (sodas, beer, rice, flour, cooking oil, etc.) Over time, and with a lot of effort, she managed to set up a respectable store in the neighborhood where her parents, Don Valentín and Doña Adalia, have their home. They help her with the store and pitch in when needed, and give her all the support she needs to get ahead. As previously, said Patricia, she has been stocking her store better over time, so that the store will be sufficiently busy. She sees a need to increase her inventory by buying soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc. For this reason she approached our institution to request a new loan for her store. Patricia has been working with our institution for a while, and has made her payments on time, which is why she is approved to take a new loan. In addition, she has a known address and no debt with any other financial entity.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy general merchandise (soda, beer, rice, cooking oil, flour, etc.)

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn E. is from the village of Burgos. She is 44 years old. Merlyn is married and has 2 adult-age children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.   The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP whenever she sells her raised pig.

In 2009, Merlyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Merlyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is a 42-year-old married woman from Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. The eldest among her 6 children is 23 years old. Virgie is a rice farmer, just like her husband. Both of them spend most of their time keeping their farm productive. Virgie also makes delicacies that she sells around their neighborhood. She says it helps in their daily needs and she hopes to have a sari-sari store where she can sell more kinds of products.

Virgie is applying for a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI. She will use it to buy farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell. She is hopeful that this loan will help her business immensely.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Señora Margarita vive en casa propia quien tiene un puestito en la escuelita cerca D. su domicilio ella vive con su esposo y su hija que le ayudan con los gastos familiares, la señora comenzó desD. muy joven con este negocio D. la venta D. dulces, nos pidió el crédito para poder comprarse una pequeña casetita y así estar mas cómoda y no sufrir del viento y la lluvia ya que pasa muchas cosas cuando venD., es muy trabajadora desea también surtir su puesto D. venta, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado	.
texts.en: Margarita lives in her own home and she has a stand in the nearby school. She lives with her husband and their daughter and they all contribute towards the family's expenses. She started out when she was very young selling candies. She requested a loan to purchase a stall so that she will not have to suffer from the winds and the rain. She is very hard working and she wants to increase the variety for sale. She is very grateful for the support provided.

loans.use: To purchase a stall.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia F. is from the village of Canitoan, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 57 years old. Claudia is married and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Claudia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While this is not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling electronic loads (electronic transfer of airtime using text messaging) from several networks like SMART and GLOBE in the local community. Claudia has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Claudia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Claudia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Claudia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional electronic loads to buy and sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Claudia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional electronic loads to buy and sell.

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOC RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Ruben Dario; el tiene 40 años de edad y es soltero; el socio se dedica a trabajar en el sector salud y también se dedica al negocio de artesanía, el vende en forma independiente, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de artesanía. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía como chompas, pantalones, cuadros y mantas.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ruben Dario belongs to the “Mosoc Runa” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Ruben Dario is 40 years old and single.  He works in the health sector and also has a handicrafts business.  He sells independently.  He would like to expand his handicrafts business.  He is requesting this loan to buy handicrafts such as sweaters, pants, pictures and blankets.

He is grateful to those who will take part in his dream by funding his loan and pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts such as sweaters, pants, pictures and blankets

loans.name: Corina

texts.es: La señora Corina vive en casa D. su Mama quien le dio una parte como herencia, vive con sus hijos, su esposo se fue a España se separaron y es ella quien cuida D. sus hijos. La señora se dedica a la venta D. accesorios D. ferretería ya bastante tiempo como tres años donD. le va muy bien con este negocio ella viaja a Oruro para traer los accesorios porque en ese departamento es mas económico y los venD. a un precio razonable, tiene bastantes clientes porque reparte a ferreterías y es muy conocida. La señora saco el crédito para comprar estos accesorios ya que tiene pedidos y no tiene lo suficiente para poder comprar y poder satisfacer su demanda, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Corina lives at her mother’s house which was given to her as part of her inheritance. There she lives with her children. Her husband went to Spain after they separated and she was left alone to care for the children. Sra. Corina has been selling hardware accessories for three years and has done very well in this business. She travels to Oruro to acquire accessories because they are cheaper and sold at a reasonable price. Corina has enough customers because she delivers hardware and is well-known.

The loan she will receive will be used to buy accessories since she has orders but not enough capital to buy them so that she can meet demand. Corina is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: Purchase hardware accessories such as alarms, plywood, and other items

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul operates Star Autospare shop, where he sells spare parts for vehicles.  He has been running this business for six years and employs three people.  Paul was able to open the business because he had gained some skills by working in another auto parts shop.  As a member of Faulu Kenya, he is able to save his money.  

He hopes to expand his shop in the future.  He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy starters, distributors and alternators.

loans.use: To buy starters, distributors and alternators.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Mr. Byambasuren is 33 years old.  He lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Currently they live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, on his grandmother's plot of land. His daughter attends a local secondary school and his son goes to kindergarten. 

Mr. Byambasuren has been a policeman since 2001. He works in 2-day shifts:  on for 24 hours and then off for two days.  During his two off days, he works as a taxi driver, ferrying people around the city using his family car to make extra money. His wife works as a waitress in  a small diner. They  dream of buying a small family house in the future. 

The taxi business gives them a chance to earn extra money to save.  Mr. Byambasuren is requesting a loan to buy some spare parts and to properly service his car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and to service car

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo H. sells many wares in her village, Banteay Meanchey province. She sells the items like soft drink, sweets for kids, shampoo, cooking supplies, and other products. Keo H. is a widow woman, and she currently lives with her three children; two are single and one is married but they still living under a roof. Due to the fact that the rice-harvesting season is coming, Keo H. has decided to seek a loan on Kiva for capital to buy more rice during the time when rice is commanding its lowest price. Then she will sell it later when the price is increasing.

loans.use: To buy rice stock while it priced low.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en: Bolormaa is 39 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives with her family in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her husband repairs tires for the local car repair center to supplement his family's income. Her oldest daughter attends a vocational training course as a hairdresser, and her youngest daughter attends a primary school. Bolormaa's middle two sons both have incurable illnesses. In 2008, she received some help from a Japanese man who paid all related costs for her sons' diagnosis in Japan. Bolormaa operates a business out of her home making woolen slippers. She started her business in 2009 after attending a training course conducted by a Japanese person. She purchases her main product, wool, at 5,000 MNT and sells her final products at 17,000 MNT. She is very worried for her two sons because neither has much time to live. Bolormaa is a very kind and modest person and says with tears in her eyes, "All I want is to provide a decent life for my two sons while they are alive." She is requesting a 229,000 MNT loan to purchase wool in order to make more woolen slippers.

loans.use: To purchase wool

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has four children and all her children go to school. Fatuma operates a  beauty salon.  She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days out of every week. 

Fatuma has requested for a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO. She wants to use this to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, conditioners, braids and weaves. The main business challenge for Fatuma is seasonality. Her goals and aspirations include improving on her standard of living  

She lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, conditioners, braids and weaves

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em T., 49, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. T. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 20 on food and USD 70 on the other necessary expenses. T. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike for her family's use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia M. sells palm oil, which she extracts directly from the palm fruit. For over 10 years, she has been selling palm oil at the Jukwa Market, a major market situated near Abura, Cape Coast. She is married to a farmer and they have four children. Her earnings help pay for the school fees and household utility bills. To expand her business, she plans to purchase more palm fruit (which you can see in the photograph) to produce larger volumes of palm oil. She hopes this will increase her sales and profits, which she plans to save up for her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria Mercedes M. B. tiene 27 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es arreglar la casa.

Le gusta salir a  pasear por el pueblo y festejar las fiestas del sector.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes M. B. is 27 years old and married with one child.  She lives with her husband and son in the canton of Guaranda in the Bolívar province.

The members of the Communal Bank “Mushuc Nan” (“New Road” in Quechua) live in the Guanto Cruz community in the Guanujo parish in the canton of Guaranda.  This chapter of 22 members is dedicated to farming: they cultivate mulberries, corn, livestock and poultry, and raise dairy cows to make cheese.  

Maria works planting mulberries and corn and raising farm animals.  She buys her supplies in Guaranda and then sells her goods at the Guaranda fair.

She is requesting this loan to purchase supplies, livestock and animal feed.  A loan would help her to meet her financial needs.  She faces challenges such as pests and disease as well as changes in the weather.  Her dream is to fix up her home.  Maria enjoys taking strolls around the village and celebrating the holidays locally.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, livestock and animal feed.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo Ramón S. Ruiz es un hombre trabajador, esforzado y emprendedor. Él se dedica a la agricultura, actividad que realiza hace más de 15 años que aprendió de sus padres, siembra maíz, frijoles y yuca. 
Además vende leña inició con 5 fletes de leña actualmente trabaja hasta con 20 fletes de leña. Sequira lleva 26 ciclos con Adim e invertirá el crédito en la siembra de dos manzanas de tierra.
texts.en:
Gerardo is a hard-working, striving, and enterprising man. He is dedicated to agriculture, an activity he has been involved in for more than 15 years. Gerardo learned from his parents. He sows corn, beans, and manioc.

In addition, he sells firewood. Gerardo began with 5 loads of firewood at a time. At present, he works with as much as 20 loads of firewood at a time.

Gerardo has worked with ADIM through 26 loan cycles. He will invest the loan in sowing 3.5 acres of land.

loans.use: TO SOW 3.5 ACRES OF FARM LAND

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
el grupo Genesis esta ubicado en la La Redonda Jamastran, esta integrado por 3 personas que se conocen muy bien, trabajan juntos y tienen sus propios negocios, juntos han logrado salir adelante, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

la sra. Santos Cristina López R. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pulpería y bici partes, tiene varios años experiencia en el manejo de este tipo de negocio, permitiéndole tener muy buena clientela, en su negocio se encuentra de todo un poco, tanto para el consumo y a su vez una variedad de repuestos para bicicletas, este transporte es bien popular en la zona ya que les facilita el traslado para sus trabajos, estudios o de recreación.
el negocio de doña Cristina ha ido teniendo un crecimiento significativo ahora ya cuentan con energía eléctrica y ya puede vender productos que requieren refrigeración tal como ser carnes embutidos refrescos charamuscas, paletas y lácteos        
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería y asi surtir mejor su negocio y mantener de todo un poco y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.     

la sra. Nohemí del Carmen R. se dedica al comercio, vende ropa americana clasificada, tiene 4 meses de dedicarse a dicha actividad ya que anteriormente tenia una pequeña pulpería la que tuvo que quitar,  una vez instalada la energía eléctrica en la zona los negocios mas grandes compraron equipos de refrigeración y ella no contaba con capital para invertir en su negocio y esto hizo que su negocio bajara y es po eso que opto por dedicarse a otra actividad generadora de ingresos, es así que doña Nohemí instala el nuevo negocio de venta de ropa americana la que sale a vender a sus vecinos y lugares circunvecinos tanto de contado como de crédito, con los ingresos que le genera este negocio cubre sus gastos personales y los gastos del hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de un fardo de ropa americana de verano y así lograr satisfacer la demanda de su exigente clientela.     

el sr. Santos Julián López R. se dedica a la micro agroindustria pues siembra granos básicos, como el rió pasa por la cercanías de la comunidad de donde vive aprovechan a lo máximo para le riego de una pequeña parcela de tierra que consta de media manzana, este rubro que ha tomado auge en la zona ya que las condiciones climatológicas se prestan para el cultivo de granos basicos, Santos comercializa a los compradores que vienen de la republica de El Salvador, los que pagan a buen precio el producto, también a compradores de la zona que abastecen el mercado local.      
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para lograr un mejor desarrollo en su cultivo.
texts.en:
The Genesis group is located in La Redonda Jamastran.  It has three members who know each other very well.  They work together and also have their own businesses.  Together they have managed to get ahead.  Here we will provide details of their different business activities:

Santos Cristina López R. sells products.  She has a grocery store and a bicycle parts business.  She has several years experience in running this type of business which means that she has a very good customer base.  In her business, you can find a little bit of everything, both food products and, at the same time, a variety of bicycle parts.  This mode of transport is very popular in her area since it enables people to get to work and school and is also used for recreational purposes.

Cristina's business has been experiencing significant growth.  She now has electricity and can sell products that require refrigeration such as cold cuts, soft drinks popsicles and dairy products.

Cristina will use her loan to buy merchandise so that she can better stock her business and have a little bit of everything available so that she can meet her customer demand.

Nohemí del Carmen R. sells products.  She sells American clothes.  She has been in this business for four months.  Before this she used to have a small grocery store which she had to abandon.  Once they installed electricity in the area, the bigger businesses bought refrigeration equipment and she didn't have enough capital to invest in her business.  This meant that her business declined.  For this reason, she decided to start another business activity in order to make money.  She set up her new business selling American clothes.  She goes out to sell to her neighbors and in neighboring areas.  She makes her sales both for cash and on credit.  She uses the income from this business to cover her personal expenses and her household expenses.

Nohemí will use her loan to buy a bundle of American summer clothes so that she can satisfy her customers.

Santos Julián López R. is a small farmer.  He grows basic grains.  As a river passes nearby the community where he lives, he takes maximum advantage in order to irrigate a small plot of land which measures half a 'manzana' (note: one 'manzana' = 1.68 acres).  This business has risen in his area since the climatic conditions lend themselves to growing basic grains.  Santos sells to buyers who come from El Salvador.  They pay a good price for his produce.  He also sells to buyers from his area who supply the local market.

Santos will use his loan to buy supplies and fertilizers so that he can improve his crops.

loans.use: to buy bicycle parts, butter, oil, margarine, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, soft drinks, juices, corn flour, salt, condiments, eggs, used clothes, basic grains to grow and fertilizers

loans.name: Ntungamo Kwetungura Group

texts.en: M. Lauben is the leader of the Ntungamo Kwetungura group in Ntungamo. He is 34 years old and married with five children. Four of the children are still in school. Lauben is into the business of selling produce like beans, millet and coffee from Ntungamo. He sells mostly to locals. Hard work and being social have enabled him to succeed. He is able to generate 200,000/= monthly after a long period of seven years in business. A friend introduced him to the business and his dream is to be able to educate his children as well as buy farm land. He has been able to buy cows for his kraal (an enclosure for livestock). He needs a loan to be able to buy more produce and a cow for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more produce and a cow

loans.name: Leopoldina Primitiva

texts.es:
Leopoldina de 55 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, es separada y tiene un hijo de 12 años que estudia en la Academia Naval. Ella se dedica en la venta de gallinas chanchos y ropa por catálogos.

Comenzó criando gallinas en su casa y luego las vendía y así fue incrementando su capital y después de un tiempo empezó con la venta de chanchos y mercadería de ropa por catálogos. Le afecta en su negocio es la delincuencia ya que por el sector es mas frecuente. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar mas gallinas chanchos y ropa por catálogos.

En un futuro desea comprarse otro solar para poner criaderos de pollos y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Leopoldina is 55 years old and lives in an urban area of Suburbio de Guayaquil.  She is separated and has a 12 year-old son who is studying at the Naval Academy.  Her business is selling hens, pigs, and clothes through catalogs.

Leopoldina started out raising hens at home and then selling them.  In this way, she gradually increased her capital and, after a while, she started selling pigs and also clothes through catalogs.  Leopoldina is affected in her business by crime since it is very common in her neighborhood.  With the help of this loan, she would like to buy more hens, pigs and clothes.

In the future, Leopoldina would like to buy another plot of land so that she can set up a poultry farm and improve her home.

loans.use: to buy 30 units of hens, 2 units of pigs, and clothes

loans.name: Jekabara  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe  JEKABARA II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 3  enfants et vivant dans des  familles polygames à ZANGABOUGOU, un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est :  le pois sucré avec  ANCHATA.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et semences pour entretenir : 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché du village de DALLEN et au marché de LOULOUNI après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20.500FCFA par campagne.
