Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Jekabara II group are married women. They are on average 35 years old with three children, and live in polygamous families in Zangabougou, one of the villages of Loulouni Township in Loulouni sub-prefecture, Mali's third administrative region.
They collaborate with the micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to complete their agricultural duties during wintering.
They are on their fourth loan with the organization; previous loans have been repaid correctly.
The cultivated species is tiger nuts for Anchata. With her loan, she intends on purchasing fertilizers and seeds to tend to 1.2 acres.
The production is sold after the harvest at the village level, at the markets of Dallen (a village) and Loulouni, to a clientele composed of men and women.
She plans on an average benefit of 20,500 CFA per cultivation cycle. This benefit will allow her to reimburse her loan and help her husband with daily expenses.
She wishes to maintain her collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso to operate an even-larger cultivation space, the better to increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (fertilizers, seeds).

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
For four years now, Juliana has been married to a mason and together they have six dependants. She has been through senior high school. 
Juliana cooks wakye at a village called Tayido near Abura. Her income is used to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. The loan, when received, will be used to purchase rice, beans and other ingredients to prepare wakye to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Juliana plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans and other ingredients to prepare wakye to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, povincia de Maputo ao sul de Mocambique separada e mãe de 2 filhos de idades entre 9 e 16 anos de idade. Fez a 5ªclasse e parou quando engravidou. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, e comerciante permanente a mais de 9 anos e tem um rendimento de 1.800.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de uma prima que tambem e cliente e este e o seu primeiro emprestimo no valor de 8.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos de venda (açucar,oleo, arroz, e outros ).
sonho e construir um estabelecimento comercial,para ampliar o seu negocio e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Ana was born in the city of Matola in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is separated and the mother of 2 children, who are 9 and 16.  She studied through the fifth grade and stopped because she became pregnant.  She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone besides them.

She never left Maputo.  She has had a business for more than 9 years.  She makes 1,800 meticals per month, which she puts towards her home's expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account at the BIM bank.

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through her cousin who is also a client of the institution.  This is her first loan in the amount of 8,000 meticals, which she will use to buy products to sell (sugar, oleo, rice, etc.).

Her dream is to build a commerical establishment to expand her business, for which she plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy products to sell (sugar, oleo, rice, etc.)

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is divorced and has five dependents. For the past twenty years she has sold Fante kenkey (a type of kenkey associated with the Fante people) at Elmina; the picture shows her in the process of making Fante kenkey.

Abena will use her loan to buy more maize flour to prepare kenkey for sale. She plans to plow her extra profits back into her business.

loans.use: to buy more maize flour to prepare kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Percy

texts.es: Percy tiene 28 años, vive en el caserío de Yanama. Ahí formó su familia junto a Lourdes, su esposa desde hace 3 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos a los que quieren mucho y cuidan en su casa propia. Las mañanas de Percy son muy arduas, ya que se dedica a la siembra de diferentes actividades durante el día. Su mayor inspiración son sus hijos a los cuales desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Por eso trabaja con ahínco en sus terrenos agrícolas; donde siembra arveja, papa y flor de gladiolo. Ya tiene 10 años de experiencia en producir la tierra. En todo este tiempo logró obtener un buen mercado en la ciudad de Tarma y la capital del país, donde dependiendo a la demanda del producto viaja al lugar donde más le conviene. Cuenta por ejemplo, que en el mes de julio se dirige al mercado de “la parada” que se ubica en la capital del Perú, donde vende los alimentos que produce a un buen precio. También tiene 2 toros, con los cuales ara la tierra a diferentes agricultores, ganando así S/. 80 soles diarios. Pero ese servicio solo lo brinda en época de sembrío, por eso desea sacar mayor provecho a esa temporada. Y ya muy pronto lo conseguirá, pues comprará un toro más para que le ayude en el arado. Además de poseer ovejas con las que espera obtener un dinero extra, al momento de venderlas. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Manantiales de Yanama” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además de agradecer la confianza depositada en él. Percy de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 3 bolsas de semilla de arveja para comenzar con éxito su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Percy is 28 years old.  He lives in the village of Yanama.  There he started his family, together with Lourdes, his wife of three years.  They have 2 children that they love very much and care for in their own home.  Percy's mornings are very arduous, since he devotes himself to many activities during the day.  His greatest inspiration is his children, to whom he wants to give a better quality of life. That is why he works hard on his farmland, where he plants peas, potatoes, and gladiolus flowers. He already has 10 years of experience in farming.  During all that time, he has been able to get a good market in the city of Tarma and in the country's capital. Depending on the demand for the product, he will travel to the place of greatest advantage to him.  As an example, in July he goes to the "La Parada" market located in Peru's capital, where he sells the food he produces at a good price.  He also has 2 bulls, with which he plows the land of various farmers, earning 80 soles a day in this way.  But he only provides this service during harvest time, so he would like to take greater advantage of that season.  And soon he will be able to do it, since he will buy another bull to help him with the plowing.  He also has sheep, from which he hopes to earn some extra money when he sells them.  He belongs to the "Manantiales de Yanama" communal bank, and this is his fifth loan with MFP.  He hopes for the support of all of you to continue with his goals. He is also thankful for the confidence placed in him.  Percy, once he obtains this support, will use the money he is asking for to purchase 3 bags of pea seed to successfully begin his next harvest.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bags of pea seeds

loans.name: Segundo Isidoro

texts.es:
Segundo de 62 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad comercial y transporte público.

Desde hace unos 10 años aproximadamente Segundo se ha dedicado a la venta de productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, fideos y gaseosas, su negocio lo ha colocado en un puesto que tiene en el mercado Moshoqueque, en elcualatiende todos los días y con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y obligaciones familiares.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes;  para cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones de su casa.  Segundo es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por brindarles más comodidades a su familia porque se lo merece.
texts.en:
Segundo is 62 years old and lives with his family in their own house. The house is equipped with all utilities and is located in the built-up area of the district of José Leonardo Ortiz in the province of Chiclayo. This area is characterized by commercial activity and public transportation.

For some ten years Segundo has been selling daily products: milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna fish, pasta and soda. He has installed his business in a stall at the Moshoqueque market, where he serves his customers every day. He spends his profit from the sales on household and family expenditures.

In order to bolster his business, he came to the microfinance institution Edpyme Alternativa and applied for a loan of 1500 new soles to buy more goods, with the sole aim to see his business growing with more goods to offer to his customers, enabling him to pay the loan installments and household expenditures. Segundo is responsible, dedicated and hard-working. He is concerned with the comfort of his family because it deserves it.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his grocery.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Uganda. She is married and has eight children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of an additional family member (a sister).  

Joyce has a restaurant.  She has been in this business for seven years, and she works six days out of every week. Joyce sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  

Joyce has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, and sweet and Irish potatoes. The main business challenges for Joyce include seasonality and the increasing price of food. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked restaurant. 

Joyce lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include utility bills, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef, and sweet and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 45 years old and a single mother of three. To earn a living, she sells household items such as basins, buckets, pegs, blinds and table cloths.  She has been in the business for one year and has employed one person. She is also employed.  

Through Faulu Kenya, she has improved her business, hence improving her financial status.

She hopes to expand her business in the future. She needs a loan of 40,000 KES to buy blinds.

loans.use: To buy blinds to resell.

loans.name: Juntas Progresaremos Group

texts.es: Guisela tiene 26 años de edad es la mas joven en la alcancía “JUNTAS PROGRESAREMOS”, es madre soltera, tiene una niña de 3 años de edad la cual es la persona que le da fuerzas para seguir adelante, Guisela  se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza en el cual se viene desempeñando por mas de 3 años, a lo largo de este tiempo indica que ha podido superarse ya que ahora tiene 35 personas a su cargo los cuales distribuyen las los productos que ella compra, el sueño que tiene es lograr tener una salón de belleza para de esta manera mejorar su estilo de vida, indica que el préstamo lo empleara en la compra de mas productos ya que por esta temporadas la demanda de productos aumenta.
texts.en: Guisela is 26 years old.  She is the youngest member of the 'Juntas Progresaremos' (We Will Make Progress Together) community bank.  Guisela is a single mother and has a 3-year-old daughter who gives her the strength to get ahead.  Guisela has been selling beauty products for mO. than three years.  Over these years, she tells us that she has done well as she is now responsible for 35 people who distribute the products that she buys.  Her dream is to own a beauty salon so that she can improve her lifestyle.  She says that she will use the loan to buy mO. products as the demand for her products increases at this time of year.

loans.use: to buy more products

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 43 years old and lives in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three school-aged children. 

To earn a living, Valentina is vending a variety of fish in the local community. She sometimes sells other seafood products like shells, seaweed, etc. It is the kind of living she obtained from her parents when she was still young. She has been doing this job for four years. Fortunately, Valentina is able to generate PHP 4,500 a month. She has borrowed PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to order a variety of fish in the local community.

Valentina has been a member of GDMPC since 2010.  In the future, Valentina would like to have a fish-vending stall in the market and to offer more seafood products to gain more income.

loans.use: To order a variety of fish to sell in the local community.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est un regroupement de quatre femmes de la ville  SAN, Région de Ségou. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 6 enfants. Elles font de la restauration et l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires tels la pâte d’arachide. 
Afin satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles qui ne cesse de croître les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans et elles sont à leur cinquième cycle.
FANTA, en boubou tricolore sur la photo, marchandises en main, compte utiliser son prêt pour aller s’approvisionner auprès des Sœurs Catholiques de SAN, qui font la transformation de l’arachide en pâte d’arachide. Elle espère avoir 30 seaux de 15 kg, qu’elle donnera à crédit payable mensuellement  aux enseignants et à bien d’autres fonctionnaires de la place.  
Elle compte sur un  bénéfice de 21.000 FCFA par mois, qui servira à rembourser le prêt, venir en aide à son époux en faisant l’entretien des enfants. 
En ce qui concerne les autres femmes du groupe elles comptes sur un bénéfice de 19.500 FCFA par mois. 
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi souhaitent continuer avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour qu’elles puissent devenir un jour des grossistes.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is a grouping of four women from the town of San in the Ségou region. They average 45 years of age, are married and have at least six children each. They have restauration activities and trade in condiments such as groundnut paste. 

With a view to satisfying their ever-growing customer demand the members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program four years ago, and they are on their fifth loan.

Fanta, who is wearing a three-coloured "boubou" (a traditional West African dress) in the photo with her goods in her hands, is planning to use her loan to go and get fresh supplies from the Catholic nuns in San, who make groundnut paste out of groundnut. She is hoping to get 30 15kg buckets which she will sell on credit (to be repaid on a monthly basis) to local teachers and other civil servants.

She expects to make a monthly profit of 21,000FCFA, which will be used to repay her loan and help out her husband by taking care of the children's needs. As far as the other women in the group are concerned, they are expecting to make a monthly profit of 19,500FCFA. The women of the Benkadi group would like to continue collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso so that one day they can become wholesalers.

loans.use: to buy groundnut paste

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru: Барно замужем имеет троих детей. Муж находится на заработках в России. Для содержания своей семьи она занимается откормом скота, выращиванием картошки и переработкой абрикосов и яблок. Это тяжело для женщины, но для содержания детей приходится выполнять тяжелый труд. Желание каждых родителей вырастит детей в достатке и дать им образование. Это требует огромных усилий и вкладов. Она хочет получить займ и приобрести крупный рогатый скот. После откорма продать и получить хорошую прибыль. Она надеется на вашу помощь  и заранее приносит свою благодарность.
texts.en: Barno is married and has three children.  Her husband is working in Russia.  In order to support her family, Barno is involved in fattening up livestock, growing potatoes and processing apricots and apples.  All of this is difficult for a woman, but she must do this hard labor to provide for her children.  It is a desire of every parent to raise their children in abundance and provide them with education.  This requires enormous efforts and investments.  Barno wants to obtain this loan and purchase cattle.  She then wants to fatten it up, sell it and make a good profit.  Barno relies on your help and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Twigishanye I Group

texts.fr:
Fides est une commerçante âgée de 40ans qui habite à la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle fait le commerce d’articles divers de boutique (farine de manioc et de mais, huile pour la cuisson, haricot, sel, riz, bonbons, souliers, dentifrices…) depuis 5 ans. Elle était tailleur avant de commencer cette activité. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaire. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 4étudient. 
 Le crédit Kiva  de 300,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités d’articles de boutique (farine de manioc et de mais, huile pour la cuisson, haricot, sel, riz, bonbons, souliers, dentifrices…) à revendre  afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et accroitre ses économies. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« TWIGISHANYE I»
texts.en:
Fides is a 40-year-old merchant who lives in the province of Gitega in the center of the country. For five years she has been selling various articles (cassava flour and maize, cooking oil, beans, salt, rice, candy, shoes, toothpaste...). 

Before starting this activity she was a seamstress. She attended school up to sixth grade. She is married and the mother of five children, four of them are in school. 

 The Kiva loan of 300,000 Burundian francs allows her to increase her capital to buy items in large quantities for her shop (cassava flour and maize, cooking oil, beans, salt, rice, candy, shoes, toothpaste...). She can resell them in order to realize large profits and increase her savings.

She is a member of the community group "TWIGISHANYE I"

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy items in large quantities for her shop (cassava flour and maize, cooking oil, beans, salt, rice, candy, shoes, toothpaste...) and resell them in order to realize large profits.

loans.name: Santos Roman

texts.es:
Don Santos tiene 48 años de edad, esta casado y de su matrimonio ya solo depende un hijo, Santos se dedica al cultivo del cafe, cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el manejo del cafe, esta actividad le genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Don Santos utilizara el credito para la campra de una planta de energia solar, en donde el vive no cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica y las posibilidades de que puedan gozar de este servicio son bien remotas, toda sus vida se a iluminado con candiles y velas, mismas que son dañinas para la salud y el medio ambiente, Santos siempre a soñado tener luz propia en su casa y gracias a este sistema de energia solar su sueño se hara realidad.
texts.en:
Don Santos is 48 years old, married and has only one dependent child. Santos grows coffee and has more than 10 years experience handling coffee. This business generates an income to cover his household expenses. 
 
Don Santos will use the loan to buy a solar energy plant as where he lives there is no electrical power services and the chances of accessing these services are remote. He has used candles and oil lamps as a source of light his entire life which are harmful both for your health and the environment. Santos has always dreamed of having his own light in his house and thanks to this system of solar energy his dream will become reality.

loans.use: to buy a solar power panel.

loans.name: Munkhzul

texts.en:
Mrs. Munkhzul, 47, is widowed and works as a janitress in the secondary school of Kherlen, a western boundary town of Mongolia. She lives with her son, who is a college student. Beyond her job, she rents a small stall for groceries. Her monthly salary does not meet her expenses and she always pays her son’s school fees. 

Munkhzul always wants to expand her sales in order to increase her earnings and save for her son’s education in the future.  First she has a plan to increase her business working capital, such as groceries. 

She thinks that her earnings will be increased when her sales volume is raised. Therefore, the loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing a large number of groceries from her suppliers to expand her sales volume.

loans.use: to purchase a large number of groceries from her suppliers to expand her sales volume.

loans.name: Willypaforce

texts.en:
Willyparforce has been in the business of mixed farming for 5 years in his home area of Kitale, Western Kenya producing and selling maize, cabbage, and milk to the local market. He is married with one child aged 1 year old.

Willypaforce has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to be able to construct a dairy unit at 10,000 KES and to buy poultry birds at 20,000 KES. He says his improved farming will enhance his financial security and he hopes to manage the business to propel him to the status of large scale farmer, especially with the poultry business.

However, he mentions animal diseases and the high cost of feed as challenges.

loans.use: To construct a  dairy unit and poultry birds.

loans.name: Enedina

texts.es:
La señora Enedina  vive en un barrio muy pequeño ella es casada con el señor  Francisco Gabriel y con quién procreo cinco hijos quienes cuatro a un están a su responsabilidad.

Ella solito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de comidas, en donde lleva trabando  siete meses en la que comenta que le va  bien ya que con ello a mejorado mucho sus ingresos para su familia.

 Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó ya que también quiere apoyar a su esposo con los  ingresos de la casa  y apoyara su hijo con sus estudios.
 Lo más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad logre mejorar cada día sus ingresos para así agrandar su negocio y siga trabajando con el préstamo.
texts.en:
Enedina lives in a very small neighbourhood. She is married to Francisco Gabriel and they have five children together, of which she still supports four.

She is asking for a loan to invest by buying ingredients to make food. She has been working in this trade for seven months and comments that it is going well as she has already greatly improved her family income.

She was inspired to start work in this trade because she wanted to help her husband with the household income and support her son with his studies. She is hopeful that with this little job she will manage to improve their income everyday in order to grow her business and continue working with the loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making food.

loans.name: Lukas

texts.en:
Lukas is 28 years old and single, supporting two children.

He has been a shopkeeper for the last one year from which he earns a monthly income of KES 5,000.

He is applying for his first loan of KES 15,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the loan to buy more goods for sale to his customers.

loans.use: To buy more stocks for his shop.

loans.name: Cira

texts.es: La Sra. Cira se dedica  a la venta de ropa vive en la zona del plan 3000 en  casa propia, vive con su hijo, es madre soltera. Es primera vez que solicita un crédito individual ya que anteriormente estaba en el banco de emprendimiento porvenir durante siete ciclos, en el cual demostró buen comportamiento de pago, el crédito que esta solicitando es para aumentar su capital de trabajo ya que por las fiestas de fin de año es donde se vende más ropa y desea comprar mercadería por mayor ropa de temporada. La Sra. Cira, ella sola mantiene su hogar y se encarga de la educación de su hijo que su deseo es un día verlo profesional ya que se esfuerza por darle un futuro mejor a su hijo.
texts.en: Cira sells clothes.  She lives in the Plan 3000 zone in her own house with her son; she’s a single mother.  This is the first time she’s asked for an individual loan since she used to be in the “Porvenir” communal bank for seven cycles and demonstrated good payment behavior.  The loan she’s asking for is to increase working capital because during the end of year festivities more clothing is sold and she wants to buy seasonal merchandise at wholesale.  Cira supports her home alone and she’s responsible for her son’s education and her wish is to see him become professional someday because she strives to give her son a better future.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Julia Elena

texts.es: La Sra. Julia Elena es profesora de un instituto publico desde hace mas de 4 años como profesora de ingles impartiendo clase a jovenes entre 15 - 17 años, agradece a CEPRODEL por haberle otorgado este credito para utilizarlo en compra de utiles escolares para sus hijos

loans.use: Compra utiles escolares para hijos

loans.name: Roger

texts.en: Roger wants to thank you all the support in the previous loan, Roger obtained earnings with sale of solar lamps, and He wants to expand his business, buying more lamps to increase his sales and enhance his economy and his family. moreover, Roger helps that families in his community, can access to better lighting and avoid using kerosene and candles, also to save recharging their cell phones, that its a way to protect the environment and the health of the people.

loans.use: To buy more solar lamps to sell his customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a water tank

loans.name: Oum

texts.en: Oum D., 36 years old, is a construction worker and the father of two children.  He lives with his wife and children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  As a construction worker, D. can typically make about $5 per day, while his wife runs the family's grocery store and can make about $6 per day.  With the loan, the family hopes to buy more grocery items in order to expand the family business.  In the future, D. hopes to further expand the business and also to send his two children to university.

loans.use: To expand grocery business

loans.name: Bihosiyat

texts.en:
Bihosiyat has been engaged in business for over 12 years. She is married and has 2 children. In 1995 she rented a stall in Panjshanbe market and started her business selling household goods. But over time she noticed that there is a more constant demand for food products and so decided to change her business from household goods to food products in 2000. She rented another stall at Panjshanbe market and started confectionery items.

As she attracted a lot of customers, Bihosiyat sold her goods in a short time. Gradually she was able to expand her assortment. She sold all kind of sugar products such as "navod", lump sugar, and granulated sugar. She also added confectionery products to her assortment: cakes, honey cakes, sweet biscuits and fancy cakes. She was later able to get refrigerated showcase for her goods.

Bihosiyat has one dream: to open a sewing workshop for her daughter. Now Bihosiyat is requesting a loan of US$ 100 to purchase addditional confectionery items.

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Araz

texts.en: Araz is 56 years old and married. He has three children and lives in Khachmaz town. 3 years ago , he started his business. He sells agricultural produce: tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages,etc. Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy more agricultural produce so he can increase his income.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce

loans.name: Delia Juana

texts.es:
Delia is 22 years old and approximately 3 years ago she decided to start a small restaurant in a rented space located in front of one of the most popular marketplaces in her hometown, Juliaca, and thanks to the delicious dishes she prepares together with her beloved mother and sister, her small restaurant has turned into one the most popular ones in her town and day by day she is getting more regular customers and growing economic benefits for her family. It is this young lady´s wish to implement her business in order to make it more comfortable for her customers, and therefore she is asking for $175 to buy tables and chairs and thus improve the environment where her delicious dishes are served to her demanding customers. It is her commitment to repay the loan in 6 months. "Delia is grateful from the bottom of her heart for your support to continue and implement her business."

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer

Delia de tiene 22 años y hace aproximadamente 3 decidió abrir su pequeño restaurante en un local alquilado ubicada frente a uno de los mercados más concurridos de su ciudad natal, Juliaca, gracias a los deliciosos potajes que prepara con ayuda de su querida madre y hermana su pequeño restaurante se está convirtiendo en uno de los más concurridos de su localidad, con el que día a día está obteniendo asiduos clientes y mayor beneficio económico para su familia.El deseo de esta joven muchacha es implementar su negocio con la finalidad de brindarles mayor comodidad a sus clientes, para esto esta solicitando un préstamo de 175 dólares, dinero con el que podrá comprar más mesas y sillas para mejorar el ambiente en el que ingieren gustosos diversos platos sus exigentes clientes, así mismo les extiende su compromiso de devolución en un lapso de 6 meses.“Delia agradece de corazón el apoyo que le brindas para continuar e implementar su negocio

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs for a restaurant

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
We found Magdalena, very happy and eager; she told us that she commercializes fruit from Chanchamayo in Carhuamayo. She works along with her dear husband in order to support their family. She is happy with the results that she is obtaining, but her wish is to be able venture into the more competitive business of breeding and selling guinea pigs. She is already in this business in a small scale with some animals that she has in her backyard. She also wants to make her current business grow, so that with the profits of both, she will able to offer a comfortable house to her two small children of eleven and seven years of age. She is requesting a loan to fulfill her wishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Encontramos a Magdalena, muy alegre y afanosa, ella nos narra que comercializa y lleva fruta de Chanchamayo hacia Carhuamayo, esta actividad la realiza en compañía de su querido esposo, para mantener a su familia.Ella se siente contenta con los resultados que está obteniendo pero el deseo que tiene en mente es poder incursionar de una manera más competitiva en la crianza y venta de cuyes, actividad que ahora realiza en pequeña escala con los animalitos que posee en el patio de su casa; así mismo desea acrecentar su negocio actual, para que con los beneficios pueda ofrecer una morada cómoda y propia a sus dos pequeños retoños de once y siete años de edad. Para concretar sus planes solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Invest the loan in a new business of breeding and selling guinea pigs on large scale

loans.name: Martha Eugenia

texts.es:
Martha Eugenia M. S. is a single woman. She is enterprising and has hopes to expand her business so that she can support her family and offer them a more stable life and meet the needs of her children.

Ten years ago Ms. M. S. started with a small grocery store that has been growing over the years allowing her to offer a greater variety of products. Her start-up capital was $50.00 in savings.

Ms. M. S. has been working with CEPRODEL for five years and is very happy with the support that they have given her because she has been able to expand her business, meet her clientèle's needs and help her children to succeed. She has a history of twenty four loans.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Martha Eugenia M. S. es una mujer Soltera, emprendedora con deseos de progresar en su negocio para poder apoyar a su familia ofreciéndole una vida estable, poder satisfacer las necesidades de su hijo.

Hace Diez años la Sra. M. S. inicio con una pequeña pulpería la cual al paso de los años ha ido incrementando, pudiendo ofrecer variedad de productos. Su capital inicial fue de U$50.00 (dólares) de ahorros.

La Sra. M. S. trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace Cinco años y se siente muy satisfecha por el apoyo ofrecido, ya que de esta manera ha podido incrementar su negocio, satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ella tiene un record de Veinticuatro créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Kurbonmurod

texts.ru:
Kurbonmurod B., 31, a teacher by training, is married and has 3 children. For 3 years, Kurbonmurod raises cattle. He plans to use this loan to purchase a milk cow. Kurbonmurod wants to make extra profit by selling milk from the cow. He plans to repay this loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобоев Курбонмурод, возраст – 31 год, образование – высшее, по специальности педагог, женат, имеет 3-х детей. Он занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота. Он в настоящий момент имеет несколько бычков. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 3 лет. На полученный кредит он хочет приобрести корову, которая будет давать молоко. Получаемое молоко он планирует продавать местным жителям. Данный кредит поможет ему приобрести корову, получить удои молока, обеспечивать свою семью свежем молоком, а также давать возможность местным жителям приобретать у него молоко. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Neli

texts.en: Neli M. lives with her husband in the town of Smolian. She works in a garment factory that encourages its employees to do some work at home and thus generate additional payments. Neli wants to be able to work at home but she needs to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jacinta Andrea

texts.es:
Mrs. Jacinta Gutiérrez is a native of the Villanueva municipality in Chinandega. She has been selling shoes and apparel for a living from her home for 5 years. At first, she did not have much success in her sales, but as time has passed, she has been improving her business, ultimately purchasing two display cases and a shelf, which she still owns today.

She is a married mother of 3 children under her care. She, alongside her husband, struggles to provide them with a better quality of life so that they can one day become great professionals. In order to see this dream come true, she has turned to Ceprodel for a loan that will allow her to purchase more merchandise to offer to her faithful customers. It is important to note that she has obtained 5 credits that have been paid off in a timely manner according to the loan terms.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Jacinta Gutiérrez originaria del municipio de Villanueva en Chinandega se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos en su casa de habitación desde hace 5 años comenzando su negocio con pocas ventas que a través del tiempo ha venido mejorando hasta alcanzar comprar dos vitrinas y un estante que es lo que ella posee hasta ahora.

Es madre casada y con tres hijos a su cargo el cual en conjunto con su esposo se esfuerzan para proporcionarles un mejor nivel de vida y así puedan llegar a ser grandes profesionales. Para ver este sueño hecho realidad ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan comprar la mercadería y así ofrecerla a sus fieles clientes. Es necesario destacar que ella ha realizado 5 créditos habiéndose cancelado satisfactoriamente en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en:
Hisham is a 30 year old man. He lives in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh.

Hisham owns a van that is used for student transportion. He also owns an aluminum workshop. This is the first time he has asked for a loan from Al Majmoua. With the loan, he is planning to do work on his house. He will use his business profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: To do work on his house

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 42-year-old Zainabu K.. She is married and has four children aged between 16 and 24. She has two other dependents, children who live with her because their parents died of HIV/AIDS. In 2008, Zainabu opened a general store. Working six days a week, and nine to 12 hours a day, she earns about $130 every month from this business. Her husband helps her run this shop. Zainabu has applied for a loan to buy additional stocks of rice, cooking oil and soap. She hopes that this loan will allow her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $45. In the future, Zainabu plans to renovate her shop and increase the quantity and range of items she has for sale. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To make bulk purchases of rice, cooking oil and soap.

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Group

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Karla L. me dedico a la produccion y venta de pastelitos de carne, pastelitos dulces y pan de levadura, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, mi producto lo reparto en diferentes pulperias de colonias y a mis vecinos tambien reparto mi producto en la Universidad Nacional Pedagogica de Honduras Francisco Morazan, por lo que estoy solicitando la ayuda para poder incrementar mi produccion ya que la demanda es bastante grande, mi producto se vende porque es bien higienico y barato.

loans.use: compra de manteca, sal, aceite, harina de trigo, coco, minimos, leña, azucar, levadura, condimentos, carne de res y cerdo

loans.name: 24 De Enero- De Panamericana Group

texts.es:
The "24 de Enero- De Panamericana" (Panamerican January 24th) association consists of 12 active members who work next to the Pro-Mujer family in the center of the Panamerican city of El Alto. The day starts very early for the association, since they make their living selling vegetables and fruits in the La Ceja Street Market in El Alto. They obtain products from wholesalers, and then sell them retail. In general they generate sufficient income to cover their daily expenses, but now they wish to invest in order to provide an additional variety of products, to expand their businesses, generate increased income, and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

La asociación 24 de enero de Panamericana esta formada por 12 miembros activos que trabajan junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer en el centro focal de Panamericana de la ciudad de El Alto. Muy temprano comienza el día para la asociación 24 de Enero, ya que se dedican a la venta de verduras y fruta en la feria de la Ceja de El Alto, adquieren productos de mayoristas, para luego vender éstos al por menor por lo general ellas generan ingresos suficientes para sus gastos diarios , pero ahora quieren invertir para proveerse de otra variedad de productos para ampliar sus negocios y asi les permita generar mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Capital for purchasing products

loans.name: Mwanjab's Tuwe Pamoja Group

texts.en:
Mwanjab is 28 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 9, 5, and 3 years old. She has been a clothes (khanga: traditional Tanzanian cloth worn as a wrap) seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 9am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 250 from her sales.

Mwanjab now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes (khanga) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Zainab and Fatma, who have businesses dealing with kiosk ownership and clothing sales.

loans.use: To  buy more clothes (khanga) for her business

loans.name: Met

texts.en: Mrs. Met N., 56, and her husband, Mr. San Sat, make jar (made from cement and sand). She sells it from her house and also takes it to customers' homes. Met has six children, three of whom are married. Three others stay home; one is a student and two help in their parent's business. Together they earn approximately US$9.00 per day. Met faces difficulty with transporting jar to sell due to the fact that her existing motorcycle is very old. So Met would like to request a loan of US$800 to purchase a second-hand motorcycle with a trailer to use instead to transport jar to sell. Met and her family live in Roleap Commune, Pursat Province.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorcycle with trailer to instead to use to transport jars to sell

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Mrs. Nan N. is a 44-year-old widow who sells vegetables in her area market for a living. Indeed, she has been selling vegetables at the market since 2005, and she generally earns approximately US$4 per day. She has four children, all of whom live at home with her in Rokar Khpurs Commune, Kandal Province. Moreover, she notes that three of her children are bricklayers, and that they each generate approximately US$75 of income per month.

Nan needs a loan in the amount of US$700 to purchase a trailer to use in conjunction with her motorcycle to transport vegetables to sell in the market.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to use in conjunction with her motorcycle in order to transport vegetables to sell in the market.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao N., 57, is married and resides with her husband and two children in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1987, she has been selling sugarcane in the market and is able to make US$3.50 per day, while her husband is a farmer and raises cows at home. Everyday, he just earns US$1. This couple also gets support from their children who work as construction workers. Both of them can make US$5 a day. Mao N. said on average she spends US$40 on food and US$15 on transportation. To make more money she would like to take out a loan of US$500 to purchase more sugarcane from individual growers for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more sugarcane.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose D., 42-year-old mother of four children from Fatima, General Santos City, never stops dreaming that her children will earn a degree in college and have a good future. Her husband, a private employee, has been helping her run their store, where they earned enough for them to address their needs. 

She sells variety of goods in her store, catering to all of her neighbors and friends as customers. She aspires to expand her business to send all of her children to school.

She is requesting a loan to purchase additional items to sell in her store.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Đô Thi Thuy Group

texts.vi:
Đỗ Thị Thuỷ sinh năm 1965 ( Mã số: 010107050032). Chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con tại Văn Thượng, Xuân Canh, Đông Anh, Hà Nội. Chồng chị làm thợ xây có thu nhập theo ngày, bản than chị tăng gia sản xuất và đi chợ rau. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.000.000 vnđ /tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 5.014.000 vnđ đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn và bò. Trong nhóm vay cùng chị còn có:
 Bùi Thị Điệp sinh năm 19( Mã số: 010107050034 ).  , tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn và đi chợ.
 Hoàng Thị Cúc sinh năm 1958 ( Mã số: 010107050033 ). Chị có cửa hàng ăn phục vụ bà con trong thôn. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 200.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư vào cửa hàng 
 Hoàng Thị N. sinh năm 1980( Mã số: 010107050036 ).  . Gia đình chị chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp. Hàng ngày chị đi chợ buôn bán gà và chăn nuôi. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đi chợ.
 Hoàng Thị Lê sinh năm 1946( Mã số: 010107050027 ).  Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi gà đẻ.
 Đào Thị N. sinh năm 1976( Mã số: 010107050030 ).  Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để nuôi vịt đẻ trứng.
Nguyễn Thị Huyền sinh năm 1971 ( Mã số: 010107050035 ). Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 5.014.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi lợn, gà.
Nguyễn Thị Ngân sinh năm 1973 ( Mã số: 010107050028 ). Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 5.014.000 vnđ để đầu tư vào cửa hàng giải khát( bán bánh kẹo, bia, nước ngọt,…)

loans.use: raising arnimals

loans.name: Daniel Enrique

texts.es:
Daniel es socio del Bancomunal Las Amigas 
Daniel es conviviente, tiene 39 años, cuatro hijos, de 19 y 17 trabajan, su hijo de 15 años no quiere estudiar, y el de 11 años esta en la escuela.  
Daniel  es de Lima, solo estudió hasta el tercero de secundaria, por falta de dinero, trabajó en varios oficios pero a los veinte años se dedico a ser cachinero, (la persona que recolecta fierro, botellas, papeles)

Daniel conoció a su esposa comprando chatarra por las calles. Han alquilado un local hace un año y medio, ella es la cajera, ahora vende cada semana una tonelada de fierro, papel, o plástico. Según como junten, ya tiene clientes fijos que cada semana lo buscan para comprarle.
Daniel necesita un crédito de 600 soles, para comprar chatarra, plásticos fierro.
texts.en:
Daniel is a member of the communal bank Las Amigas. Daniel is married, 39 years old and has 4 children. The 19 and 17-year olds work, his 15 year-old son doesn't want to study and his 11 year-old is in school. Daniel is from Lima, he only studied until the third year of high school because he lacked the money and he worked in various trades until he was 20 years old when he dedicated himself to being a cahinero, or a person who collects iron, bottles and plastic. Depending on how much they collect, they already have secured clients that look for them every week to buy from them. Daniel needs a loan of 600 soles to buy scrap metal, iron and plastics.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Daniel needs a loan of 600 soles to buy scrap, plastic, iron

loans.name: Sadullo

texts.ru: Норов Саъдулло проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 35 лет. Женат и имеет троих детей. Имеет микроавтобус , который испольпользует для перевозки пассажиров. Сейчас хочет сделать ремонт своей автомашины, для чего и запрашивает кредит. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sadullo N. lives in Gissar. He is 35 years old and is married with three children. He has a minivan which he uses as a taxi. Sadullo is applying for a loan in order to do car maintenance. He would be able to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: car maintenance

loans.name: Marvis

texts.en: Marvis O. sells jewelry. She travels to Togo and Ghana to purchase her jewelry to sell in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She is 45 years old and married with five children. She has applied for a loan for 140,000 NGN to purchase more jewelry to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelery to sell

loans.name: Delia Rufina

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita.
Delia es viuda, tiene 56 años y 5 hijos, Delia tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 D. abril en donD. venD. comida, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. su hermana.
Delia necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños D. delia son aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the Morenita Communal Bank.
Delia is 56 years old, a widow and has 5 children. Delia has a stall in the 12 D. Abril market, where she sells food every day with her sister’s help.
Delia needs a 1000 soles loan to purchase rice and sugar. Delia dreams of expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice and sugar.

loans.name: Dame

texts.fr: Monsieur Dama S. est un homme marié qui a 35 ans, il habite au quartier Malamy Senghor de Thiès, il est boutiquier juste à coté de la caisse Jammy Xaleyi  et a décidé d’intégrer l’IMCEC  pour développer son commerce. Il est à son premier prêt  avec lequel il veut renforcer sa boutique, il réalise un bon chiffre d’affaire d’où un bénéfice de 150000fcfa. Ce bénéfice lui permet de rembourser les intérêts du prêt, d’entretenir sa famille et aussi d'investir  le reste dans sa boutique
texts.en:
Mr. Dama S. is a married man who is 35 years old. He lives in the Malamy Senghor district of Thiès and is a shopkeeper located next to the Jammy Xaleyi bank. He decided to join IMCEC to develop his commerce. He's on his first loan, with which he wants to enhance his shop. He's realizing good sales figures resulting in a profit of 150,000 francs CFA. This profit enables him to make loan interest payments, to care for his family, and also to invest the rest in his shop.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enhance his shop

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sudantri

texts.en: Ni Ketut Sudantri - (DNR.M-0668) is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Candikusuma - Melaya. She is married and has a school-aged child. Ni Ketut Sudantri raises pigs for sale and has been engaged in this business for over five years, earning approximately 200,000 IDR a month. In 2008, Ni Ketut Sudantri joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be her 2nd loan from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Ni Ketut Sudantri - (DNR.M-0668) merupakan 39 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Candikusuma - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Ketut Sudantri memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Ketut Sudantri sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut Sudantri menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2008, Ni Ketut Sudantri bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Ketut Sudantri telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Ketut Sudantri berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk membayar biaya sekolah anak-anak peminjam. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Cisnes De Casacada Group

texts.es:
En la urbanización 6 de junio de la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra el centro focal Cascada a este pertenece la asociación “Cisnes de Cascada”, integrado por doce miembros, trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer hace mas  de ocho años cumpliendo sus actividades internas de forma responsable.
Diversos son los negocios que hay en este grupo, por ejemplo se dedican al trenzado de mantas, confección de polleras, venta de ropa de invierno, venta de gorras, entre otros.
Necesitan comprar materia prima y/o mercadería para poder aumentar sus ventas, de este modo generar mayores ingresos que les permita cubrir necesidades básicas en sus hogares.
texts.en:
In the housing development 6 de Junio in the city of El Alto, you will find the focal centre of Cascada, to which pertains the association 'Cisnes de Cascada'. Made up of 12 members, they have worked together with Pro-Mujer for more than 8 years, achieving their domestic activities in a responsible way. The businesses that exist in this group are diverse, for example some work plaiting blankets, selling chickens, selling winter clothing, selling hats, among others. They need to buy raw material and/or groceries to be able to increase their sales, and by this mode generate better income which will permit them to cover the basic necessities of their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material and/or groceries

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero makes a living selling groceries and various other provisions. She is 32 years old, married and has three children. She is applying for this loan to buy more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support and assistance.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell to her customers

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa B. is from the village of Purok 8C, Barangay Santiago, Iligan City. She is 45 years old. Teresa is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresa owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, selling fish through peddling. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish in the local community. Teresa has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In June 2009, Teresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Teresa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and supplement the family income.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish and aquatic resources to sell

location.town: Purok 8C, Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Anara's Group

texts.en:
Anara is the group leader. She is 57 and divorced; her son and daughter are adults. They work and live separately from her. Usually women of her age are already retired and do not work, they depend on their children. However, Anara is not like that - all her life she depended only on herself and got used to it. Now, she earns her living by selling milk from her cows. Sometimes, her children come from the city to help her around the house. Six years ago, her relatives advised her to buy a cow. Now, keeping this cow lets her live an independent humble life. Now she courageously seeks a loan to help her two grandchildren pay for their college education. After having some experience with keeping cows, she seriously got interested in raising cattle. Her ultimate dream is to buy a big house outside the capital to be near her children, so that her grandchildren could visit her more often.

Anara’s partners in the group are Lyubov, Ainakan, Nazgul and Jiparkul. Lyubov is 51. She and her husband work at school. All their children live separately. Two sons are in Russia, while other two sons work as drivers, and their daughter works at school. Lyubov needs a loan to buy a new fridge. 

Ainakan is divorced; she raised three children. She works as a tailor, receiving orders for manufactured or ready-made garments. She then distributes products to clothing stores. This was her friend’s suggestion. Now she feels ready to try cattle-raising and therefore needs a loan to buy a calf.

Nazgul is a mother of four children. She makes a living by selling hay and milk. What she earns is not sufficient, so she wants to obtain a loan to send her daughter to work in Russia, so that her daughter can help her mother financially.   

Jipargul is 50. She is divorced and has one daughter. She makes a living by selling hay. Jipargul needs a loan to prepare her daughter’s dowry.  


======================================
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To pay for college education of 2 grandchildren

loans.name: Sara Dina

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 89351&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Sara es socia del Bancomunal Mi Buen pastor.
Sara Tiene una fuente de soda “la vallita” distribuye a los mercados y a dulcerías,  también se ha puesto a vender productos de belleza por catalogo      
Los préstamos le están ayudando a crecer en su negocio.
Sara necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles, para la compra de insumos y quiere comprar una batidora semindustrial.
El sueño de Sara es tener una dulcería y partería fina, fuera de San Juan.
texts.en:
Click HERE to see the previous loan.

Sara is a member of the Communal Bank Mi Buen Pastor (My Good Shepherd). She operates a soda shop called La Vallita and distributes baked goods to grocery stores and candy shops. In addition, she sells beauty products by catalog. Her previous loans have helped her expand her business.

At the moment, Sara needs a loan of 2400 soles to buy supplies and a semi-industrial blender. She dreams of opening a candy store and starting a midwifery practice outside of San Juan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies & a semi-industrial blender

loans.name: Marie Pierre

texts.fr: Marie Pierre N. est âgée de 50 ans, célibataire et sans enfant. Elle fait du commerce de fruits de saison : mangues, pastèque, orange, mandarine). Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins.

loans.use: Vente de fruits de saison

loans.name: Omolayo

texts.en:
Omolayo sells plastics and cooking utensils like pots, plates, etc. She also sells hair extensions. She started this business nine years ago.

Omolayo hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more hair extensions and plastics to sell. She is 40 years old and married with three children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Mary  Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose M. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 29 years old. Mary Rose is single and has four infant children. To make a living, Mary Rose owns and operates a business that makes and sells food. The main source of income comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Mary Rose has been in business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Mary Rose joined HSPFI to access financial services, improve her living situation and to engage in business. Mary Rose is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business. --------------- About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La señora MARCELINA B. B. , tiene 52 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES VALEROSAS. La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de Secundaria. Es viuda desde hace 8 años  y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales a 2 apoya económicamente ayudándolos  que abran su propio negocio.
MARCELINA se dedica a la compra y venta de menestras como papas, yucas, harinas que trae de la sierra y los vende al por mayor.
También es socia de su hermano con quien compran madera la por mayor.
Actualmente se encuentra delicada de salud porque hace 1 mes se cayo de las escaleras ocasionándole una hematoma en la pierna izquierda por lo cual no a podido viajar a traer su mercadería pero refiere que el 15 del presente mes viajara a traer su mercadería.
El primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de sacos de chocho y harinas.
Este crédito de 800 nuevos soles lo utilizará en la compra de menestras, chocho, harinas, etc.
La empresaria sueña con aumentar sus ventas, empezar a vender al por mayor para así generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Marcelina B. Briceño is 52 years old and lives in the District of Trujillo, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Valerosas” (Courageous Women). Marcelina completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She has been a widow for 8 years and has 5 children, of whom 2 she support financially by helping them start their own businesses. Marcelina buys and sells dried vegetables such as potatoes and cassava, as well as flour. She brings her products from the mountains and then sells them wholesale. Her sister is also a Communal Bank member and sells wood wholesale. Marcelina is currently in fragile health because she fell from the stairs a month ago, causing a hematoma in her left leg. As a result, she is not able to travel in order to acquire her products for resale. Her next trip is scheduled for the 15th of the month. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase sacks of flour and candy. Marcelina is requesting another loan of 800 soles to buy dried vegetables, candy, flour, and other items. She dreams of increasing her sales and becoming a wholesale vendor so that she can generate more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dried vegetables, candy, flour, and other items

loans.name: Peter Macharia

texts.en:
Peter is 25 years old and has been in the butchery business for two years. His butcher shop is his main source of income, from which he earns around 10,000 Kenya Shillings a month. Peter's other source of income comes from farming, from which he earns approximately 5,000 Kenya Shillings a month. 

This is Peter's first loan, and he will use it to renovate his butcher shop. He wants to repair the cracked, uneven floor and build a proper enclosure for the meat he sells. Peter's clients live in a very low income settlement.

One day, Peter hopes to buy live animals to slaughter and sell to retailers.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To renovate his butchery shop

loans.name: Lorena Elizabeth

texts.es:
El banco Comunal Mujeres D. Nuevo Milenio está ubicado en el cantón Montecristi en la bella y productiva provincia de Manabí en la región costa D. Ecuador,  ésta región se caracteriza por sus artesanos que elaboran los tan famosos sombreros de paja toquilla tan conocidos en el mundo entero, sus platos típicos, la belleza natural y la amabilidad de la gente. 

Este banco lo formaron mujeres emprendedoras en busca de una mejor calidad de vida junto a sus familias, es así como  nos pusimos en contacto con la socia Lorena Elizabeth D. S., madre soltera de dos niños comparte sus actividades entre los quehaceres D. hogar, el cuidado de sus hijos y su labor como comerciante,  compra y vende mercadería como prendas de vestir, ropa casual, deportiva e interiores para damas caballeros y niños,  cosméticos Yanbal, etc. esta actividad la realiza de forma ambulante en la misma localidad donde vive, para poder vender facilita a sus clientes la forma de pago cobrando por semana o quincena así los clientes quedan satisfechos.

Lorena esta preparándose para ser una profesional, ha empezado a estudiar en la Universidad de Manta la especialidad en Servicios Gerenciales,   en su  tiempo de trabajo y estudio su madre le ayuda con el cuidado de los niños ya que viven junto a ellos  todavía, manifiesta  que no ha sido nada fácil enfrentarse en la vida con dos pequeños  pero ellos son su inspiración para salir a trabajar todos los días.

Nuestra socia Lorena está solicitando un préstamo a la Fundación Espoir con la cual ha venido trabajando desde hace  tres ciclos y los créditos obtenidos ha invertido en su negocio, ahora comprará mercadería surtida como pantalones jeans, camisas, blusas, interiores, etc. para damas caballeros y niños para la época de  navidad y para entregar algunos pedidos pendientes de sus clientes.

El sueño de Lorena es ponerse una tienda grande de ropa para seguir manteniendo a sus hijos y cubrir sus gastos de estudios.
texts.en:
The Women of the New Millennium Communal Bank is located in the Montecristi division of the beautiful and bountiful province of Manabí, located in Ecuador’s coastal region. This area is known for its handicrafts (the best straw hats in the world), traditional dishes, natural beauty, and friendly people.

This Communal Bank consists of enterprising women who are looking to provide their families with a better quality of life. One of these women is Lorena Elizabeth D. S., a single mother of two children. She divides her time among her household chores, looking after children, and her work as a retailer. Lorena buys and sells merchandise such as dress clothes, casual wear, sportswear, and undergarments for women, men, and children. In addition, she offers Yanbal cosmetics. She sells her products as a traveling merchant in the neighborhood where she lives. To keep her customers happy, she allows them to pay her on a weekly or biweekly schedule.

Lorena is preparing to become a professional. She started her studies at the University of Manta for a degree in Management Services. When she has to work or study, Lorena’s mother looks after her children since they already live together. Lorena says living with two small children is not easy, but they provide the inspiration for her to go to work every day.

Lorena is requesting another loan from Fundación ESPOIR. She worked on three previous loan cycles and used the proceeds to invest in her business. With this loan, she plans to buy merchandise to add to her inventory such as jeans, shirts, blouses, underwear, and other items for women, men, and children. This will allow her to be prepared for the Christmas season and fulfill some of her outstanding customer orders.

She dreams of opening a large clothing store so that she can continue supporting her children and cover her educational expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise for the Christmas season

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
When Ramon was laid off from his job in 2005, he decided to become a taxi driver in order to earn enough income to support his family. He has successfully made a steady income since then, but he says one of the main challenges of being a taxi driver is keeping his vehicle in good shape. Since he drives it all day, it is constantly breaking down. Now, he is going to use his loan from ACCION USA to pay for repairs to his car. He is a return client, but has also used credit cards to pay for repairs in the past. With credit cards, he tries to pay his full balance at the end of the month because of the high interest charges.

Ramon does not want to be a taxi driver forever - he has big dreams to open his own business one day, in an entirely different industry - a restaurant! He hopes that when he decides to do this and has saved enough money, he will be able to get help from ACCION USA to start up the business.

More about ACCION USA and the underbanked in the United States

Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent on a monthly basis got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated 10 million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis.” Microfinance institutions like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low-income neighborhoods and rebuild the U.S. economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides low to moderate income workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Ramon from  United States

loans.use: Repairs to his taxi

loans.name: Dib

texts.en: Dib has been working as a car painter and repairman since 2000. He is a 27-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. Dib does good work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. Dib decided on this business because he wanted to have independent work. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to purchase all the needed tools for his garage. Dib requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his third loan cycle and he has always repaid on time. In the future, he plans on improving his business by purchasing more sophisticated tools.

loans.use: To purchase all the needed tools for his garage

loans.name: Willian Jhonattan

texts.es: Willian tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero vive en casa de sus padres. Willian se encuentra realizando practicas en la Universidad San Luís Gonzaga de Ica. El inició su negocio hace 3 años, con un capital pequeño producto de sus ahorros y poco a poco ha ido incrementando su negocio, Willian con los ingresos que tiene en su bodega se ha costeado sus estudios en dicha universidad. El le pone mucho empeño a su trabajo como practicante y a los clientes que concurren a su negocio les brinda una buena atención tanto el como su mama y hermana que le ayudan en la atención del negocio, ahorra al máximo el dinero que obtiene de las ventas de su bodega el cual lo vuelve a invertir. El sueño a futuro de Willian es llegar a superarse como profesional y así poder ayudar a que su hermana menor pueda estudia una profesión, y ayudar a su madre. Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería, las cuales venderá en la temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Willian, 22, is single and lives with his parents. He is enrolled in workshops at the San Luís Gonzaga University in Ica. He began his business 3 years ago with a small capital investment that came from his savings. Little by little his business has grown. Willian has paid for his courses at the university with profits from his store. He puts a lot of effort into his work and he, along with his mother and sister, who help him at work, gives very good service to his customers. He saves the most he's able and he reinvests it into his store. Willian's dream for the future is to excel as a professional in order to help his youngest sister study a profession and to help his mother. He requests funding to buy stock items to sell during the Chistmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Ana M. se ha destacado en la actividad de venta de frutas y verduras teniendo su propio establecimiento en el que se esfuerza a diario para obtener los ingresos para el sustento de su hogar.

Ella es una persona muy dedicada al trabajo y siempre está pensando la manera de ir mejorando poco a poco. La razón por la que solicita el crédito es para la compra de naranjas dulces para ofrecerlas en el mercado y de esta manera generar las utilidades para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
In the wholesale market of the city of Managua, Ana M. has excelled in the activity of selling fruits and vegetables, having her own business in which she works daily in order to obtain income to sustain her household. She is a person who is very dedicated to her work and is always thinking about ways to gradually improve. The reason that she requests this loan is to buy sweet oranges to offer them for sale in the market and in this way generate earnings for the welfare of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Esterlita's Group

texts.en:
Esterlita S. is from the village of Lilo-an Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Esterlita is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Esterlita is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Esterlita owns and operates a general store, selling products such as biscuits, eggs, coffee, candies, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $112 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Esterlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.en:
This group was formed by Teresa P., a resident of the Virgen del Rosario neighborhood in the city of Coronel Oviedo. She approached Fundación Paraguaya to learn more about its Committee of Enterprising Women program, and then invited her friends and neighbors to form a group in order to get ahead and improve their quality of life. The group is made up of 20 very hard-working, humble women who work every day to earn a living.
 The loan the group took out from Fundación Paraguaya was disbursed among them, and each member invested the money in their respective business. 
 One of the group members is Gloria, who sews high-fashion wedding dresses and evening gowns. Her work is impeccable and very valuable. She does very lovely embroidery and designs, so she has many clients. She used her loan to buy the materials she needs, like colored thread, beads for embroidery, and fabric. 
Each one of the group members works at their respective job to support their family:
1. Teresa P.: Grocery store 
2. Aurelia B.: Clothing sales
