3. Blanca V.: Fast food sales
4. Gloria M.: Fashion designer
5. Laura B.: Fruit and vegetable sales
6. Edelida M.: Grocery store
7. Edith V.: Hardware store
8. Elva González: Fruit and vegetable sales
9. Mª Graciela Arzamendia: Food sales
10. Estelbina B.: Grocery store
11. Graciela R. Díaz: Food sales
12. Laura A.: Food sales
13. Mirna M.: Fashion designer
14. Del Rosario P.: Street vendor
15. Zoraida I.: Food sales
16. Nilda L.: Grocery store
17. Liz V.: Hardware store
18. Celsa O.: Fast food
19. Celia Z.: Fashion designer
20. Mª Ilda Z.: Food sales

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread and accessories

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
At 74, the role of being a mother has never ended yet for Ofelia C.. Though her eldest 46-year-old child and her family live along with her and the rest of her six children whose ages range from 31 to 45 years old, and they incur a large amount of daily expenses, Ofelia feels happy being with them always and being a mother to them. None of her children has reached college. Though they went to a high school, they were not able to graduate thus being employed in an office is impossible for them. However, Ofelia’s children are hard working and know how to earn money in a hard way and be able to survive their everyday lives in spite of poverty. Despite that fact, she still wants her small “sari-sari” (variety) store to grow to a grocery store with large volume of inventory. She also wants her fishing business to grow by purchasing her own fishing boat to be managed by her male children. For this to materialize, she is requesting a larger loan from Kiva through ASHI. 

Ofelia and her children are very much hopeful that someday, through their business finance with her loans, they will be able to improve their standard of living and will share some of her profits with her children and grandchildren by providing them with their daily needs. Though they will not be as wealthy as other people in their village, at least they will live a peaceful kind of life.

loans.use: To purchase a boat for fishing and inventory for her store

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: This is Mr. Kung C., who is a villager living in Andoung Samretth in Takeo province.  Born in 1962, he is a widower who lives with three children: one  is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a driver who earns a low salary, and the third is a Khmer cake seller. Mr. Kung C. is a farmer who owns 2.5-hectares of land to cultivate rice to support his family. Although they try to work hard, the family earns little income.  Mr. Kung C. wants to start a new business, but the family does not have enough money. Thus, he decided to apply for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and to plow his field for farming.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Elva Sonia

texts.es:
La Sra. Elva vive en casa familiar y se encuentra casada con don Horacio que trabaja como ejecutivo de ventas en Multivisión con el que tiene dos hijos que se ecuentran en edad escolar, la Sra. Elva tiene como actividad la venta de pollos a la Broaster en un restaurante que se encuentra en su domicilio, actividad que lo realiza todos los dias a partir de las 17:00 horas hasta largas horas de la noche y tambien tiene 2 vehiculos de los que recibe la renta diaria de sus vehiculos que trabajan en Radio Taxi, esta empresa de radiotaxi es propiedad de su Tio.

El crédito solicitado es para comprar mercaderia para su negocio de venta de pollos a la broaster, el mismo que se encuentra ubicado en la calle Buenos Aires en la zona Tiwiña, que es la casa de sus papas, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Elva lives in her family’s house. She is married to Horacio, a sales executive with Multivisión. They have two school-age children. Elva sells roasted chickens in a restaurant in her home. She does this everyday from 5:00 p.m. until late at night. She also has two vehicles, and she receives daily rent for them from Radio Taxi. The Radio Taxi business is her uncle’s. The loan she has requested is to buy merchandise for her business of selling roasted chickens. The business is located on Buenos Aires Street in the Tiwiña area in her parents’ house. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in giving her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka J. T. is a 30-year-old lady who is married to Abraham T.. They have three children. She lives in Kaiboi, where she does tea farming and plants short seasonal crops like maize and beans. She also practices dairy farming and sells the milk to Kenya Cooperative Creameries, a milk-processing factory in Kenya.  

Milka was introduced to KADET by a women's group that consisted of some of her customers. She has applied for a loan, which she will use to prepare her 5 acres for planting maize and beans, to start poultry farming and to buy two more dairy cows.

Milka plans to become independent and generate more income from her different businesses so that she can pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To prepare her 5 acres for planting maize and beans and to start poultry farming

loans.name: Jane Warigia

texts.en:
Jane Warigia is a 29-year-old married business lady.  She has a shop where she sells cooking fat, cooking flour, and body lotions to her clients in Shauro Moyo, Nairobi. She has been in the business for a period of eight years now, with a monthly profit of 42,000 Kenya shillings.

She was introduced to KADET by an existing client. She wants to use her loan to buy more stock of cooking fat, cooking flour, and body lotions. 

Jane is ambitious and hard-working and wants to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add stock of cooking flour, cooking fat and body lotions

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de  48 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y persistente, vive en la casa de sus padres  pues es separado.Es periodista de profesión, y trabaja en una empresa que instaló, desde hace 7 años, en sociedad  con algunos amigos. Actualmente brinda servicios de publicidad, pues realiza banderolas, trípticos, volantes, almanaques y diferente  material corporativo. Gracias a su profesión también produce un diario local, que se distribuye por la zona donde vive. Juan siempre busca la manera de mejorar su trabajo, es por esta razón que desea  mejorar los materiales que produce, y además quiere incursionar con fuerza en las próximas campañas políticas para  las elecciones municipales que ya se aproximan. Sabe que aún le falta mucho trabajo por realizar, pero también se siente muy contento por las mejoras que viene logrando.Es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Juan tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  material de publicidad, (papelería)  al por mayor, para de esta manera  mejorar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Juan, 48 years old, is a very hard-working and determined man. He lives with his parents and is divorced. He is a journalist, and works for a company that he created 7 years ago with some friends. He currently offers publicity services; he makes banners, leaflets, calendars and other such materials. As a journalist, he produces a local daily paper which is issued in the area where he lives. Juan is always looking for ways to improve his work, and he wants to improve the materials he produces. He also wants to be strongly involved in the next political campaigns for the upcoming municipal elections. He knows that there is even more work he could be doing, but he is also very happy with the improvements he is making. This is his sixth loan with MFP and he promises to be punctual with his repayments. Juan plans to invest the requested loan in purchasing paper wholesale, in order to improve his product.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase material (paper) for his publicity work

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: La Señora Maria De Los Ángeles es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo menor de edad. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de leña y cerdo, por lo que esta muy contenta con su negocio, pues ella es la propia dueña del local. Por lo que siempre está  atenta con su trabajo y lo que sus clientes le soliciten nunca deja de lado los trabajos que se le presentan, pues es muy empeñosa y siempre trata de salir adelante. En un futuro le gustaría establecer un negocio como pulpería, por ahora continuará trabajando y vendiendo sus productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima necesaria.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria De Los Ángeles is a single mother of a young child. For the past four years she has been selling firewood and pigs, and is very happy with her business since she is the owner of her location. Maria is always focused on her work and her customers’ requests. She is a hard worker who never neglects her job and always tries to get ahead. In the future she wants to establish a business, such as a grocery store, but for now she will continue working to sell her products. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy the materials she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 38 year-old woman who sells clothing. She has been in business for 10 years and sells both men’s and women’s clothing in a busy market.  Her biggest business challenges are lots of competition and the high cost of new clothes that her customers can afford. She is married and has four children, one boy and 3 girls, aged between 10 and 18. 

Irene plans to use the 60,000 Kenya Shilling loan to purchase new clothing stock and more recent fashions. She hopes to become the leading provider of new, fashionable clothes in town. In five years, she dreams of expanding and opening a boutique to better serve her clients.

loans.use: To increase and vary her inventory

loans.name: Amtullah's Group

texts.en:
Amtullah is a resident of the city of Pakpattan in Pakistan. Pakpattan is famous for its sugar and it's shrines to the saints.

Amtullah and her husband own & operate a vegetable selling business. They have a cart on which they sell their vegetable stock. They sell to their community. Amtullah helps him in this business and sells the vegetables in his absence. In this way they meet the financial expenses of their family.

Amtullah has applied for a loan from Asasah for their vegetable selling business. With the loan amount they will buy seasonal vegetables in bulk and be able to increase the amount they can sell.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal vegetables for the vegetable selling business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia M. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Balisong, Brgy Libacao, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures:   swine raising, rental of a water pump, and farming businesses.  Her husband Jose M., who is 58 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living.  They have  5 children who are 18 to  28 years old. 

Lucia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lucia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for their future and purchase a motorcycle. Lucia M. is a 'Dungganon' woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis nació en el distrito de Yucay  provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco, Perú  y tiene 76 años. Actualmente, Cesar vive en la ciudad del Cusco y su esposa vive en Yucay. Hace muchos años atrás se casaron y fruto de este matrimonio tuvieron cuatro hijos de las cuales todos y son independientes. Cesar y su esposa, entregaron lo mejor de ellos, para sacar adelante a sus hijos y hoy en día se sienten orgullos de sus hijos porque la mayoría son profesionales.   

Luis y su esposa tienen una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en la ciudad de Yucay, donde venden comestibles a sus vecinos y amigos. Cesar también se dedica  a la sastrería, donde confecciona ternos. Le pueden encontrar en su negocio, que está ubicado en la ciudad de Cusco en el distrito de Wanchaq, los 7 días de la semana, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Cesar que espera recibir S/. 1o00 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y muchas cosas que servirán para abastecer la tienda.

El banco comunal “Cusi Ccoyllor de Chinchero” tiene dos años y medio de funcionamiento, Luis pertenece desde hace dos años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. El nombre del banco comunal es un término que en quechua (el idioma autóctono) significa “Princesa Hermosa de Chichero”.
texts.en:
Luis wasborn in the Yucay district, Urabamba province, in Cusco department, Perú. He is 76 years old. Luis lives in Cusco city and his wife lives in Yucay. They married many years ago and the fruit of this marriage was 4 children who are all independent. Cesar and his wife gave the best of everything to them to allow them to improve themselves and today feel very proud of their children because the majority are professionals. Luis and his wife have a small grocery store in Yucay city where they sell food and grocery items to their neighbours and friends. Cesar also has a tailor's shop where he makes suits. You can find him in his shop, located in Cusco city in the Wanchaq district, 7 days a week from 8am until 7pm. With this loan Cesar hopes to receive 1,000 nuevos soles which he would like to use to purchase stock such as rice, sugar, pasta and other things to stock his grocery store. The communal bank "Cusi Ccoyllor de Chinchero" is 2 years old and is functioning. Luis has belonged to the bank for 2 years and is doing very well. The name of this bank is a Quechua term (the indigenous language) meaning "Beautiful Princess of Chinchero".

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stock such as rice, sugar, pasta and others

loans.name: Carmen Olinda

texts.es:
La Sra. H. L. Carmen Olinda se dedica a transporte y solicia el crédito para dar mantemiento a su vehículo y a la vez para realizar acabados en su vivienda.
Tiene dos hijos en edad escolar de 11 y 13 años, su esposo trabaja como minero informal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen Olinda H. L. provides transportation services. She is asking for funds for vehicle maintenance and to do some repairs to her house. She has two school aged children who are 11 and 13 years of age. Her husband occasionally works as a miner.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and home repair.

loans.name: Damiran

texts.en:
Damiran N., age 51, lives with his wife and four sons, whose ages range from 21 to 28, in their own traditional housing tent called a ger in Uvs province, western Mongolia. All of his sons help him out with his business. The youngest son is a student while his wife works as a saleswoman in their town. 

He began his food retailing business in 2006 and it is now considered the biggest store in his local area. His wife is responsible for managing the food store while Damiran operates a transportation business in his town. His personality is not so polite, but he seems to be good at calculating and estimating and is a responsible person. 

He wants to expand his own food store and manage it sustainably. Damiran is requesting a 4,000,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase food products at wholesale prices from Tashkent, the border city of China, in order to increase his business line.

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa L. is from the town of Banga. She is 49 years old, married and has 6 children. Her eldest is 29 years old and the youngest is 18. To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Elsa also helps her husband at the farm when she has time, mostly with selling their harvest.

Elsa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Elsa is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Hildebrando

texts.es:
Hildebrando es un padre de familia de 59 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito agrícola de Cayaltí, una zona ubicada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a la crianza y venta de animales menores. El los cría en algunos ambientes de su domicilio alimentándolos de granos y pastos naturales. Cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. El  utiliza los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad como una fuente importante de ingresos para sostener la economía de su familia.

Hildebrando desea comprar más animales y alimento balanceado para aumentar su nivel de ventas y percibir un mayor número de ganancias por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles. 

Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y de confianza.
texts.en:
Hildebrando, 59, is a father living with his wife and children in Cayaltí, an agricultural district located over an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the last ten years he has raised small farm animals.   He raises them in his yard feeding them grains and natural grasses.  When they reach a good level of development he sells them to merchants who frequent the area.  He uses income from this activity as an important source of family support.

Hildebrando wants to buy more animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them to increase his sales and profits so he is asking for his first, 1000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

His greatest wish is to continue to grow as a businessman and to be able to provide his family with a better quality of life.  People who know him consider him to be levelheaded and trustworthy.

loans.use: To buy more animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them to increase sales.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith E., from the town of Veruela, is 34 years old, married and has four children aged 17, 13, 11 and 9. Judith and her husband are both farmers, cultivating their land for rice crops. Judith is hoping their harvest will increase, and she also finds ways to earn extra money by cooking food that she sells in their neighborhood.

Judith joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from CEVI, she is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rosa Giovanna

texts.es: ROSA ES UNA MUJER JOVEN TIENE 02 NIÑAS DE 8 Y 4 AÑOS  EN EDAD ESCOLAR, DIA A DIA SE ESFUERZA POR LOGRAR LLEVAR A SUS NIÑAS A LA ESCUELA POR LO QUE DEBE CERRAR UNAS HORAS SU NEGOCIO. ROSA TIENE UN NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE FRUTAS  Y BEBIDAS EN LA CARRETERA CENTRAL SUS CLIENTES SON VIAJEROS QUE CON MUCHO GUSTO CONSUMEN LAS RICAS TUNAS, NISPEROS, CHIRIMOYAS Y BEBIDAS QUE ELLA OFRECE. SU CONYUGUE ES ALBAÑILY LA APOYA EN LOS GASTOS DE CASA. ES UNA BUENA TEMPORADA PARA LA TUNA Y CHIRIMOYAS NOS MANIFIESTA  ROSA. EL PRESTAMO SERA INVERTIDO EN FRUTAS, BEBIDAS Y  GOLOSINAS PARA AMPLIAR SU STOCK Y SATISFACER  ASUS CLIENTES, ELLA SUEÑA  QUE SU NEGOCIO CREZCA Y PUEDA AHORRAR PARA INVERTIR EN UN AUTO PARA COMPRAR SU MERCADERIA. ROSA ESTA CONTENTA CON LOS PRESTAMOS QUE RECIBE DE EDAPROSPO POR QUE SON RAPIDOS  Y HACEN CRECER SU NEGOCIO. EN LA FOTO PODEMOS APRECIAR A ROSA CON SU PEQUEÑA DAYANA MUY CONTENTAS DE SER ENTREVISTADAS.
texts.en: Rosa is a young woman.  She has two daughters aged 8 and 4 who both go to school.  Every day she makes a real effort to take her daughters to school.  It means that she must close her business for a few hours.  Rosa has a business selling fruit and drinks on the main highway.  Her customers are travelers who really enjoy consuming the rich prickly pears, loquats, custard apples and drinks which she offers.  Her husband is a bricklayer and supports her in covering their household expenses.  Rosa tells us that it is a good season for prickly pears and custard apples.  Her loan will be invested in buying fruit, drinks and candies to expand her stock and satisfy her customers.  Her dream is for her business to grow and to be able to save up to buy a car which she can use when buying her merchandise.  Rosa is happy with the loans which she receives from Edaprospo as they are quick and help her business to grow.  In this photo we can see Rosa with little Dayana, both so happy to be interviewed.

loans.use: To buy fruit, drinks and candies

loans.name: Horencia

texts.es: Horencia tiene  56 años, es una mujer muy noble y trabajadora, vive en su casa de sus parientes,  junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella y su esposo poseen una imprenta, en donde su esposo, es quien ejecuta los trabajos, mientras que Horencia es la encargada de buscar clientes que necesiten del servicio que ofrece su imprenta. Paralelo a este trabajo, vende postres típicos de su ciudad, como es el caso de la mazamorra y arroz con leche, de esa manera recorre las calles ofreciendo estos postres. En estos 8 años de trabajo continuo, ella y su pareja han logrado sobresalir, además que este negocio le da mayor rentabilidad durante la temporada navideñas, ya que son mucho los clientes que le mandan a hacer almanaques en mayor número de tirajes. Se considera una mujer independiente y dentro de sus planes es ampliar su taller de impresiones, para que sus hijos también puedan dedicarse a esta actividad y ganarse su propio ingreso. Este es su 18avo crédito con MFP de Horencia,  y está dispuesta a pagar puntualmente su cuota. En su grupo ha demostrado ser una socia muy responsable. Con el crédito que solicita, va comprar los repuestos de Offset y papelería en general,  para que atienda los diversos pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Horencia is 56 years old, and is a very dignified and hardworking woman.  She lives in a house with her relatives, together with her husband and their 2 children.  She and her husband have a printing business, where her husband completes the printing jobs while Horencia is in charge of finding customers who are in need of the services that they offer.  In addition to this work, she sells desserts typical of the city, such as mazamorra and arroz con leche.  She travels the streets offering these desserts.  

In 8 years of continuous work, she and her husband have been able to do very well.  The business is more profitable around Christmas, because there are many customers that ask them to make large orders of yearbooks.   She considers herself an independent woman, and among her plans is increasing the printing workshop so that her children can also participate and earn their own income.  This is her 18th loan with MFP, and she is prepared make her payment punctually.  In her group she has proven to be a very responsible partner.  With the loan that she is asking for, she will buy the Offset repairs and stationary in general, to meet the diverse orders that she has.

loans.use: Buy repairs for the printer and stationary in general.

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old and married.

In 2009, Firas decided to open his own store selling electrical devices. He is well experienced since he used to work in this field before. Now he is becoming well-known in his area and has an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a $3000 loan increase his inventory, advertise, and install more shelves in his store. He is aiming to grow bigger in the future and expand his work.

loans.use: Increase his inventory, advertise, and install more shelves in his store

loans.name: Nhov

texts.en:
Nhov S., 35, is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3.50 per day. S. is married and resides with his wife and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend USD 50 on food, USD 5 on electricity, and USD 35 on other necessary expenses every month. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more supplies to improve his construction business. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house.  This is his second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more construction supplies

loans.name: Munhtsetseg

texts.en:
Munhtsetseg is 27 years old and lives with her mother in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in the Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She operates a dairy products trading business to support her family. She sells a variety of dairy products such as milk, yogurt, and fermented milk, etc. out of a rented stall at the trade center in her district. 

She started her business in 2006 selling dairy products from her home, and since then her business has improved and she has gained much experience. Previously, she obtained loan of 500,000 MNT from our bank to support her business. 

Munhtsetseg says, "All I want is to have my own store in the future." She will use this loan to increase her working capital for her dairy trading business. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase and preserve more dairy products, such as dried curd, melted butter, grease, etc. to sell for the upcoming Tsagaan Sar, the Mongolian new year holiday.

loans.use: To purchase and preserve more dairy products to sell

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo L. is from the village of Olingan, Dipolog City. She is 55 years old. Consuelo is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Consuelo operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste. Consuelo has been engaged in this business for over a year.

In 2010, Consuelo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). 

Consuelo is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Consuelo from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Jaime Israel

texts.es: Jaime tiene 29 años de edad es casado tiene un hijo de meses de nacido ellos viven en casa de sus padres ubicado en Manzanilla Jaime se dedica al transporte el se inicio trabajando en la mototaxi de su suegro actualmete cuenta con dos mototaxis propia en la cual trabaja y la otra la da en alquiler, el financiamiento otorgado sera destinado para la compra de una refrigeradora y una cocina para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa e hijo, se le otorga el financiamiento por contar con buenas referencias,voluntad y capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Jaime is 29 years old, married, and has a son who was born a few months ago.  They live in his parent's house, located in Manzanilla.  

Jaime works in transportation.  He began working on his father-in-law's mototaxi and currently has two mototaxis of his own.  He works with one and rents out the other.  

This loan will be used to purchase a refrigerator and a stove so that his family can have a better quality of life.  He deserves this loan because he has good references and the will and ability to pay.

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator and stove

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda N. is from the village of Brgy. Sto. Domingo West, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 54 years old. Erlinda is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling charcoal to local businesses and community members. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business. This loan will be Erlinda's second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase tools and other equipment to expand her business.

loans.name: Clemencia Victoria

texts.es:
Clemencia Victoria R. M. tiene 42 años, Es Viuda vive con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Clemencia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es incrementar el negocio.

Le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Clemencia Victoria Rodríguez M., 42, is a widow living with her two children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province. 

The members of the “SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS” communal bank located in Amarillos which belongs to Ventanas Canton are short cycle corn and rice farmers.

Clemencia farms corn and rice.  She buys her products at Comercial Murillo and sells them there as well.

She is requesting the loan to plant corn and rice, to buy farming supplies and fertilizer for her crops.   Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The challenges she faces are infestations, illnesses and the variations in the weather.  

Her dream is to expand her business.  She enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is married with four children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is employed and he provides the family with basic needs from his earnings. For the last two years, she has operated a water distribution business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. 

Bahati faces a major challenge of seasonality and electricity black outs. During the dry hot season, the available water for distribution is inadequate to meet the customers' demand. She hopes to expand her business and satisfy her customers' needs.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase water pipes and water purifiers. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes and water purifiers.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 46 años, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 4  hijos en su casa propia. Elena tiene más de 20 años dedicándose a la agricultura, actividad que le ha aportado económicamente y con ello ha logrado mantener a su familia, convirtiéndola en el pilar de su hogar. Ella y su esposo han luchado mucho para sobresalir, ya que esta actividad requiere de esfuerzo y dedicación.  Año tras año supo que hacer, sin descuidar de su hogar, es así que se ganó el respeto de sus hijos a quienes ahora les enseña con ejemplo. Actualmente se dedica al cultivo de la papa y maíz, pero en tiempos de escasez cría cerdos, para cuando tenga alguna dificultad con su producción, vende estos animales para obtener ganancias. Ahora continua trabajando muy duro para seguir adelante buscando el desarrollo de su trabajo y el de su familia. Es su crédito número 8 con MFP, considera que tuvo una buena experiencia de trabajo grupal en su banco comunal porque aprendió a invertir sus ingresos económicos, motivo por el cual agradece y afirma que seguirá trabajando de esa misma manera. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de semillas mejoradas y abono para su campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Elena is 46 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and four children. She has been farming for more than 20 years and has relied on this activity to support her family financially. As a result, she has become the pillar of her home. Elena and her husband have fought hard to succeed since farming requires effort and dedication. Year after year, she continues to work without neglecting her household. Elena has earned the respect of her children and now teaches them by example. At the moment, she is growing potatoes and corn. During scarce periods, she raises pigs that she can sell for when she has trouble with production. She is now working hard so that she can continue developing in her job and with her family.

This is her eighth loan with MFP. Elena considers working with her Communal Bank to be a good experience because she has learned how to invest her income. For this reason, she is grateful and says that she will continue working in the same manner. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of improved seeds and compost for the planting season.

loans.use: To purchase potato seedlings and sacks of compost.

loans.name: Maria Trinidad

texts.es: La Sra. María  es una persona muy seria y trabajadora ella esta casada con el Sr. Jesús y junto a  sus  tres  hijos  forman una  familia, actualmente  tienen  un negocio de  comida  que  es de donde  obtienen  sus  ingresos y  en esta  ocasión solicitan   de  nuestro  apoyo  para  realizar la compra  de mercancía y  así  continuar  ofreciendo  a  sus  pequeños  una excelente  calidad  de   vida.
texts.en: María is a very serious and hard-working person.  She is married to Jesús and they have three children.  They currently have a food business which is where they make their income.  On this occasion, they are requesting our support in buying merchandise so that they can continue offering their little ones an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Amon

texts.en:
Amon is a twenty nine year old married man with three children and he owns a house in Kasese Uganda.  He has been in the retail and cattle rearing business for ten years in which he started with 150,000 shillings and now has 3,500,000 shillings as working capital. 

His hardships are lack of sufficient capital and land for rearing animals.  His dream is rearing frezian cattle, running a wholesale business and educating his children.  Amon needs the loan to buy beers, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: To buy beer, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en: Taghreed is 45 years old and married to Siddeeq who is a 48-year-old mechanic. Taghreed had a lot of free time and wanted to be a productive person in society, but because she was not able to finish school, she was limited in the things she could do.  Taghreed decided to put her skills and hobby into something useful, which is sewing and tailoring. Five years ago, she bought a sewing machine and started tailoring clothes and selling them. Then people came to her asking her to make things other than clothes such as bed covers, special bags for fruits etc. Being able and flexible to serve her customers’ needs has given her an additional point to attract more customers. Today she has applied for a loan to buy more equipment (machines) so she can serve her customers on time and open her own sewing workshop in the future, as she is now working at home. Since Taghreed is a conservative person, her sister Jameeleh agreed to pose in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two siblings. He has been working as a freelance electrician for more than 10 years, sticking with multiple electric projects. He also works as a plumber serving customers upon their request.  

In Lebanon, it is common at all levels of society for people to have multiple businesses to be able to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses. Today, this borrower is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase an air compressor and new tools needed. He feels positive about his business future and looks forward to working on bigger projects.

loans.use: to purchase an air compressor and new tools needed.

loans.name: Mohamed's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you teachers of the Integrated Primary School, based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Teachers and workers of various institutions usually apply for loans from SMT/Kiva lenders. At the end of each month, the bursar or person in charge of paying salaries in the institution will deduct the borrowers’ monthly repayment and pay SMT on their behalf. 

This is the first loan that workers of this school have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. They have requested a loan of SLL 5,000,000. With the help of this loan, these borrowers are in a strong position to buy or invest in something that their mere salaries can not let them do.

Mohamed is the leader of the group. He is age 27. Mohamed was born in a village called Gbatoma, about 58 miles from Kenema. Mohamed is married to a housewife and has one child who is not of school-going age. Mohamed has requested a loan of SLL 1,000,000. With the help of this loan, he will buy house-building materials like iron corrugated zincs, nails, boards, etc.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like iron corrugated zincs, nails, boards, etc.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob has been a mechanic for the past 22 years. He also sells motor vehicle spare parts. He is an aggressive and hard working 49 year old business man. He is married and blessed with six children who are school going. In the next five years, he wants to have trained young mechanics and to have a wholesale shop. His dream is to own his own garage and provide employment for other mechanics.

He wants a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.use: to buy motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis Fernando desde sus 16 años aprendió la labor de latonería y pintura gracias a las enseñanzas de su tío.

El actualmente tiene su propio negocio que es el que le permite tener su sustento diario y el de su hijo, el tiene una buena clientela y es reconocido por su buen servicio y trabajo. Luis Fernando quiere que su negocio cada día crezca mas y sea reconocido y para esto el quiere comprar materia prima que le pueda facilita su trabajo y así ofrecerle a sus clientes un mejor del servicio, además así mejora su calidad de vida ya que se incrementan sus ventas.
texts.en: At the age of 16, Luis Fernando learned how to perform auto paint and body work from his uncle.  He currently has his own business, which allows him to provide for his daily needs and those of his son.  Luis Fernando has a good customer base and is recognized for his good service and quality work.  He wants his business to grow more each day and gain more recognition.  For this reason, he wants to buy more supplies that he needs to facilitate his work.  As a result, he will be able to offer better service to his customers, improve his quality of life, and increase his sales.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for performing paint and body work.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica, tiene 37 años, se caracteriza por ser alegre. Vive junto a su esposo Luis y sus 3 hijos a los que quiere mucho. En armonía familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Patay. Ella es muy feliz, todas las mañanas desde las primeras horas de la mañana junto a su esposo Luis, se dirige a sus sembríos de papa, olluco, arvejas y habas, los cuales siembra en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, que gracias al trabajo conjunto que realizan como socios y esposos lograron adquirir. Ya tienen 11 años dedicándose a la agricultura, y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder pasar la mayor parte de su tiempo en compañía de su familia. Por el desarrollo y éxito de su negocio, desea más adelante ahorrar el dinero suficiente para poder adquirir un camión y, de esa manera minimizar los gastos de trasporte que realizan de la ciudad al mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde lleva a comercializar su cosecha. Además de ayudarle en su negocio de compra y venta de animales, que consiste en llevar toros, vacas, burros y carneros a la feria ganadera que se realiza en la ciudad de Huancayo, donde vende a un buen precio cada ejemplar. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Picaflores de Patay”, y este es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es una socia trabajadora y muy puntual en sus cuotas. Razón por la cual espera del apoyo de todos ustedes en la obtención de un pequeño préstamo. Angélica de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de toros y vacas.
texts.en:
Angelica, 37, is known for being happy. She lives together with her husband, Luis, and her 3 children whom she loves very much. They live in harmony in their own home in the village of Patay. She is very happy. Every morning from very early she goes to work with her husband Luis, managing her crops of potatoes, ulluco, peas, and broad beans. They plant them on their own land which she and her husband were able to acquire thanks to their hard work together as partners and spouses. 

They have been farming for 11 years and what they like most is being able to spend most of their time together as a family. For the development and success of their business, in the future they want to save enough money to be able to buy a truck so that they can reduce the cost of transportation to the wholesale market in the city where they sell their harvest. It would also help with their business buying and selling animals, which consists of carrying bulls, cows, donkeys and rams to the cattle market in the city of Huancayo. There they sell each specimen for a good price. 

She belongs to the village bank "Picaflores de Patay" and this is her 5th loan with MFP where she is a hardworking member and is very punctual in her payments. For this reason she hopes for all of your support in obtaining this small loan. Angelica will invest the requested loan in the purchase of bulls and cows.

loans.use: to buy a bull and a cow.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Ella a sus 28 años y con dos hijos trabaja para ellos en un carro de comidas rápidas en semana al frente de su casa y los fines de semana en el parque principal del municipio de Sonson.

Ella quiere tener mas adelante un restaurante para así poder incrementar sus ingresos y brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y un mejor futuro, pero mientras tanto quiere tener mas variedad de comidas para ofrecer a sus clientes y así empezar a construir su sueño.
texts.en:
Sandra Milena is 28 years old and the mother of two children for whose well-being she works. She sells fast food from her cart: during the week in front of her home and on weekends in the main city park in Sonson.

She wants to have a restaurant later on in order to increase her income and give her children a better quality of life and a brighter future. In the meantime she wants to offer her customers a greater selection of food and start building the object of her dream.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa  lives in Uganda.  She is married and has  three children, two of whom are in school. Hanifa  has a retail shop. She has been in this business for three years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Hanifa sells her products in the shop, retail. 

Hanifa  has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of  soap and cartons of salt. The main business challenges for   Hanifa  include  seasonality and  increasing prices of  commodities.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop. 

Hanifa  lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of soap and cartons of salt.

loans.name: María Avelina

texts.es:
María tiene 51 años es soltera vive con su hijo en Ambato, su hijo tiene la esas de 28 años. María se desribe como una mujer algre y trabajadora.

Trabaja sola durante 15 años en la crianza de animales. Es la segunda vez que trabaja con FODEMI, el crédito que solicita actualmente es para la compra de terneros para seguir con la crianza de animales y aumentar sus ingresos y poder ayudar a su familia.

Su sueño es seguir invirtiendo para aumentar su negocio y obtener más ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old and lives with her son, who is 28 years old, in Ambato. She is described as a happy and hardworking woman.

Maria has worked alone raising animals for 15 years. This is her second loan with Fodemi. She is requesting this current loan to buy calves so that she can continue raising animals thereby increasing her income and her ability to help her family.

Her dream is to continue expanding her business and to make more income so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Hugo René

texts.es:
El señor Hugo es Soltero, domiciliado en la Ciudad de Curuguaty. Es de profesión carpintero con más de 12 años de experiencia, realiza todo tipo de trabajo en madera (muebles finos de cocina, dormitorios, placares en general).
La Carpintería se encuentra ubicado en el predio de la casa de sus padres, donde tiene todas las herramientas, además acaba de comprar una cierra para cortar rollos de madera. Comenta que día a día se esfuerza mucho para poder salir adelante y que gracias a su trabajo sea conocido en el barrio.
Con su trabajo también ayuda a sus padres con los gastos que ellos tienen, pues desea de alguna manera poder retribuirles todo lo que ellos habían gastado por el.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de inmueble que se encuentra ubicado al lado de su vivienda, el cual utilizará para poder ampliar su taller de carpintería. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues de obtener el crédito lo ayudará mucho en su microempresa.
texts.en:
Hugo is single and lives in the town of Curuguatay.  He is a carpenter by profession and has more than 12 years experience.  He carries out all kinds of work in wood (high-quality kitchen furniture, bedroom furniture, wardrobes).

Hugo's carpentry workshop is located on his parents' property where he has all his tools.  He has also just bought a saw for cutting rolls of wood.  He says that he works hard every day to get ahead in life and, thanks to his work, he is well known in his neighborhood.  Through his work, he also helps his parents with their expenses as he would like to somehow be able to return to them all the money that they have spent on him.

Hugo needs this loan to buy some real estate which is located next to his home.  He will use this to expand his carpentry workshop.  He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that they are giving him as this loan will help him a lot in his micro-business.

loans.use: to buy some property to expand his carpentry workshop

loans.name: Mony

texts.en: Mony (in the photo) and her husband, Sarun, have been married since 1995 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both children are garment workers. They are living on an island in the Mekong River approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Mony is a weaver, while her husband is a mason and fisherman. She is applying for another loan of 400 USD. She will use the money to buy weaving materials to continue her weaving business and to buy fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials and fishing nets

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 33-year-old married woman with four school-going children. Her husband Sylvester is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Emily has operated a retail shop for the past twelve years; in addition she also sells piped water. Her potential clients are her neighbors and passers by. She faces a major challenge of transporting her goods from the market place of business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop. 

With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar for resale. She decided to join Yehu because it provides easy access loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 52 years old and married with 1 child.

Liza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business of buying and selling of charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Liza has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been in the business of buying and selling of charcoal for 3 years and also earns an income from fish retail.

Liza aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sinani Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sinani Group in Western Kenya! Ruth is the facilitator of the Sinani group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Ruth takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Ruth had an excellent maize yield harvesting 13 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ruth was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ruth and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Ruth will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sinani group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

She is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, ciudad de  clima cálido y agradable y con una rica gastronomía, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Santo Rosario.

En este lugar vive don Luis, tiene 50 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 9 años de edad, el mismo que estudia en escuela. La esposa es ama de casa.
 
El se dedica al comercio, vende medicinas naturales y ropa de todo tipo, él se desplaza hasta otras ciudades para realizar sus ventas y estas las realiza recorriendo estas ciudades, trabaja tres a cuatro días a la semana, deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 7 años dedicado a este negocio y que le va muy bien ya que con esto ha sacado adelante a su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar más medicinas naturales y ropa de todo tipo. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco  Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy agradables y organizadas.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para realizar sus ventas y visitar a los clientes.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Santo Rosario” meet every 15 days in Andrés De Vera parish in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. For many years, Portoviejo has been known as the "City of the Royal Tamarind Trees". This city has a warm and pleasant climate, and is known for its rich cuisine.

Don Luis lives in this place. He is 50 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has a nine-year-old son who is in school. His wife is a homemaker.

Luis is a merchant who sells natural medicines and all types of clothing. He travels to other cities in order to conduct his sales. Luis works three or four days each week. He extends credit and collects payment on a weekly basis. Luis has been in this business for seven years and has done very well, which has enabled his family to move forward.

This loan will be used to buy more natural medicines and clothes of all types. He has participated in two loan cycles with the Communal Bank and enjoys being a member because the other people in his group are very nice and organized.

His dream is to have a car that he can use for conducting his sales and visiting his customers.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Oleala

texts.en:
Oleala is 24 years old and married with 1 child.

Oleala owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has 2 years of experience in this business. She needs a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase weed-killers, such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 WST or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Oleala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Oleala's second loan with SPBD. 


About  SPBD:

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score".  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Maria Eufemia

texts.es: María Eufemia cuenta con 72 años de edad es madre soltera ella es comerciante vende frutas y verduras ella apenas inicio su negocio no tiene  mucho pero dice que sacara adelante su negocio ya que es una ayuda para ella, dice que el préstamo fue de gran ayuda ya que lo invertirá en la compra de verduras como son: aguacate, calabaza, jitomate, manzana, romanita, etc. a doña María le gustaría que su negocio incrementara mas ya que ahora no tiene muy bien surtido pero su meta es incrementar el negocio y sacarlo adelante esta muy agradecida con su préstamo.
texts.en: María Eufemia is 72 years old and a single mother. She is a merchant selling fruits and vegetables. She just started the business and does not have much, but says that she will keep moving forward because the business helps her. She says the loan is a big help because she will invest in the purchase of produce like avocados, pumpkins, tomatoes, apples, romaine lettuce, etc. María would like to expand her business even more because right now it isn't well stocked, but her goal is grow and keep making headway. She is very grateful for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mbizi Group

texts.en:
This is Hazvinei, a 35-year-old married lady from Masvingo, Zimbabwe. She has 2 children, aged 14 and 9 years, both of whom are still in school. She does not have any other dependents staying with her. 

She has been in the business of buying and selling clothes imported from Botswana for two years. She operates from her home and has 1 employee. Hazvinei has requested a loan of $400 to buy additional clothes for resale. She has been a MicroKing borrower for quite some time, and her payment record is clean. The challenge she faces in the business is the lower quality of clothes she is getting from Botswana. Because these items are not competitive, she needs to begin to import clothing from Tanzania. With the income from this loan, Hazvinei will be able provide for her family's needs, supplementing her husband's salary. She has plans to open a shop in the central business district of Masvingo.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fomi, silicon, ribbon, scissors, and eyes.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 33 years old. She is married with two children aged 5 and 8; both were enrolled in school at the beginning of this year. Catherine sells used clothes and she has been selling clothes for the last 5 years. She has decided to request a loan to add more clothes to sell. With the profits, she plans to put aside savings in order to have enough money to help her build her residential house.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes Alina

texts.es: La Sra. Alina tiene 47 años y vive en la comunidad de Guerra del Departamento. de Tarija,   la Sra. Alina es casada; tiene y vive en casa propia junto a su hijo, por lo que su esposo viaja a otro pais a trabajar por lo que no participa en el presente crédito, tiene principalmente la producción de productos agrícolas, esta producción la realiza en terrenos propios de herencia de su padre cuenta con herramientas y terrenos necesarios para esta actividad, al Sra., Alina nos indica que con el crédito que sacara lo usara para la compra de semilla de papa como también para compra de abono orgánico para la producción de papa que sacara el mes de octubre, según la experiencia que tiene en este negocio nos indica que sus ventas se irán incrementando a medida que se vayan mejorando el proceso productivo.
texts.en:
Alina is 47 years old and lives in the Guerra del Departamento community of Tarija. Alina is married and lives in her own house with her son. Her husband traveled to another country for work and as such, is not participating in the current loan. She primarily works in the production of agricultural products. She does this work on her own land inherited from her father. She has her own tools and land necessary for this work. 

Alina has said that with the loan that she is taking out she will buy potato seeds as well as organic fertilizer for the potato production which will take up the month of October. According to the experience she has in this work, she says that her sales will continue increasing at a measure that will improve the production process.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds.

loans.name: Vividjegbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupement VIVIDJEGBE est composé de vingt quatre personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Houéfa Véronique est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Houéfa Véronique est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Léopold. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Houéfa Véronique vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Houéfa Véronique assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la maison. Pour ce faire, Houéfa Véronique vend du maïs et de la bouillie de maïs à son domicile et dans un marché. De façon secondaire, Houéfa Véronique vend de la farine de maïs. Houéfa Véronique s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Houéfa Véronique ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe VIVIDJEGBE, sollicitent un premier credit  auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa is a 41 year old woman who is very dynamic and has been selling for 19 years. She is married and has three children and a husband who help her with her business. She sells sausage and yogurt and has been well accepted by her clients. She started her business four years ago in the local market in order to be self-sufficient and support her family's economy and, over time, she has increased her business.

Teresa is asking a loan of $ 650 USD to buy merchandise in order to increase her inventory and offer better services to her clients. She intends to pay back the loan over a term of 6-12 months.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

La Señora Teresa es una mujer de 41 años muy activa que se dedica al comercio desde hace 19 años, esta casada y tiene tres hijos que ayudan en el negocio al igual que su esposo. Su negocio es la venta de embutidos y yogur, los cuales tienen una muy buena aceptación entre sus clientes. Desde hace cuatro años inicio su negocio en el tianguis ante la necesidad de generar ingresos y poder ayudar a la economía familiar y durante este tiempo ha hecho crecer el negocio.

Teresa requiere un crédito por $ 650 USD para comprar mercancías y poder incrementar sus inventarios y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, piensa pagar el préstamo en un plazo de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Zanfira

texts.en: Zanfira is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region, settled in Sumgait city,  and has 2 children. This 51-year-old woman has been engaged in a carpet factory for 18 years. Zanfira used to work at a weaving factory but decided that she wanted to start her own business. She supports her family with this business. Now Zanfira needs a loan amount of $1200 to buy the carpet machine.

loans.use: To buy the carpet machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margaret would like to buy animal Feeds for Her Dairy Cows and 300 chickens.

loans.name: Egwuogu

texts.en: Miss A. Eqwuogu is 34 years old. She has a little store where she sells handbags and shoes and and does her clients' nails. She hails from Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria and is an experienced person in her business. She needs a loan of $ 750 so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and bags for her inventory

loans.name: Neema

texts.en: Neema is a 39-year-old mother of four and a resident of Mbagala area, Dar Es Salaam’s largest slum area. She owns a boutique that specializes in ladies items (shoes, clothing, and hand bags). She has been in business for the past five years, and her business has been growing steadily since joining the Youth Self Employment foundation. She trades in Kariokoo, Dar es Salaam’s biggest trading areas, and her business booms during the Easter and Christmas seasons. She is requesting a loan of $550 to increase her stock so she can take more advantage of her boom periods and to expand her business.

loans.use: To increase stock and expand business

loans.name: Santiago Florencio

texts.es:
Santiago is a selfless father, and as a good head of household, he has in mind what he should do to support his family. He decided to dedicate himself to raising livestock five years ago, after gaining experience working on a livestock ranch. He added everything he learned to the education his parents instilled in him since he was a child. He stopped practicing his professional career of nursing because the low wages that he received didn't let him support his three sons. Now he is dedicated to raising and fattening his cattle. He rents and sells the breed that he raises at his farm for bullfighting activities in the various towns in the Mantaro Valley. In accordance with upcoming celebrations, Santiago presently has 12 cattle that he is raising for these activities. He plans to keep raising livestock and to acquire even more. Subsequently, he plans to open a small pharmacy in the city where he can practice his profession independently. This is why he is requesting a loan of $100 that would allow him to purchase more food for the normal development and competitiveness of his cattle. He thanks all of you who kindly respond to his request.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Santiago es un padre abnegado y como buen jefe de familia tiene en cuenta que debe sostener su hogar. Decidió dedicarse a la ganadería hace 5 años, después de adquirir experiencia trabajando un tiempo en una hacienda ganadera y adicionó tofo lo aprendido a la enseñanza que sus padres le inculcaron desde niño, dejando así de ejercer su carrera profesional de enfermería por el bajo sueldo que percibía y el cual no le alcanzaba para sostener a sus 3 hijosAhora se dedica a criar y a engordar su ganado, la raza que cobija en casa le permite poder arrendar y vender su ganado para las corridas de toros y otras actividades taurinas en los diferentes pueblos del valle del Mantaro; deacuerdo a sus fechas festivas, en la actualidad cuenta con 12 vacunos que le permiten poder realizar estas actividades; Santiago piensa seguir dedicándose a la ganadería y por ello piensa adquirir más ganado y posteriormente abrir una botica en el centro de la ciudad para ejercer independientemente su profesión. Es por ello que solicita un préstamo de 100 dólares que le permitirán poder comprar más alimentos para su normal desarrollo y competitividad, desde ahora agradece a aquellas personas que gentilmente accedan a su pedido.

loans.use: Purchase of food for cattle

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
Yovana rents a shop near the entrance to her town where she sells all sorts of groceries. At this hot time of year, when the sun beats down on the Peruvian jungle, cold soft drinks are very popular and she always makes a point of stocking them. Unfortunately, the monthly rent on the shop is very high and this eats into Yovana's profits. She is asking for a loan to finish building the home and shop she has begun so she can move her business there and see better returns for her labor. Let's help her benefit from her own hard work.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Yovana, nos contó que por esta época de inmensa irradiación del astro sol, en la selva peruana, empiezan a tener un incremento de temperatura en su comunidad y este fenómeno es muy notorio; razón por la que las bebidas frías son muy solicitadas por los visitantes y lugareños, es por este hecho que en su pequeño puesto ubicado en la entrada de su comunidad se dedica además de ofrecer sus artículos ya acostumbrados a la venta de gaseosas y refrescos que gracias al gran calor existente tiene muy alta demanda y el lugar es muy concurrido.Sin embargo tiene un enorme problema debido a que este puesto es alquilado, por lo que tiene que pagar considerables sumas de dinero mensualmente, lo que sin duda merma grandemente los ingresos que con mucho esfuerzo obtiene. Ella solicita una suma de dinero en préstamo para terminar de construir su casita para que allí pueda trasladar su negocio con el objetivo de dejar de pagar el arriendo elevado que le imponen y obtener mejores beneficios económicos para su hogar. Apoyémosla a que siga prosperando con su digna labor.

loans.use: To stock a grocery store with soft drinks and eventually to construct a new shop.

loans.name: Ana De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Ana de los Angeles G. Garcia is married and has five children. She studied up to 5th grade. She has a business selling food in the county market of Chichigalpa. She started the business when her husband's income was very low. She had always enjoyed preparing food, and had been selling food at her home every afternoon. Ten years ago, at the insistence of a friend who also has a food stand at the market, she rented an unoccupied locale in the market too.

She has been working with CEPRODEL for two years now, and she tells us that she feels very good about all the loans she has gotten because they have arrived at a good time and have been given quickly and allowed her to get ahead because through the income generated by this business they have been able to improve the living conditions in their home and have managed to ensure their children are educated.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Ana de los Ángeles G. G., es casada y con cinco hijos, cursó hasta el quinto grado de primaria, tiene un negocio de venta de alimentos ubicado en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa, el negocio lo comienza cuando los ingresos que percibía su esposo eran bastantes bajos, a ella siempre le gustó el negocio de comidería ya que en su casa se vendía todas las tardes, este negocio lo emprende hace diez años, esto lo logra a través de una amiga que también tiene un puesto de comida en el mercado, fue ella quien la impulso a rentar el local que estaba vacío.

Trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace dos año, nos manifiesta que se siente muy bien con los créditos otorgados pues han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, y que le han servido para salir a delante, ya que a través de los ingresos que les ha generado este negocio han podido mejorar sus condiciones de su hogar y a podido lograr que sus hijos se vayan preparando.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Compra de mercadería)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more rice crops from the growers to resell.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en:
Graciela is a hard-working mother of four. She runs a small grocery store out of her house where she sells general necessities. Her husband is a potter who makes various decorative goods out of clay.

For seven years now she has run her grocery store and it has continued to increase in business and income. Graciela’s next goal is to save enough money from her work, along with her husband’s work, to construct a second story on their house.

She is asking for a loan today to help her flourishing business. Her plan is to buy rice, sugar, flour, general drinks and baked goods for her shop. With the increase in goods she will be better able to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, baked goods and drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maria del Socorro T. is a mother to three children and makes a living teaching in a small school in the municipality of Villanueva where she lives.
The problem currently facing this humble lady is that she needs to invest in the infrastructure of her home and for this she is seeking help from Ceprodel.  She is requesting to be beneficiary of al loan that will allow her to buy the materials for the construction.
In spite of the difficult financial situation that she has been in for some time, she always tries to give her children the best possible living conditions. Her dream is to see her children turn into successful professionals.
Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.
María del Socorro T. es madre de tres hijos el cual se dedica a la labor de la docencia en un pequeño colegio del municipio de Villanueva donde es originaria.
La problemática que hoy en día atraviesa esta humilde dama es que necesita invertir en su infraestructura de su hogar y para ello ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan la compra de materiales para la construcción.
A pesar de la difícil situación económica que ha atravesado desde hace mucho tiempo siempre se sigue esforzando para proporcionar a sus hijos las mejores condiciones de vida y así poder ver realizado su sueño de que sus hijos sean unos grandes profesionales y de mucho éxito.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Esterfila

texts.es:
Señora Esterfilia C. G. belongs to the communal bank called 'Ayaymaman'. She lives in the region of San Martin, Moyobamba. Her food stand is located in Jr. Serafin at the local supermarket called 'Erick'. She sells vegetables from the region which are purchase daily by the people in the city.

When she separated from her husband, she decided to open up her own business which took a lot of effort, but she did it anyways to support her children and to offer them a better future. Due to her good customer service, her clientele has grown.

With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase different types of vegetables in big quantities such as lettuce, tomatoes, onions, potatotoes, sweet potatoes and yuca so that she can have enough to satisfy her clients' demands.

Señora Esterfilia is 58 years old. She's a hard-worker since she works every day non-stop. She accomplishes each goal she has set for herself without any limitations. She's dedicated to what she does and hopes that in the near future she can have her own store from home.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Esterfilia C. G. ,pertenece al Banco Comunal “Ayaymaman”,” vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Moyobamba y distrito de Moyabamba, su negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Serafín en un puesto del mercado “Erick”, se dedica a la venta de verduras de la región y de la costa, que diariamente es comprado por los moradores de la ciudad. Al separarse de su esposo ,decidió iniciar este tipo de negocio con mucho esfuerzo y seguir adelante para el sustento de sus hijos gracias a su buen trato supo ganarse su clientela . Con el crédito de S/.2,500.00,el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará diversas verduras como: camote, repollo, tomates, cebolla, papa , yucas en sacos, para así tener abastecido su puesto y satisfacer la exigencia de sus clientes. La señora Esterfilia tiene 58 años, trabaja diariamente demostrando de esa manera, que es una mujer emprendedora y que para cumplir sus metas, no hay límites y se pueden alcanzar con esfuerzo y dedicación, es así que en el futuro piensa tener una tienda de abarrotes, en su casa.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Rukia M.. She is married and has three children ages 1, 6, and 12. In 1995, Rukia established a business selling grains. She requires a loan to purchase additional stocks of rice and beans in bulk, and thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice and beans in bulk.

loans.name: Marlene Guadalupe

texts.es:
Lupita (short for Guadalupe), as her customers and friends call her, lives in the city of La Libertad, El Salvador, along with her life partner and their two children.

For the past several years she has dedicated herself to the business of selling bedding (covers and cases for pillows), and her partner has been working as a brick layer.

Through their hard work and the loans they have received from Kiva's field partner Apoyo Integral, both partners have been able to acquire a greater variety of merchandise, meet the demands of their clients, and increase sales. This has helped them generate enough income to maintain their family. Now they would like to begin improving their home through the construction of a perimeter wall that will bring greater security to the whole family. For this reason Lupita is asking for a loan that will help her complete this construction project.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Lupita como le dicen sus clientes y amigos, vive en el Departamento de La Libertad, junto a su compañero de vida y dos hijos que han procreado. Desde hace varios años se ha dedicado al negocio de venta de ropa para camas(Cobertores y forros para almohadas) y el compañero de vida se ha dedicado a realizar labores de albañilería A través del trabajo de ambos y los créditos que durante 3 años le ha brindado Apoyo Integral a podido ir adquiriendo más variedad de mercadería para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes e incrementar las ventas, que le han generado la manutención de sus hijos. Ahora quiere empezar a mejorar la vivienda, con la construcción de un muro perimetral , que le brinde seguridad a toda su familia.
