El crédito será de mucha ayuda para poder  cambiar el estado económico de la familia y mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

El sueño de Lucila es poder ayudar a los hijos para que puedan culminar los estudios y ser profesionales. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir de paseo y practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Lucila Cruz, 30, is single and has two children.  She lives with her children who are 11 and 9 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.   She’s a member of the “Cevallos” communal bank that’s located in Recinto San Francisco belonging to San Juan del Pueblo Viejo Parish that belongs to Ventanas.  They are cocoa bean farmers.


Lucila is a cocoa bean farmer and makes her purchases and her sales in San Juan.  She requests the loan to provide maintenance for her cocoa bean crops to be able to sell it at a better price.  The loan will be of much help for her to change her family’s economic state and to keep the crops in good condition.  


Lucila’s dream is to be able to help her children finish their schooling and become professionals.  In her free time she likes going out on excursions and to play sports.

loans.use: to provide maintenance for her cocoa bean crops.

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Каромат замужем и мать троих детей. Она умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Её муж работает в Кирпичном заводе и его зарплата не хватает на содержании семьи и чтобы помогать мужу она начала заниматься торговлей 13 лет назад. В начала она занималась купля продажей женских одежд, а потом постепенно перешла на продажу детской и женской обуви. Сегодняшний день она успешно продолжает этот бизнес и имеет много постоянных клиентов. Она всегда привозить высококачественные сезонные обуви, поэтому её товары продаются хорошо на рынке. Каромат хотела бы получит займ для покупки зимних обувей и заранее благодарит всех вас за вашу доброту.
texts.en: Karomat is married and is a mother of three children.  She is a smart and hardworking woman.  Her husband works at a brick factory, however, his salary is not sufficient to support the family, so Karomat began involved in sales 13 years ago in order to help her husband.  At first, she was involved in selling women's clothing and then gradually transitioned to selling children's and women's shoes.  Today, Karomat successfully continues this business and has many loyal customers.  She always brings in high-quality seasonal shoes, and this is why her merchandise sell well at the market.  Karomat wants to obtain a loan to buy winter shoes and thanks all of you in advance for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase winter shoes

loans.name: Bukiabi Poultry Farmers B Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is the facilitator of the Bukiabi Poultry Farmers B group. Emmanuel and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Emmanuel takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seed to help him ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Emmanuel had a very good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Emmanuel was only able to harvest nine bags of maize on one acres of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Emmanuel and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Emmanuel will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Bukiabi Poultry Farmers B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Emmanuel is pictured with his group members. Their Field Officer is on the left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Sally has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages .

Sally has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future Sally hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her shop.

loans.name: Sasauli

texts.en:
Sasauli, 52, is married and she has five children.

Sasauli owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has many years of experience in this business.    Sasauli needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 WST or US $250 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Sasauli joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Sasauli's second loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (The higher the number, the better off the person is.) and these are averaged for the overall social metric score.  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives.

loans.name: Ali Edson

texts.es:
Edson es socio nuevo en el banco comunal “Chaska” y sus amigos le invitaron en participar en el banco comunal. 

Edson nació en la ciudad de Cusco, tiene 29 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo. Desde varios años que se dedica a la distribución y venta de celulares móviles. En esta oportunidad Edson requiere el préstamo para comprar equipos de celulares móviles.  

Edson agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en: Edson is a member of the “Chaska” communal bank; some of his friends invited him to participate in the communal bank.  Edson was born in the city of Cusco.  He’s 29 years old and is in a common law relationship; he has a son.  He has sold mobile phones for several years.  On this occasion, Edson needs the loan to buy mobile phone equipment.  Edson is grateful for and values the loan and commits to make his monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone equipment.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth cuenta con 58 años de edad, es casada su esposo se llama Ambrosio es campesino, ella es comerciante vende verduras ya tiene  7 años con el negocio de las verduras también vende maíz y coco en copra, lo cual invertirá su préstamo en la compra de calabazas y maíz ella dice que su préstamo le ayuda bastante porque podrá subir su negocio ahora espera que le vaya muy bien ya que le gustaría incrementar su negocio sacarlo adelante y para eso esta trabajando mucho.
texts.en: Ruth is 58 years old and married; her husband is called Ambrosio and he’s a farmer.  She’s been a vegetable merchant for seven years; she also sells corn and dried coconut meat.  She will use her loan to buy pumpkins and corn.  She says that the loan helps her quite a bit because she will be able to raise her business and now she hopes to do very well because she’d like to increase business and move it forward; this is what she’s working so much to accomplish.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and corn.

loans.name: Vikindu Group

texts.en:
Flora, who is in her early 40s, is married with four children who go to school.  She has been running a retail business since 2002.  She works from 6.00 am to 10.00 p.m daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the stock in her shop and to pay school fees and household expenses. She has paid back her first loan successfully. She wants a loan to re-stock missing items in the shop.  Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will hold this loan with her loan group "Vikindu," which has a total of 22 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.  (The person writing in the background of the photo is not part of the group.)

loans.use: to re-stock missing items in her shop.

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
A citizen of a village located in the Sa And district of Cambodia, Sarom is forty years old and has six children, a few of whom are still in school. She is a farmer who has been growing rice for thirty years.

Sarom leads a group of three female members. This is her first loan with VisionFund, while her group members have been with VisionFund for the last two years. The group is requesting a 3,000,000 KHR loan with VFC.

With her portion of the loan, Sarom wants to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and generate a good yield so as to increase her family’s income.

Sarom wishes to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 60 years old, married to Lusiah and supports a family of four children. He has been operating in motorcycle transport for the last 20 years, earning KES 3,000 per month. 

Joseph has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to produce more food for the family. His future hopes and plans are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma made a decision to help her husband with the family expenses two years ago, and she started her business preparing cookies and meat pies that she sells to her neighbors and friends. Irma’s family experienced an economic crisis because she has anemia and for this reason, she has a lot of medical expenses and also family expenses. However, she never falls down and she continues to fight because she is convinced that her suffering is something transitory. Irma is a very enthusiastic entrepreneur and has all the support of her husband who also knows how to cook the products. Irma is requesting a loan of US$475 with a promise to repay in 6 months. She plans to purchase raw materials because she needs to increase her production because in cold season her demand grows. She wants to run a successful business and she is thinking about putting a mark or special name as an image of her products. But she just needs a little more time and more sales first. Irma feels fortunate to have an activity that lets her do something good and also allows her to support her family.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Hace 2 años Irma tomo la decisión de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares por lo que inició la elaboración de galletas y empanadas que vende entre sus vecinos y amistades. La crisis económica se les vino encima a raíz de los problemas de salud, pues Irma padece anemia y constantemente tiene gastos médicos que cubrir, para poder salir adelante; sin embargo ella no se desanima, pues esta convencida de que esto es algo transitorio. De hecho es una empresaria muy entusiasta, y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quién inclusive conoce el proceso de elaboración de repostería. Irma está solicitando un crédito por la cantidad de US$475 a 6 meses para invertir en materia prima, necesita incrementar la producción pues en temporada de frío se incrementa la demanda. Esta decidida a volver su negocio en una actividad exitosa, por lo que esta pensando en poner imagen a sus productos a través de un nombre y la presentación para la venta, solo necesita un poco de tiempo y que se venda cada vez mas su producto. Se siente afortunada de poder desarrollar una actividad que le permite realizarse y salir adelante con su familia.

loans.use: To purchase raw material to her business

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Madame Justine is a 37 year old woman who sells kenkey, a locally prepared meal, to her community. As the number of people in her community increases she needs to cook in larger quantity to serve her community. She has no assistance to do this. She is asking for a loan of $750 from Kiva to enable her cook in larger quantities.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Tumpes would like to start a beadwork business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace E. is 42 years old, married with six children, and hails from Asaba, Delta State, in Nigeria. She is someone who takes care of people in her community.  Grace hopes to expand her business with a Kiva loan of $750.

loans.use: To buy more medicine for resale

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 22 years old and has a mini-market shop in Kirkuk. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase more goods for the shop, develop his shop and paint the shop. He has one child. He wants to increase his income and enhance his living standard. He also wants to develop his business.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods for the shop, develop his shop and paint the shop.

loans.name: Alena

texts.en: Alena T. is a thirty five year old lady, who is married and has five children. This will be her fifth loan to help run her plantation. This time, she will use her loan to improve and expand the business. Alena is a member who budgets her money wisely. When she sees that her inventory is plentiful, she will sell it in the market. If she is low on supplies, she sells in front of one of the shops in her village. Alena believes that if she can grow her business she will no longer need to go all the way to the market. Instead, she will build a shop in her village, or a canteen at the nearby school.

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment for her plantation

loans.name: Faalotoina

texts.en: Faalotoina is a 30 year old mother and is married with 9 children.  Her family lives on their plantation, which is also their main source of income.  Her husband is a farmer and he has been very supportive in taking care of the family.  Faalotoina heard of SPBD through the village women and she decided to do something to make use of her time.  Her parents used to run a shop, but when the father passed away two years ago, it was closed down.  With her first loan, she renovated the shop and started it up again.  Her shop is now running well and she hopes to expand it using this loan (her second).  She is very thankful for the help of SBPD which has helped her to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her small shop

loans.name: Cuauhtemoc

texts.es:
The family of Cuautemoc has been working to manufacture powdered brown sugar since their great-great-grandfather. Nevertheless, Cuauhtemoc decided to begin to work in other jobs, which did not serve him so well since he did not earn sufficient money to pay the costs of school for his two children.

That is why Cuauhtemoc decided to continue the tradition of its family and to take advantage of how well he knows how to do this work. It began with a little powdered brown sugar and seed candies to sell to his relatives and friends. Little by little he broke into selling to the small stores that there are in his area. At present they are asking him for a greater assortment which he can not always provide because he does not use machinery to make his work efficient.

That it is why Cuauhtemoc is requesting a loan of $750 that he is willing to pay back in 6 months. With this money Cuauhtemoc will be able to buy a mill and a cane cutter to be able to make his products faster and thus to give him greater stability to his micro-business. With your aid Cuauhtemoc will be able to bring up his family.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La familia de Cuautemoc se dedica a la elaboración de piloncillo desde tu tatarabuelo, sin embargo Cuauhtemoc decidió comenzar a trabajar en otros oficios, lo cual no le sirvió tanto puesto que no sacaba suficiente dinero para pagar los gastos de estudios de sus dos hijos es por eso que Cuauhtemoc decidió seguir la tradición de su familia y aprovechar lo bien que sabe realizar su trabajo. Comenzó con un poco de piloncillo y dulces de semillas para vender entre sus familiares y amigos, y poco a poco se fue abriendo camino entre las tiendas pequeñas que hay en su localidad. Actualmente le están pidiendo mayor surtido el cual no puede en ocasiones cumplir porque no cuenta con maquinaria para eficientar su trabajo.

Es por eso que Cuauhtemoc está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Cuauhtemoc podrá comprar un molino y una cortadora de caña para poder hacer más rápido sus productos y así darle mayor estabilidad a su micro empresa. Con tu ayuda Cuauhtemoc podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: To buy a mill and a sugar cane cutter

loans.name: Abduholik

texts.en:
C. Abduholik is 50 years old. He is married with 4 children, two of which are already married and two who are living with their parents and helping their father in his business.  He is pictured here with his wife leaving for the market.

Abduholik rears cattle for a living. He now has four cows and has created a stable family business which provides the major income for the family. 

Abduholik has previously taken out serveral loans with IMON and has proved himself to be a reliable borrower with a positive credit history. Today he requests a loan of 350.00 US Dollars for the term of 12 months as he is planning to increase his cattle stock by purchasing one cow. Abduholik thanks everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing of 1 cow.

loans.name: Primitiva Beatriz

texts.es:
Mrs. Primitiva Beatriz R. P. belons to the Communal Bank Señor D. los Milagros D. Chiquian. She sells alfajores, a caramel sandwich cookie, in different stores in the Chiquian area, Bolognesi province, Ancash state. She also sends orders of 500 alfajores to Lima.

With a previous loan of S/800 soles she has been able to grow her business and her income. With the current loan of S/1200 soles which will be repaid in 8 months, she will buy flour, butter, sugar, and milk at wholesale prices.

She is 49 years old, a single mother of 4 children, and her income enables her to educate her children and pay her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Primitiva Beatriz R. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor D. los Milagros D. Chiquian”, ella se dedica a la venta D. alfajores los cuales son repartidos en las diferentes tiendas del distrito D. Chiquian, provincia D. Bolognesi, departamento D. Ancash. También envía pedidos D. 500 alfajores a la ciudad D. Lima.

Con el crédito anterior S/. 800.00 nuevos soles ha podido incrementado su negocio y sus ingresos. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,200.00 el cual será cancelado en 8 meses lo invertirá en la compra D. harina, manteca, azúcar y leche por mayor.

Ella tiene 49 años, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos, sus ingresos le permite educar a sus hijos y solventar los gastos del su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase flour, butter, sugar and milk

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther began to sell food when she constructed a restaurant in her own home. Her customers have shown her great affection because she has provided them with great service. She is 51 years old and a mother of seven. She hopes to increase the quantity and variety of her dishes so that she may offer them in a daily buffet. With a large number of national and international dishes she hopes to make her restaurant popular.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Su dedicación a la venta de comida hizo que la señora Esther construyera en su propio domicilio un restaurante, por la misma razón que sus clientes le extendían esta solicitud a diario, ella por su buena atención y sazón, se ha ganado el cariño y respeto de sus clientes. Tiene 51 años de edad, es madre de 7 hijos y desea incrementar la cantidad y variedad de sus comidas para ofrecerlos a través de un buffet a diario y con una amplia variedad de platillos nacionales e internacionales con el objetivo de popularizar su restaurante.

loans.use: To invest capital in order to further her proposal to establish a restaurant with great variety

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
The Lady Mariela G. J. is an associate of the “Dynamic Women” Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin region, province and district of Picota. She is dedicated to the business of selling articles of clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children, as well as underwear. Her store is found located on the Av. Grau Nº 551 of the district of Picota. She has had this business for 7 years.

With the loan of 2500 soles that will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of underwear by the dozens for girls, jeans of different marks for ladies, gentlemen, children and girls, sports polos for gentlemen, sports blouses for ladies, and dress pants for children and adults. To supply her business she tries to satisfy her clients in all their inclinations and to be always up to date with the fashion.

She is 38 years of age and is a native of Piura. She has 3 children who, along with her husband, are dedicated to this business. She is known for being genteel and very attentive with her clients. She is concerned with moving her family ahead and being an example for her children.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Mariela G. J., es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Dinamicas” vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Picota, se dedica al negocio de venta de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, así como ropas interiores. Su tienda se encuentra ubicada en la Av. Grau Nº 551 del distrito de Picota. Tiene este negocio hace 07 años.

Con el préstamo de S/.2500.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ropas interiores por docenas, para niñas pantalones Jean de diferentes marcas para damas , caballeros, niños y niñas , polos deportivos para caballeros, blusas sport para damas , pantalones de vestir para niños y adultos Para surtir su negocio busca satisfacer a sus clientes en todos sus gustos y estar siempre actualizada con la moda.

Ella tiene 38 años de edad, es natural de Piura , tiene 03 hijos y juntos con su esposo se dedican a este negocio. Se caracteriza por ser gentil y muy atenta con sus clientes. Preocupada por sacar adelante a su familia y por ser un ejemplo para sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy underwear forr girls,  jeans of different marks for ladies, gentlemen, children and girls, sports polos for gentlemen, sports blouses for ladies, and dress pants for children and adults for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Babita

texts.en:
Mrs. Babita T., 20 years old, lives in Kulashwor, Kathmandu. Most of the people in this area are engaged in small businesses. Mrs. T. lives in a single family home with her husband Mr. Bhakta T. and their son. Her husband is a taxi driver and her son is studying in primary school.

Mrs. T. is a grocery shop keeper in Kulashwor. She opened her grocery store 3 years ago to improve the living standard of her family because the income of her husband is not sufficient to run her family smoothly. Mrs. T. sells different types of grocery items in her shop such as maize, rice, noodles and so on. Now she is requesting Rs 15000.00 to expand her business.

loans.use: Babita would like to expand her grocery business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a 44 year old entrepreneur. She has lived with her family members in Nyamasaria Kisumu for the last twelve years. Her main income-generating activity is charcoal sales, a business she has run for thirteen years. Teresa has also initiated a cereals business, selling beans, green grams, and rice in small scale thus improving her level of income. She requires $400.00 to buy more stock of cereals and charcoal to sell.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To buy stock of charcoal and cereal to sell.

loans.name: Asha's Amken Group

texts.en:
Asha is a 22-year-old, married woman with 2 children (ages 4 and 5). She began selling charcoal and fruits in 2002, and she proudly states that she works every day from 9:00 am to 8:00 pm at her business. Accordingly, she is able to generate a monthly profit of approximately $110 from her sales.

Asha now seeks a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. Importantly, she will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses relating to vegetable (e.g., beans and maize) sales, fruit sales, and clothing sales.

loans.use: To expand and improve their respective businesses by purchasing additional goods (e.g., charcoal, vegetables, fruit, and clothes) to thereby increase their inventory.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is 48 years old. She is a widow with one child aged 20 years old. She has been a clothes and bites seller since 1988. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 80 from her sales.

In the past, Pili has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Pili is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Florence's Nakyeyune Group

texts.en:
Florence is the leader of this five member group. She is 42 years old and married with four daughters, who are between the ages of 24 and 15. All her children go to school. She owns a five-room house where she stays with six people. Florence doesn't take care of any additional family members. There is no electricity or piped water at her home but the family gets three meals a day.

Florence resides in and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She sells chicken and rents a stall at Kalerwe in the city suburbs. She sells to an average of 30 people a day and works seven days a week. Florence's major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises, school fees, and medication. She uses a bicycle to commute to and from work. She has been in this business for six years. Her main challenges are the rainy season, which disturbs her a lot, and seasonality.

Florence has been with MCDT for over six years and this is her twelfth loan, working all along with the same groupmates. She wants to use this loan to increase stock in her business. Florence also aspired to build rental rooms in the available space near her house.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is 24 years old and lives in Lebanon's capitA. city, Beirut. Hussein owns a beauty salon in his neighborhood and also works in the car trading industry. Hussein has asked for a loan of $1000 US Dollars from A. Majmoua to cover some of his importation expenses.

loans.use: Hussein would like to cover the importation expenses of an automobile to resell.

loans.name: Cham

texts.en: Cham S., 42, is married and lives with her four children and husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 2007, she has been raising ducks for eggs to earn a living and is able to make US$7.50 per day. Her husband is a farmer growing rice. The climate conditions have been unfavorable in Cambodia this past year for farming, and this has caused food prices to soar. Inflation has also been out of control, as this has turned into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Cham S. included. Mrs. Cham S. would like to take out a loan of US$600 to expand her livestock by adding more ducks and purchase feed for them as well.

loans.use: To expand her livestock.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan N., 44, is married and resides with her husband in the Battambang province, Cambodia. She is a true entrepreneur who sells various kinds of fruits in a busy market to earn a living. She is able to make $3.50 profit per day, while her husband is a taxi driver. On average, he makes $3 a day. This couple together has five children, and all of them are students.

Chan N. would like to take out a loan of $1000 to add to her inventory of fruit.

loans.use: To add to her fruit inventory

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en: Wassim is a 25-year-old man living in Chhim in Mount Lebanon. He has owned a shop since 2006 where he sells new and used clothes. Wassim wants to buy more clothes in order to increase his sales and cover most of his clientele's needs; therefore, he wants to borrow US$ 1,000 to fulfill his project.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for re-sale

loans.name: Rogelia Mercedes

texts.es:
ROGELIA MERCEDES CARRIÓN T., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Solidarias”, ubicado en el Jr. Inmaculada N° 169 del Distrito de Callería, un jirón muy concurrido por muchos turistas, por la variedad de comidas típicas que preparan y venden.

La señora Rogelia tiene 58 años de edad, 03 hijos, su esposo trabaja en una granja, ella es socia de Manuela Ramos hace siete años, con su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 que recibió compro una cocinita a carbón, en la cual asaba sus pescados, plátanos verdes, pollos, etc., preparaba juanes (arroz envuelto en hoja) patarashca (pescado envuelto en hoja) y asado, todo en poca cantidad.

Con este préstamos de S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, ambiento su local, compró pintura, platos, vasos, cubiertos, aumentó sus clientes y de personal, su Restaurant lleva el nombre de “July Jessy”.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella.
texts.en:
ROGELIA MERCEDES CARRIÓN T. belongs to the "Banco Comunal"Mujeres Solidarias", located in Jr. Inmaculada No. 169, District of Callería, a very popular street for many tourists due to the variety of typical food prepared and sold there.

Doña Rogelia is 58 years old, has 3 children and her husband works at a farm. She has been a partner of Manuela Ramos for seven years. With a first loan of S/.300.00 she bought a coal kitchen where she fried her fish, green bananas, chicken, etc. and prepared "juanes" (rice wrapped in leaves) "patarashca" (fish wrapped in leaves), and roast, all in small quantities.

With this loan of S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, she will adapt her premises, buy paint, plates, glasses, cutlery, increase her clients and staff. Her restaurant is named "July Jessy". She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for having confidence in her.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase paint, plates, glasses, cutlery; increase number of clients and staff.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi A. is a young and energetic man who has been caring for his elder mother since his father passed away a year ago. At 23 years old, he operates a small grocery store where he sells products like rice, canned foods, drinks, among other things.

Fadi is asking for a US$1000 loan to purchase more groceries to meet the increasing demand of his costumers. He is excited about this loan and would like to thank everyone for their trust and support

loans.use: To purchase grocery items

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan S. is 19 years old and single. With the help of his family he opened a small grocery store where he sells different kinds of food, such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, tea, and many others.

He would like to ask for a loan of $1,000 to expand the capacity of his commerce by acquiring supplies of new products for his store. Given this chance, he will earn more funds and save more, so as to meet the needs of his family. He and his family thank you for the support that you're giving him to be able to continue growing his business.

loans.use: Purchase more and new products

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en: Lhagvasuren G. lives with his wife and three teenage children in Arhanghay province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His three children study in local high schools. With his wife, he runs a small family business in wood processing and transportation. In 1995, he initially started his business by making wooden furniture for local clients. However, as he realized that there was a better money to be made in wood processing and transportation, he switched his business focus in 2007. He transports trees from local forests and processes them for carpenter's use. Business is going well, and he was able to repair and modernize his truck with his profits. He aims to supply all the processed wood for the local carpenters. He requests a loan to purchase trees and new tires for his truck. He hopes to be able to afford university education for his children. In the picture: Lhagvasuren's wife Altantsetseg in their business field.

loans.use: To purchase trees and new tires for his truck.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert A. is 45 years old. He is married and the father of five children: four sons and one daughter. The last born is currently in the senior high school. The rest have all completed school and are working. His wife trades in infant layettes. Robert lives with the family in a rented apartment in a town called Achiase. Achiase is a busy farming and trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. He is an auto electrician by profession. He mends electrical problems in clients’ vehicles. He says he also charges their vehicles’ batteries. Robert has a shop at the lorry station in his community. He also has some apprentices who are in training. He has been in business for over eighteen years. He wants a loan to buy more car batteries.

loans.use: To buy car batteries

loans.name: Mandahsuren

texts.en:
Mandahsuren B. is 38, married, and the mother of two: ages 11 and 13. Her family lives in a "ger" (traditional nomadic tent) district on the plot of land her family owns in Uvurhangay, one of the Mongolian central provinces. Both her children are attending an elementary school.

Mandahsuren started running a retail business in 2002. She used to sell bicycles and bike accessories outside a local market. In 2004, with her profit, she bought a little booth and started selling spare parts inside the market. In 2007 she bought another bigger booth to sell motorcycle spare parts. Her husband Dashhuu helps her run these businesses. Dashhuu goes to UlaanB., the capital city of Mongolia, once or twice every month to buy spare parts at the wholesale markets. Their regular customers are mostly herders who have motorcycles for their daily transportation needs.

Mandahsuren says that "with my profit I'm able to save money for my children's future university tuition." She requests a loan to buy spare parts for her business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Nabila Muhammad Akram Group

texts.en:
Nabila baji is the wife of M. A. and has lived in Multan, Pakistan, for the past ten years. Multan is famous for its shrines. Her husband is a welder by profession.

Nabila baji runs a decorative-embroidery business. She earns income by preparing embroidered dresses on orders which she collects from the clothes shops. She does this work to pay off the utilities. She is applying for a loan to buy a welding machine for her husband. 

She is the group leader of two other women from her locality:

Talat naheed baji wants a loan to buy materials (beads, clothes and colored thread) for her decorative-embroidery business.

Rozina baji wants a loan to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine for her husband's business

loans.name: Chamreoun

texts.en: Chamreoun E. is 45 years old and married. She has four children of which three are students and one is a garment worker. She makes a living by selling groceries at her home for a daily income of $8. Her husband is employed in a garment factory in Phnom Penh City where he earns a daily income of $3. She plans to take a KIVA loan of $700 to buy a motorbike for the transportation of her groceries. She hopes that, with the success of her business plan, she will be able to decorate her house and push all her three children to a good school of higher education.

loans.use: buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Si

texts.en: Si N., 41, is a rural villager in the Province of Siem Reap where she makes a living planting a variety of crops as her  business. Her husband works fishing in and around Tunle Sap River which is the main area for fish. This older couple  lives with five children. Two are working in construction, while the others are unemployed but work on the farm field. Because this is the rice harvesting season, Si N. has requested a loan to hire harvesters to cut her crops and to buy fertilizers to begin growing her new plants.

loans.use: To hire harvesters to cut her crops, and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza is dedicated to improving her quality of life and does not scrimp on any efforts to achieve this. Her responsibility as a mother is her major driving force. She has been working for 12 years raising young cattle. Firuza built a small stable in her house in order to do this, and her earnings represent her long term efforts to care for these animals. She is very enthusiastic about continuing to raise animals, since this will permit her to improve her conditions. Firuza asked for a loan of $1200 USD to purchase young cattle to expand her business. Let’s support this hard-working and talented woman so that she can attain her goals!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy young cattle

loans.name: Lomialagi

texts.en:
Lomialagi S. Tofilau is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Moataa.  She is married and has 4 adult-aged children.  To make a living, Lomialagi S. owns and operates a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community.  Lomialagi S. has been engaged in this business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2007, Lomialagi S. joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lomialagi S. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1750 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital.  Lomialagi S. is now requesting a new loan of 2500 WST which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.  The loan will be the fourth loan she has taken out from SPBD.  Lomialagi S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Maria Justina

texts.pt:
Maria Justina M. nasceu no distrito de Boane, de 39 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 10 e 20 anos, todos os filhos freqüentam escola e vivem com o pai que é militar no quartel de Boane tem a sua casa própria onde mora com toda família. Para alem dos seus filhos, não vive com mais ninguém sob sua responsabilidade. Maria estudou ate 7 classe tendo parado, na altura da guerra, devido à falta de condições financeiras por parte dos seus progenitores.

Nunca saiu do distrito de boane, cresceu na companhia dos seus pais e passou a viver com seu marido depois de um casamento tradicional.
Aprendeu a fazer negócios com as irmãs e vizinhos. Dedica se a venda de produtos diversos (bebidas, bolos bolachas e outros) no seu estabelecimento onde trabalha sozinha. Rende pro mês 1.000,00MT.

Nunca teve empréstimos com outras instituições e este é o seu quarto credito com a Hluvuku-Adsema, primeiro do kiva no valor de 15.000,00MT para compra de produtos (bebidas, bolos, bolachas, chips e outros).
Os primeiros três créditos foram também para a mesma actividade (5.200,00MT; 10.000,00MT e 13.500,00MT).

Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de manter firme o negocio assim como fazer mais um estabelecimento comercial no quintal da sua própria casa.
texts.en:
Maria Justina M. was born in the district of Boane, She is 39 years old, and is married with four children between the ages of 10 and 20. All of her children are in school and they all live with their father, who is a soldier in Boane. They own their own home, where the whole family lives. Apart from her children, she isn't responsible for supporting anyone else. Maria attended school through the 7th grade but had to stop during the war because her parents didn't have the money to send her. She's never left Boane. She was raised by her parents and then went to live with her husband after a traditional wedding. She learned how to run a business with her sisters and neighbors. She sells a variety of goods -- soft drinks, sweets, etc. -- in her shop, where she works by herself. She earns 1000 meticals a month. She's never had loans from other institutions and this is her fourth from Hluvuku-Adsema and her first with Kiva. She will use the 15,000 meticals to stock her store (soft drinks, sweets, snacks, chips, etc.). Her first three loans were for the same purpose (5200 meticals, 10,000 meticals, and 13,5000 meticals). She intends to pay back her loan on time and in full so she can request additional loans, with the goal of keeping her business going and opening a shop in the backyard of her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for her store

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 48-year-old divorced man who lives with his 2 children. He has owned his own metal shop since 1974 when he first learned the business. Today, Mohamad is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a new machine.

loans.use: To purchase a new machine

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo S. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 58 years old. Consuelo is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Consuelo owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Consuelo has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Consuelo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Consuelo is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Consuelo from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her product offering

loans.name: Manuela Rosa

texts.es:
La señora MANUELA ROSA M. J. , tiene 37 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES VALEROSAS.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de Secundaria.
La socia madre soltera y tiene 1 hija  de 23 años de edad a quien la apoya económicamente con la crianza de sus nietos porque es madre soltera..
MANUELA se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios como: papas, fideos, jugos, aceite, menestras, golosinas, etc.
En la tienda de comestibles que tiene en su casa.
El primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de más productos alimenticios para abastecer la tienda que está ubicada en su misma casa.
Este crédito de 1,700 nuevos soles lo utilizará en la compra más productos alimenticios (azúcar, fideos, arroz, golosinas, conservas, etc.)  y también empezará a vender cerveza.
La empresaria sueña  comprar un carrito sanguchero y vender por las tarde afuera de su casa hamburguesas, salchipapa y salchipollo.

loans.use: compra productos alimenticios (azúcar, fideos, arroz, golosinas, conservas, etc.) y cerveza.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more motor spare part

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en: Candelaria R. is from the village of Punta Dulapo. She is 58 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Candelaria owns and operates a business planting and harvesting flowers for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2003, Candelaria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Candelaria is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 14th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Nelis Yamileth

texts.es: Nelis Yamileth M. D. A. D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en Ahuachapán, vive junto a su esposo y cuatro hijos menores D. 14, 12 10 y 3 años D. edad, los tres hijos mayores se dedican a estudiar mientras que el pequeño esta al cuidado D. ella durante todo el día. Nelis posee una venta D. ropa en el mercado D. Ahuachapán, en este lugar ella comercializa ropa para niños y adultos. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más ropa y poder aprovechar la temporada naviD.ña en la cual sus ventas se incrementan, es por esto que ella desea surtir su negocio y tener gran variedad D. tallas y colores.
texts.en:
Nelis Yamileth M. D. A., 39, lives with her husband and four minor children, 14-, 12-, 10, and 3-years-old, in Ahuachapán. The three older children are all students and the youngest is still at home under her care all day. Nelis sells clothing for children and adults in the Ahuachapán market. She is requesting financing to buy more clothing to stock her stall with items in a wiD. variety of sizes and colors so that she can take advantage of the Christmas season when sales rise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a committed LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Africa, particularly in Nigeria. Rose sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers.

She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Rose is a very hard working and friendly woman. She is 42 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a welder. Her children are still dependent upon her and go to school. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie E. is 23 years old. She owns a small rice field in Santa Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She needs additional capital to run her rice farm, especially when farm supplies are expensive.  Her family relies on the income she makes from the farm. She uses the harvest to feed her family and sells the remaining rice to rice traders for additional income for her family.

She is hoping to receive a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to increase her harvest and better support her family.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
El Señor Diego se dedica al transporte publico(Taxi) dentro del radio urbano de la ciudad, desde hace 5 años,como cliente de la Institucion el Señor  Diego al transcurrir del tiempo desde que es cliente  ha demostrado responsabilidad con la institucion,actualmente se ecuentra en su en su tercer ciclo, el vive en casa de sus abuelos a  los que asiste cuando es necesario.						

Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Diego works in public transportation as a taxi driver around the city. He has been a client of the institution for five years. In the time that he has been a client Diego has demonstrated responsibility with the institution. He is currently in his third cycle. He lives in his grandparents’ house, and he helps them when they need it. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence given to him in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tires and a battery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock of beans, local rice, and groundnuts in bulk

loans.name: Roca Blanca Group

texts.es:
Cascada, es un centro focal mediano situado muy cerca de una embotelladora de gaseosas llamada “Cascada”, muy famosa hace unos años.  La asociación comunal “Roca Blanca” esta en formación con el deseo de asociarse para solicitar crédito e impulsar sus negocios.
Los negocios son diversos, como  venta de víveres, taller de mecánica – soldador, tejido de mantas, venta de cosméticos, artesanìas en aguayo y madera, tejido de chompas y confección de buzos.

La señora Valentina C., casada con 4 hijos, 2 varones y 2 mujeres, desea iniciar este primer crédito para incrementar el capital de su negocio que es tejido de mantas.  

Estas mantas pasan por un proceso de tres pasos:  primero se teje la manta en sí, con el diseño que este de moda, despues de lograr un rectángulo de 70 centìmetros por 150 centímetros, la socia teje por el borde con un ganchillo haciendo un diseño especial de unos doce centìmetros, finalmente se añaden largos flecos, que con anticipación habían sido torcelados para rodear la manta.  Las mantas son vendidas en la zona 16 de Julio los jueves y dómingo, de 5 a 7 de la mañana.
texts.en:
Cascada is a medium-sized focal center located very near a soft-drink bottling plant called, "Cascada," that was very famous a few years ago. The "Roca Blanca" communal association is organizing itself with the goal to seek financing to push their businesses forward. The businesses are diverse: food sales, machine shop, welding, blanket weaving, cosmetics sales, multicolored woolen cloth and wood crafts, sweater weaving, sweatshirt making. Valentina C. is married and has 4 children: two boys and two girls. She wants to start her first loan in order to increase her working capital; she is a blanket weaver. These blankets go through a three-step process: first, the blanket itself is woven with whatever design is in fashion. Once a rectangle measuring 70x150 centimeters is attained, the member weaves the edges with a weaving hook making a special, 12 centimeter, design. Finally, long fringe, that had previously been knotted and twisted to encircle the blanket, is added. The blankets are sold in the 16 de Julio zone every Thursday and Sunday from 5am to 7 am.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cones and balls of wool.

loans.name: Margaret Njeri

texts.en:
Margaret, a 38-year-old lady, is married to Charles and they are both small scale farmers. They are blessed with three daughters and one son whose ages are between 11 and 18. Margaret has been practicing both dairy farming and poultry keeping for the last ten years. This has been her source of income.

She was introduced to Kadet by an existing client. She plans to expand both her dairy farm and poultry keeping with the loan for which she has applied. She has no credit history with any other MFI or Bank. Margaret intends to expand her poultry farm with the extra income generated from her farming businesses. 

Her hopes and dreams are to be a supplier of eggs and milk in large quantities, and she describes herself as a hardworking farmer.

loans.use: To expand her poultry farm and her dairy farm.

loans.name: Sovanna

texts.en: Mrs. Sovanna C. is 37 years old and she is a villager who lives in Peam Ta Aek village in Kandal province. She is a seamstress in the garment factory and she sells clothes to earn a living. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Sovanna C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more clothes to enlarge her business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her living. Mrs. Sovanna C. is a widow without any children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn P. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old. Evelyn is married. Evelyn owns and operates a business selling gasoline in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 7000 PHP and was used to expand the business.

Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to to expand the business. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand the business

loans.name: Geethani

texts.en:
Geethani is a hard working 44-year-old married woman living with her husband, two daughters, and one son in the town of Telijjawila in southern Sri Lanka.

Geethani is managing a business where she makes spices. She has been doing this for eight months.  In her business, she buys spices, then grinds and packages them to sell to shops. 

She has asked for a loan of 20,000 LKR from BRAC to help purchase a grinding mill.

Thank you for considering supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To purchase a grinding mill

loans.name: Lucero Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “Lucero” se reúnen cada treinta días en las oficinas de la unidad de micro finanzas de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, el banco comunal se encuentra en el ciclo 11 y está conformado por  18  personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 

Delia, tiene 61 años, es madre soltera,  tiene una hija y es natural de la Santa Teresa de la provincia de Convención del departamento del Cusco. 

Delia nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Lucero”  somos 18 integrantes (15 mujeres y 3 varones) y me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. Delia trabaja en el área administrativa en el  centro educativo especial de niños “CEBER”.  Ella requiere el crédito para apoyar la educación de su hija que estudia la carrera profesional de turismo en el instituto “ESITUR”.  

Las actividades económicas de algunos de los socios a lo que se dedican son  a las ventas de  comestibles, venta de productos secos, venta de cuyes, venta de autopartes, venta de panadería, venta de muebles  de madera y otros socios brindan servicios de transportes, empleada, atención de familia, profesora de inicial, lavar ropa y además son profesionales en ingeniería de sistemas y educación.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora de la región sur del país.
texts.en:
The members of the “Lucero” communal bank meet every thirty days in the micro-finance offices of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. Currently this communal bank is in its 11th loan cycle. It is made up of 18 hardworking and entrepreneurial people who look for every opportunity to get ahead and work hard every day to provide a better future for their children. Delia is 61 years old and is a single mother. She has one daughter and is from Santa Teresa, in the province of Convención, in the department of Cusco. Delia tells us, “In my communal bank, Lucero, there are 18 members (15 women and 3 men) and they chose me as the representative of the communal bank to tell the story of my business.” Delia works in administration in the children’s educational center “CEBER.” She needs the loan to pay for her daughter’s education. Her daughter is studying tourism in the “ESITUR” institute. The businesses of the other members are selling grocery items, dry grains, guinea pigs, car parts, working as a domestic servant, a nanny, a kindergarten teacher, and washing clothes. There are also professionals who work in engineering, computer systems, and education. The members value and are grateful for the loan provided through this program and they promise to repay the loan in the established time period. Cusco is a city that is characterized by its archeological attractions, its historic center, its scenic views, and its history. It is a charming city in the southern region of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's education

loans.name: Lázaro Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Lázaro Jesús H.  es casado y con 6 hijos de los cuales dos de ellos son menores de edad y los otros cuatro adolecentes, ellos habitan en Sabana Grande, un barrio capitalino conocido por su alto índice de delincuencia, que amenazantes de la población que allí mora, estos datos son tomados según la Policía Nacional de Nicaragua, así mismo sus habitantes son personas de escasos recursos entre los cuales son de familias grandes, sin empleos o fuentes de ingresos que no les permite mejorar sus niveles económico-sociales.

El señor Lázaro se ha dedicado toda su vida a la carpintería, empezando como aprendiz a muy temprana edad y el buen ahorro le permitió abrir su propio taller de ebanistería, comenzando sus trabajos en la reparación de muebles, ahora su demanda ha crecido, gracias a su buen prestigio que le permite nuevos clientes y nuevas solicitudes de trabajo que aportan en gran medida a su economía, con el negocio en pie solicita un préstamo para la inversión destinando a realizar reparaciones al techo de su casa, debido a que está bien deteriorado y amenaza con la seguridad de sus hijos y la de su esposa, esta inversión les permitirá mejores comodidades que favorecerá al bienestar de todos.
texts.en:
Lázaro Jesús is married and has six children, four of whom are adolescents and the others are younger. They live in Sabana Grande, a neighborhood in the capital, known for its high crime rate, according to the Nicaraguan National Police statistics. Its residents are people of limited resource; mostly large families with no employment or sources of income that would allow them to improve their economic status. Lázaro has been a carpenter all of his life, having started as an apprentice when he was very young. He was able to save enough money to start his own carpentry shop, beginning with furniture repair. His services are now very much in demand, thanks to his good reputation. He gets new customers and job orders, which help boost his income. He is asking for this loan in order to be able to make repairs his roof, which is now in very bad state and it threatens the security of his children. This will allow him to better provide for their well being.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Chicas Lindas Group

texts.es:
El comité Chicas Lindas nace hace aproximadamente 1 año, y actualmente se encuentran trabajando muy conforme con las actividades que realizan. 
 Realizaran  actividades para ayudar y asi se ayudadan entre todas para  el pago de las cuotas de los créditos que reciben de la Fundación Paraguaya.
 Para los ingresos individuales cada una realiza una actividad, una de las ellas es la señora Francisca quien tiene una peluqueria donde ofrece sus servicios de peluqueria.
Ella hace muy buenos trabajos en su salon es muy frecuentada por las clientas.
Para ofrecer mayor a sus clientas ella queire comprar un sillón para peluquería por lo que solicita el préstamo.
texts.en:
The Chicas Lindas Communal Bank formed approximately one year ago. They are currently happily working with the activities they do. They will carry out activities in order to help. That way they help everyone to make the payments on the loans they receive from the Fundación Paraguaya. For the individual incomes each one carries out an activity. One of these women is Francisca. She has a beauty salon, and she offers hairdressing services. She does very good work in her salon, and her shop is frequented by many customers. In order to offer her customers more she wants to buy a hairdresser’s chair. That is why she is requesting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a hairdresser's chair and other tools

loans.name: Sambour

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambour E. is 49 years old and is a villager who lives in Roluos village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sorn Nget, are farmers who own 3 hectares of land and own a plowing machine to support their farming crop. For this farm, Mrs. Sambour E. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline to support her farming crop. 

Aside from farming, Mr. Sorn Nget is also a plowing machine driver who is able to earn a small income to support his family. This couple has four children, two of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory, while others are students in the local school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou O. is from the village of Wadya, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 31 years old. Marilou is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Marilou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anna Liza

texts.en:
Anna Liza S. is a 39-year old married woman who supports her family by fish vending and fishing and by making hand sewn smocking embroidery. She lives in Purok Green Shell, Brgy. Canmoros, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental.  Anna Liza has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1992 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 8000. 

Anna Liza is now borrowing PHP 15000 for additional working capital.  This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP 13000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Anna Liza aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and insure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

----------------------------------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: Tomasa tiene 53 años, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y su nieto. DesD. hace mas D. 8 años, se dedica a la preparación y venta D. comidas, y entre las más solicitadas, están el arroz con pollo, tallarines, chanfainita y salda D. ocopa con papas (platillos peruanos); que son del gusto D. la mayoría D. sus clientes, entre ellos deportistas que juegan en las lozas deportivas D. su localidad, pero los días D. semana venD. mazamorra morada y arroz con leche (postre peruano). Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es que es una actividad tranquila y los realiza sin apuro alguno además que le es rentable, D. esa manera pueD. estar pendiente D. su nieto.  En el futuro le gustaría tener un restaurante, ya que la cocina es lo que más le apasiona hacer. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas oportunamente, ya que desea contar con posteriores créditos, y D. ese modo aumentar el  capital D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar ollas y utensilios para facilitar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Tomasa is 53 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and grandson. For the last 8 years, she has been preparing and selling food. Some of the most popular are chicken and rice, noodles, fried rice and potatoes with Ocopa sauce (Peruvian dishes). These are what most of her customers like. Among them are athletes who play on the community sports fields, but on weekdays she sells mazamorra morada and rice pudding (Peruvian desserts). What she likes the most about her work is that it is a calm activity and she does it with no rush and it is profitable. With this job, she can watch her grandson. In the future, she would like to have a restaurant, since cooking is her passion. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to making her payments on time, since she wants to have subsequent loans to expand her working capital. With the loan that she is asking for, she plans on buying pots and utensils to facilitate her work.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pots and utensils

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz;  La socia tiene 29 años de edad;  ella es madre soltera  y tiene 1 hijo, La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de repuestos para autos, ella trabaja y sin ningún apoyo cuida de su menor hijo; la socia es muy disciplinada y tiene el sueño de ver crecer feliz a su hijo, ella solo desea la felicidad para su menor, un día quiere también poder estudiar administración. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de artículos de ferretería.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank “Virgen del Rosario de San Sebastian.” This bank is located in the Huanchac distric, in the Cusco province, department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Luz. She is 29 years old and a single mother of one child. She works in the purchase and sales of auto parts. She works and cares for her young child without any help. She is very disciplined and has a dream of seeing her child grow up happy. She only wants happiness for her child. One day she hopes that she can study administration. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of articles for her auto shop.

She is thankful and appreciates the loan granted by these means. She also promises to complete the payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To puchase articles for her auto parts shop

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry K. is a 23-year-old man who is married and has one child who is now three years old. Henry has been in the fishing business for the past year now. He works in Sita, Malindi, and his clients are mostly from that area.

This is the first time Henry is asking for a loan from KADET after being introduced to the company by a credit officer who is a staff member there. The loan he wants amounts to 10,000 KES, and he plans to use some of it to buy more fishing equipment so as to strengthen his business and use the rest to educate his son who is going to nursery school and to sustain his young family. He wants his business to become well-established and have its own premises.

loans.use: To buy more fishing equipment and pay for his son's nursery school

loans.name: Zulekha

texts.en:
Zulekha is a married woman with two children, one attending school and another still too young for school. She prepares food (french fries and flat bread) and sells it to her neighbors. With this loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (Kes) she wants to purchase cooking oil, flour, and potatoes.

The challenge for her business is from the seasonality of her food, as she sells more in the afternoon than in the evening when her customers are in their homes preparing food for themselves. She has been in the business for six months and was a housewife before.

She rents her home and has electricity with no water. She cites her greatest expense as school fees. She joined Yehu for the financial support that they offer. Zulekha hopes to open a shop where she can start a clothing business.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, wheat flour, and sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi  est une femme mariée et mère de 1 enfant, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de bè kpota qui est quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. En 2002 elle a entamée le commerce de céréales  précisément le maïs qui est très utilisé dans la cuisine togolaise. Elle est seule à exercer ce commerce et sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. Elle fait face à une baisse de son stock de marchandises et sollicite de  WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 28 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
Akouvi is a married woman and the mother of one child. She lives with her family in the Bè Kpota district, one of the peripheral districts of the city of Lomé. 

In 2002 she started selling cereals, precisely corn, which is widely used in Togolese cuisine. She is the only one in this business and her customer base is made up of all types of people. 

She is experiencing a decline in her stock and is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 28 bags of charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase corn

loans.name: Tobiko

texts.en:
Tobiko O. is 36 years old. He is a farmer and supports five people in his family. His spouse is Nanyikae and they have children aged between one and 15 years. Nanyikae is a housewife and also helps Tobiko in his farming. Tobiko has been a wheat farmer for the last ten years. This will be his second loan and he is planning to buy chemical and fertilizer. Wheat can be affected by pests that destroy it if not sprayed.

He is planning to use the anticipated profit to rent a bigger piece of land to increase his wheat production. His dream is to become a large-scale farmer and be financially stable enough to support his family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and fertilizer for his wheat farm.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Matugga in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child.  Shamim has a poultry business that she has been engaged in for four years.         

To help expand her business, Shamim has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase chicken feed.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Shamim hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Shamim hopes to have her own plot. Shamim is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which is helping her improve future prospects and provide a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed

loans.name: Pablia

texts.en:
Mrs. Pablia D. is from the village of Dimaluna, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old and is married to Edilberto who manages their business. They were blessed with 5 children who are now of school age. She is presently engaged in a coco lumber business. She has been working in this kind of business for 14 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 from PMPC. Pablia is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a band saw mill. This loan will be her fourth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family and to cover future emergencies.



About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a band saw mill

loans.name: Fanny Patricia

texts.es:
Fanny Patricia  B. C.  tiene 31 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y con los hijos, vive en el cantón  Ventanas en la Provincia de los ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.
