UNIDOS VENCEREMOS  se encuentra ubicada a pocos minutos de la Oficina Ventanas en el recinto la América , perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Fanny Patricia  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac, Agro insumos Karlita y Comercial Jiménez  los vende en la feria en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandu. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Fanny Patricia B. C. is 31 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has two children.

The 'Unidos Venceremos' (Together We Will Overcome) solidarity group is located a few minutes from our Ventanas office, in La América district, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this solidarity group work in short-cycle agriculture growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.  They have been doing this for a long time.

Fanny Patricia is a farmer.  She has been growing corn, rice and pigeon peas for 2 years.  She buys her products in Agripac, Agro Insumos Karlita and Comercial Jiménez and sells them in the market in the same district.

Fanny Patricia is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her corn, rice and pigeon pea crops.  The support of this loan will help her financially to cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to buy a house.  She enjoys taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Onondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité  Oñondivepa ” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Yataity. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas, cría de animales, etc. 
Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Este comité ya están en su tercer ciclo, todo este tiempo demostraron puntualidad, solidaridad y  unión entres las compañeras.
	La  Sra. Clementina M. es una de las integrantes de Yataity, del Barrio Ñatiury Guasu tiene 40 años de edad, casada, Actualmente tiene 4 Hijos, todos  mayores de edad.
 
      Ella se dedica en crías de animales como gallinas, cerdos, vacas, en su domicilio, es una señora muy trabajadora. 

             La Sra. con este crédito está pensando comprar Balanceados y así tener mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
The group named "Onondivepa" is made up of various neighbors in the city of Yataity. All of the members have their own businesses, including sales, fast food, raising livestock, etc.

The members of this group formed a very tight community, capable of collectively carrying out activities that will strengthen their companionship. This group is on their third loan cycle. They have always demonstrated responsibility, collegiality and team work among themselves.

Clementina M. is one of the members in Yataity, in the Natiury district. Guasu is 40 years old, she is married and she has 4 grown children. 

She raises livestock, such as chickens, pigs, and cattle on her property. She is a very hardworking woman. 

With this loan she will purchase feed for the livestock which will translate into better profits.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn L. is from the village of Misom, Baliangao. She is 33 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector growing assorted crops to sell. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase housing materials. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Evelyn from PMPC. 
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house repair

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yaya D. est un homme de 20 ans et sans enfants. Il vit chez son père dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, à son jeune âge il suivait les animaux c’est à dire l’activité du berger auprès de son père au village.
Quelles années plus tard il décida  de quitter le village pour Bougouni afin d’apprendre le commerce notamment la vente  d’articles divers de boutique auprès de son frère.
 Avec 3 année d'expérience, il maîtrise cette activité.
 Pour le renforcement de son commerce, monsieur Yaya D. décide de prendre un prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter des articles divers pour sa boutique. Il est à son premier prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso.
 Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et à Bamako. Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
 Avec ce prêt, monsieur Yaya D. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000 FCFA.
 Avec ce bénéfice il envisage toujours agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Yaya D. is a 20-year old man, without children. He lives in his father’s home in the Torakabougou district of Bougoni. Not having gone to school, he started guarding animals from an early age on, that is to say, he worked as a shepherd together with his father in the village. Some years later he decided to leave the village for Bougouni in order to learn how to run a small business, learning from his brother how to operate a general store. Now, with three years of experience, he knows his work well. 

In order to bolster his business, Mr. Yaya D. had decided to take out a loan from Soro Yiriwaso in order to purchase miscellaneous items for his store. He is on his first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. He stocks up in Bougouni and in Bamako. His customers come from the local area.

With this loan, Mr. Yaya D. plans to achieve a monthly income of 25,000 West African Francs. He plans to use this income in order to expand his store further.

loans.use: Purchasing miscellaneous items for his store

loans.name: Moises Francisco

texts.es: Moisés Francisco tiene 41 años, su actividad es la venta de madera acerrada. Hace más de 9 años que tiene este negocio, inicio con fondos propios ya que tiene que mantener a su familia siempre se ha caracterizado por ser un padre responsable que se encarga de las necesidades de su hogar y familia. El motivo de este crédito es para la compra de diferentes tipos de madera y así obtener mejores ganancias. Uno de los mayores desafíos que enfrenta es obtener un buen precio por la madera ya que algunas veces es difícil negociar el precio de la madera.
texts.en:
Moisés Francisco is 41 years old and has a business selling lumber. He has been in this business for more than nine years. Moisés started this business with his own money since he has to support his family. He has always been known as a responsible father who takes charge of meeting the needs of his household and his family.

The reason for this loan is to buy different types of wood so that he can generate better earnings. One of his greatest challenges is obtaining a good price for wood because sometimes it can be difficult to negotiate.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy wood

loans.name: Mrs. Bresh Mabb Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bresh M. is a village bank president who has been selected by ten people who make up this village bank loan. They each want to improve their families' living standard with their portion of the loan. They are located in Doung Khpos village in Takeo province. 

Mrs. Bresh M. is a door-to-door clothes and mosquito net seller. In this way she can earn some profit with which to support her family. As her business is going well, she wants to expand. She is, therefore, applying for a loan to buy more clothes and mosquito nets to resell. 

Her husband, Mr. Vat Vong, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he grows rice,  not for sale, but to support his family. They have three children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a student and the other is 2 years old.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and mosquito nets for resale

loans.name: Milca

texts.es:
Milca tiene 39 años, es soltera y tiene dos hijas a su cargo. Viven en casa con sus padres en la ciudad de Picsi, una comunidad urbana y emergente de tamaño grande. El mercado de Picsi es un mercado emergente con grandes proyecciones de desarrollo.

Desde hace más de tres años, Milca cuenta con un negocio donde vende dulces, golosinas, abarrotes, juguetes, helados y artículos varios del hogar. También brinda servicios de fotocopiado. Con el préstamo desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería para la temporada escolar como cuadernos, papelotes, mochilas, loncheras, gotas, y tintes. Esto ayudará a incrementar sus ventas significativamente ya que dará mayores variedades de servicio. Para lograr sus metas, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Milca is 39 years old and single with two children in her care.  They live in her parents' house in the city of Pisci, a sizable and growing urban community.  The market in Pisci is a growing market with large amounts of development projected.

For the last three years, Milca has run a business selling sweets, snacks, groceries, toys, ice creams, and household items.  She also offers photocopying services.  With the loan proceeds she would like to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise for the school season, such as notebooks, paper, backpacks, lunch boxes, beads, and paints. This will help increase her sales significantly as she will be offering a greater variety of services. To achieve her goals, she has decided to ask for a loan in the amount of $375 USD.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for the school season

loans.name: Zoila Mercedes

texts.es:
Zoila Mercedes A. M. tiene 19 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y  con los  hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Zoila se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terreno y ganado.

Le gusta cocinar y lavar la ropa.
texts.en:
Zoila Mercedes A. M. is 19 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and two children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.

The 'GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN' community bank is located in Guanto Cruz community, in Guanujo parish, in Guaranda canton.  The 22 members of this group work in agriculture, growing blackberries and corn.  They also raise farmyard animals and dairy cows for making cheese.

Zoila is a farmer who grows blackberries and corn.  She also raises farmyard animals.  She buys her supplies in Guaranda and sells her produce in Guaranda market.

Zoila is requesting this loan to buy supplies, animals to raise, and feed for her animals.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her work such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to buy a plot of land and some livestock.

Zoila enjoys cooking and washing clothes.

loans.use: to buy supplies, animals to raise, and feed for her animals

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es: Yeny tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 8 años. Vive junto a su familia en casa de su madre en José Leonardo Ortiz, un distrito urbano, relativamente grande y pacífico en la provincia de Chiclayo, ubicado en el norte de Perú.  Gana la vida vendiendo ropa en el Mercado Carolina. Tiene más de 6 meses de experiencia con y maneja su negocio muy bien. Desea ampliar su negocio y surtir su puesto con ropa colegial. La demanda para estos productos ha aumentado ahora que la temporada escolar ha comenzado en Perú. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles. Con esta inversión, Yeny podrá aumentar sus ventas y generar mayores ingresos.  De esta manera, ella puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.
texts.en: Yeny is 30 years old, married and has an 8-year-old child. She lives with her family in her mother’s house in José Leonardo Ortiz, a somewhat large and peaceful urban area in the Chiclayo province in northern Perú. She makes a living selling clothes in the Carolina Market. She has been doing this business for more than six months and she runs her business well. She would like to grow her business by providing school clothing. The demand for this product is growing now as the school year is beginning in Perú. With this goal in mind, she is asking for a loan of 500 new soles. With this loan she will be able to increase her sales and earnings. Thereby she will be able to help her husband with the family’s expenses.

loans.use: to provide an assortment of school clothing for her booth.

loans.name: Vidalia

texts.es:
Vidalia tiene 31 años. Ella posee un puesto de venta de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños en el Mercado Municipal de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, además de juegos de toallas, sábanas y manteles.
Ella trabaja en esta actividad desde el año 2006. Es madre soltera de dos hijos menores de edad.
Necesita de este crédito para adquirir prendas de la nueva temporada (Otoño). En sus inicios trabajó con su hermana, quien también se dedica a la misma actividad, pero gracias a sus esfuerzos pudo independizar su puesto.
En el futuro desea culminar la construcción de su vivienda, que la está mandando realizar de a poco acorde a sus posibilidades económicas; para que de esta forma le pueda brindar mayor seguridad a sus hijos, y más adelante también darles la posibilidad de que puedan estudiar y llegar inclusive a obtener sus títulos universitarios.
texts.en:
Vidalia is 31 years old.  She sells clothes for women, men and children at a stand she has in the Municipal Market of the city of San Lorenzo.  She also sells sets of towels, sheets and tablecloths.  She’s been doing this work since 2006.  She is a single mother of two minor children.

She needs this loan to buy clothes for the upcoming season (Fall).  In the beginning, she worked with her sister but, thanks to her efforts, she was able to carry her stand independently.

In the future, she would like to complete construction on her house.  She is working on little by little, as her financial situation allows.  This would enable her to provide better security for her children.  In the future, she would also like to give them the possibility of studying and even the ability to obtain college degrees.

loans.use: buy clothing for the upcoming Fall season.

loans.name: Juana Luz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MATEO PUMACAHUA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana Luz; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos, cuyes y gallinas y también vende artesanía en forma ambulatoria y los animales también los vende en forma ambulatoria llevando a lugares como Urubamba y Cusco, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los animales y también para comprar animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Luz is a member of the Communal Bank “Mateo Pumacahua” which is located in the District of Chinchero, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 46 years old, married, and has two children. Juana Luz divides her time between her daily activities and her business of raising animals such as pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens. She sells the animals as a traveling merchant by bringing them to places such as Urubamba and Cusco. Juana Luz also sells handicrafts in the same manner. She wants to expand her business of selling animals, so she is requesting a loan to buy more of them as well as the appropriate feed.

Juana Luz is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase animals and the appropriate feed.

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida is a seamstress by trade. She sews clothes for her neighborhood clients. Due to the good quality of her work, she receives regular orders from her customers. She has 9 children. Her two elder daughters work and the other two are enrolled in a local school to get an education while the others stay at home. Rashida couldn’t provide education to all of her children due to financial constraints. 

Rashida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s fruit selling business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruit to improve his business. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Rashida hopes that an investment will help him improve his business which will result in better financial conditions for her family. 

Rashida is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rashida.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruit for resale.

loans.name: Bayerena Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 19 octobre 2001. Le groupe est  constitué de six femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Khady qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge deux autre enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle fait un petit commerce de tomate et de bissab (feuilles oseille). 

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités afin de générer plus de bénéfice.

Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was formed on October 19, 2001. The group is made up of six women who live in the same district. Their main business involves selling small items. 

Madame Khady who is on the right in the photo, raising her hand, is the leader of the group. She is 43, married, and the mother of six children. She is also raising two other children who were confided to her by relatives. 

She has a little business selling tomatoes and hibiscus petals. This loan will allow her to bolster her capital and expand her business so as to earn more income. Her goal is to participate in improving family living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc.) and adding to her savings.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and dried hibiscus flowers.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
For the past 10 years, Nana has been cooking banku (a corn-dough dish) and fried fish at Abura for sale. Nana has received a junior high education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a customs officer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Her loan will be used to buy maize and fresh fish to cook and sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy maize and fresh fish to cook and sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al bA. comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; El bA. está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia ella tiene 36 años de edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de librería, el vende cuadernos, libros, lápices y tarjadores, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de librería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería al por mayor para la librería.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She is a member of the communal bank "Patron San Sebastian". The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco. 

She is 36 years old, married, and she has 6 children. She alternates her daily activities with her office supply business. She sells notebooks, books, pencils and binders. She works from 7am to 6pm. It is through this business that she is able to provide for her children. She wants to expand her office supply business. She requests a loan to purchase merchandise in wholesale for her supply store.

She is happy for her loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase office supplies in wholesale for her business.

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Friday is a 45-year-old married man with three children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to educate his children. He has been working in the transport sector for three years now. With the income generated, he has been able to provide the basics for his family. His challenges are mechanical breakdowns, and his desire is to own at least three motorcycles. Friday needs this loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs.Sok is 33 years old and her husband is 58. She earns a living as a farmer and by raising ducks. Her husband earns a living by selling sugar made from palm in the busiest market in their area. Like his wife, he earns about $5 a day. Mrs.Sok is applying for a loan for $550 to buy more sugar for her husband to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar for her husband to sell in a local market.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama San Antonio, se localiza en el estado de Morelos, México, es un pueblo bonito de clima calido, está integrado por el señor José Socorro va a comprar alimento para criar mojarras, la señora María Fidela va a comprar puercos, borregos, toros, las señoras Felipa y María de la Luz va a comprar jabón, azúcar, leche, huevos, la señora Patricia va a comprar alimento para engordar borregos, la señora María Mercedes va a comprar puercos para engorar, la señora Virginia va a comprar verduras, carne para elaborar sus taquitos. La señora Virginia tiene 51 años de edad, ella estudio hasta el 2º. Año de primaria, ella es casada tiene siete hijos, cinco ya mayores de edad ya trabajan y dos hijos menores un varón de 15 años de edad estudia la secundaria, una niña de 9 años de edad estudia la primaria, ella vende taquitos de bistec, longaniza y tripa, ella solicito su crédito para comprar 1 quemador, refrescos, verduras, carne para elaborar los taquitos y una parte para poner el piso donde vende los taquitos, ella inicio su negocio hace 25 años por falta de recursos económicos ya que su esposo no tenía trabajo y sus hijos estaban pequeños así que consiguió prestado con su cuñado para poner su negocio y comenzó a vender sus taquitos, su negocio es importante porque le deja ganancias cuando vende bien, ella recuerda cuando su nieta se enfermo consiguió $500.00 pesos para llevarla al doctor y comprar  las medicinas y con las ganancias de su negocio pudo pagar, ella se siente orgullosa por la preferencia de sus clientes que son las familias y cuando le dicen que sus taquitos están sabrosos, las ganancias las reinvierte comprando los insumos para seguir vendiendo, su hija y su esposo le ayudan en su negocio a preparar y a despachar los taquitos. Sus sueños y esperanzas son hacer más grande su negocio que sus hijos pequeños logren una profesión. Ella está feliz con este préstamo porque no donde quiera ayudan a las personas desinteresadamente. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación realidad “muchas gracias por confiar en nosotros, no les vamos a fallar y que sigan ayudando a más personas en sus negocios y a sus familias”. falta en la foto el señor Jose Socorro.
texts.en: This solidarity group is named "San Antonio." They are located in the state of Morelos, Mexico, in a beautiful village with a warm climate. The group is comprised of Mr. José Socorro, who will use this loan to buy food for raising mojarra [a type of fish]; Ms. María Fidela, who will buy pigs, sheep and bulls; Ms. Felipa and Ms. María de la Luz, who will buy soap, sugar, milk and eggs; Ms. Patricia who will buy food for fattening her sheep; Ms. María Mercedes who will buy pigs to fatten; and Ms. Virginia, who is going to buy vegetables and meat to make her tacos. Virgina is 51 years old and studied until the second year of primary school. She is married and has seven children, five of whom are grown up and working. Her two younger children are a 15 year-old boy who is in secondary school and a 9 year-old girl who attends primary school. Virginia sells steak, sausage and tripe tacos. She is requesting a loan to buy one burner, soft drinks, and vegetables and meat to prepare her tacos. She will also use part to install a floor where she sells her tacos. Virginia started her business 25 years ago because, with her husband out of work and her children still young, she lacked the necessary economic resources. She obtained a loan with her brother-in-law to put into her business and started to sell her tacos. Her business is important because it brings in profits when she's selling well. Virginia remembers once when her granddaughter was sick and she came up with 500 pesos to bring her to the doctor and to pay for her medicines. It was the profits from her business that made it possible for Virginia to pay. She feels proud that the families who are her customers prefer her business and is proud when they say that her tacos are delicious. She reinvests her profits to buy ingredients to continue selling. Her daughter and her husband help her with the business, preparing and selling the tacos. Virginia's hopes and dreams are to make her business larger and for her youngest children to reach professional careers. She is happy to receive this loan because it's not just anywhere that you find people who help others unselfishly. The members of this group would like to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad: "Thank you very much for having confidence in us. We will not fail you, so that you will continue helping more people with their businesses and families." Mr. José Socorro is missing in the photograph above.

loans.use: to buy a burner, soft drinks, and vegetables and meat for preparing tacos

loans.name: Banco Comunal Tesoro De Dios Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal Tesoro De Dios está conformado por nueve integrantes que se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas, ellos formaron este grupo La representante es la señora Azucena De La Concepción de 63 años tiene 13 hijos que viven de manera independiente. La señora Azucena se dedica a la elaboración y venta de cuajada desde hace cuatro años, es una señora muy reconocida en su población pues siempre ofrece muy buenos productos a sus clientes y la reconocen. Ella solicita  el préstamo para comprar materia prima como  leche, sal, entre otros productos.  Está muy contenta ya que su negocio le deja muy buenas ganancias para proporcionar el ingreso diario de su hogar y de igual manera para realizar sus pagos para el préstamo. 

Los otros integrantes son Milagro Justina se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía. Ines Auxiliadora se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía. Darvin Pastor se dedica a la compra y venta de insecticidas. Candida Rosa se dedica a la venta de artesanía. Juana Betania se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía. Maritza Del Carmen se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía. Maria Eugenia se dedica elaboración de artesanía. Dominga Xiomara elaboración de tortillas. dan las gracias a por el apoyo que les han brindado para salir adelante con esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Banco Comunal Tesoro de Dios consists of nine members who work in different economic activities.  The representative, Azucena de la Concepción, is 63 and has 13 children who live on their own.  Azucena has been making and selling cottage cheese for four years.  She is well known in her community because she always offers very good products and her customers recognize her.  She is requesting the loan to buy ingredients such as milk, salt, and other products.  She is very happy since her business yields her a good profit to provide for the daily income of her home as well as to be able to make her loan payments.

The other members are Milagro Justina, Inés Auxiliadora, Juana Betania, Maritza del Carmen, and María Eugenia, who make crafts; Darvin Pastor, who buys and sells insecticides; Cándida Rosa, who sells crafts; and Dominga Xiomara, who makes tortillas.  They are thankful for the support they have received to get ahead and for offering them this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy milk, salt, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Salustina Vicenta

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Amor Y Paz se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Calderón de la  ciudad de Portoviejo, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos.

La señora Salustina es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas y se divierte en las reuniones. Tiene 53 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 4 hijos, dos hijas aun viven con ella una de ellas está casada y vive con su esposo y dos hijos pequeños que son la alegría de nuestra amiga. El marido se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
Nuestra amiga a más de ser una gran ama de casa también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta. También ella compra maní lo procesa y luego lo distribuye molido a comerciantes de su zona o lo lleva a entregar a la ciudad de Portoviejo donde cuenta con buena clientela. Trabaja todos los días, lo que es ropa la deja a crédito  y cobra cada quince días pero el maní  cobra en efectivo ya que son ventas más lejanas.  Lleva 11 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, ropa de niños y maní para procesarlo y venderlo.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y en el banco.
texts.en:
The "Amor Y Paz" ("Love and Peace") Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Calderón parish in Portoviejo city.  This is an area where people mainly work in agriculture, livestock and selling products.

Señora Salustina is a founding member of the Communal Bank, which she likes because her colleagues are very united and she enjoys the meetings.  She is 53 years old, and has a common-law marriage with four children: two daughters still live with her, one of them is married and lives with her husband and two small children, who are the joy of our friend's life.  Her husband works in agriculture and livestock.

In addition to managing the household, our friend also works selling all types of clothes, which she does door-to-door.  She also buys peanuts which she processes and grinds, and later distributes to the retailers in her area, or she takes them to Portoviejo city where she has a good customer base.

She works every day.  She provides credit for her clothes, which she collects on every two weeks, but she charges cash for her peanut sales as they are further away.  She has been doing this work for 11 years, and it's going very well for her.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as trousers, blouses, children's clothing and peanuts for processing and selling.

Her dreams are to continue moving ahead with her business and with the bank.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, children's clothing and peanuts.

loans.name: Umjima

texts.en:
Umjima is a 39-year-old married woman with two children two of whom are in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years

Umjima requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will be used for building a concrete house in future

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: C2362 Abizeranye Group

texts.en:
Faina, 49 years old, is married and has seven children between the ages of 5 and 22 years old. She has owned a sewing business for about thirty years. Her business is open from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day. Faina is the leader of this group, which is called "Abizeranye" in the local language. In the photo, she is the first person on the left. 

Faina has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more clothes for sewing. Faina and her team will reinvest their profits into their businesses and save for their children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sewing.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a 34-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Abeer is selling clothes from her home since she can't afford the expenses of renting a store. Abeer is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more clothes to meet the increased demands from the neighborhood.

Abeer is looking to expand her business by contracting with nearby shops to sell her products.

Due to culturA. issues, the man in the picture is Abeer's husband.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella, a 43 year old lady, runs a general shop. This is a business that she started 15 years ago. Stella works hard in her business so as to help her husband in raising their three children. Besides operating a general shop, she does farming for more income generation.

Stella hopes to open other outlets of her business in five years. She needs a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to add stock of cereals in her shop.

loans.use: To add stock of cereals.

loans.name: Dorjhand

texts.en: Dorjhand is 33 years old and lives with her husband and four kids in her own house in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Her husband is a security guard and helps with her business. Her three elder kids are school students and the other one goes to kindergarten. She started her business in 2003 by sewing at home. She is very experienced and quite popular in the nearby area. Now that she has enough experience, she is planning to rent a counter in a market. To do so, she needs more supplies. Therefore, she is requesting 800,000 MNT to buy materials.

loans.use: To buy materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Marakaru Group

texts.en:
Martin is the facilitator of the Marakaru group. Martin and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Martin takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Martin had a very good maize yield, harvesting 10 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Martin was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Martin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Martin will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Marakaru group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Arrete

texts.fr: Madame Arrête  est âgée de 45 ans. Elle habite dans une des localités communautaires du Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 6 et 30 ans. Elle gère depuis plus de 10 ans un restaurant dans le quartier ou elle habite. Auparavant elle vendait seulement du petit déjeuner. Mais actuellement elle a élargi son activité aux  3 repas  journaliers. Elle a choisi le secteur de la restauration par passion mais aussi a cause de son aspect lucratif. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis  aout 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de poulets et  de viande en grande quantité, de sacs de couscous, d’huile pour les besoins de la préparation du diner qu’il commercialise. Son objectif est de renforcer son activité, d’accroitre ses bénéfices  pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Arrête is 45 years old.  She lives in Senegal.  She is married and is the mother of 5 children, ages 6 to 30.  For more than ten years she has been the manager of a restaurant in her neighborhood.  Initially she only sold breakfast but has expanded her business and now serves three meals per day.  She chose to work in the restaurant business because this is her passion, but also because this activity allows her to make some money.  She has been a member of a local branch of UIMCEC since August 2011.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 CFA francs, which will allow her to buy large quantities of chickens, meat, couscous bags and oil for the preparation of meals.  Her goal is to boost her business, increase her profits and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy some chickens, oil, meat and couscous in order to prepare and sell meals.

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
maimouna  agée de 37 ans habite dans région du sud du sénégal,mariée avec 4 enfants dont 3 sont à l'école.
Le fils ainé fait la classe seconde le 2em est en classe de 3em et le 3em fait la 6em secondaire.
Maimouna depuis son mariage travailler dans des rizière et fait la volaille en meme temps pour nourrire sa famille car son mari ne travail pas.Avec ce crédit,elle achète des poussins pour agrandire son poulailler qui est une activité tres rentable chez elle.
Maimouna habite dans une maison en location elle souhaite dans l'avenir etre dans sa propre maison;
texts.en: Maimouna is 37 years old and lives in the southern region of Senegal. She is married with four children, three of whom attend school. The eldest son is in second grade (of the Senegalese school system), the second in third grade and the third in sixth grade of secondary school. Maimouna has been working in rice mills since she got married and also raises poultry in order to feed her family, since her husband does not work. With this loan she is going to buy chicks to expand her henhouse; this is a very profitable activity for her. Maimouna lives in a house which she rents but would like to have her own house in the future.

loans.use: to strengthen funds

loans.name: Saedye

texts.en:
Saedye is a 49-year-old widowed woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Saedye is requesting a loan of 700 JD to do home maintenance with an aspiration of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to do home maintenance.

loans.name: Martha Eugenia

texts.es:
Doña Martha, continua laborando, como cajera, y el ingreso de un cuarto que alquila, logrando a si, equilibrar sus gastos, atraves da estos años, su meta ha sido mejorar su casa, en donde lo ha venido logrando, con financiamientos.
Hoy en dia, desea subir paredes, mas altas en su casa, ya que la alcaldia, reparo calles y echo tierra, lo que las calles, quedaron altas, quedando su casa en bajo, y desea hacer esta mejora, ante que las correntada del invierno, le inunden, quedando paredes de enfrente, al igual que la calle. Lo que comprara materiales de construccion en piedra, arena, cemento y hierro para comenzar la obra. Dando seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Martha continues working as a cashier and making income from a room which she rents out.  This helps her to cover her expenses.  Over the years, her goal has been to improve her house and she has been managing this through loans.

Martha would currently like to build higher walls in her home as the council repaired the roads and raised the ground at the same time which meant that the streets became higher and her home was left lower than the level of the road.  She would like to make this improvement before the winter comes and she gets flooded.  She would like her front walls to be level with the street.  In order to achieve this, she will buy building supplies ( stone, sand, cement and iron) and start the work.  This will provide her family with security.

loans.use: to buy building supplies so that she can start building concrete walls at the front of her home

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina is 27 years old. Christina lives with her parents and one child in Pangani District, Tanzania. She is a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide who teaches students life skills awareness in order to improve their academic performance. Christina requests a Kiva loan to start a business selling soft drinks near her village. Christina plans to use the profits to expand her business selling soft drinks into becoming a wholesaler. She has wider dreams in business and believes through Kiva, her life will improve.

loans.use: to start a business of selling soft drinks near her village

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Don Miguel is a vendor who has recently moved to the city after living most of his life in rural Ecuador in a town named Quevedo. Although Don Miguel and his wife are older they refuse to be burdens to their children who do not make much money. They purchase certain fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices from his town and take them into the city. They also bring goods from the city back to Quevedo where they can resell them for a profit. He travels back and forth about twice a week and is happy with his business. He is requesting this loan in order to buy more products to sell in his home town of Quevedo.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy goods to sell in rural sectors of Ecuador

loans.name: Leobardo

texts.en:
Mr.C. is a very hardworking person. He has one year of experience selling tennis shoes in an outdoor market in Nuevo Laredo and the business is growing very well, that's why he is applying for a loan of $1200.00. He wants to buy more merchandise and pay off the loan in 12 months.

El sr. C. es una persona muy trabajadora, el vende desde hace mas de un año zapatos tennis en un tiangis aqui en Nuevo Laredo y el negocio va creciendo muy bien, por lo cual el esta aplicando para un prestamo de $1200.00 dllrs y comprar mas mercancia, el planea pagarlo en 12 meses.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Three years ago, after looking for gainful employment in many places without finding anything promising, Ariel decided to start his own business as a shoe salesman to be able to afford the necessities for his family. He is married with two daughters, ages 8 and 13. Love of his family has pushed him to work arduously from day to day and has helped him grow his business, which has borne fruits from the start.

Now, Ariel needs a loan of $475 to buy merchandise to add more supplies, allow him to offer a wider selection to his customers and to continue growing his business. He will repay it within three to six months. You can be a part of helping Ariel's family and business grow. They are thankful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Hace tres años, después de buscar empleo en muchos lugares sin obtener un buen resultado, Ariel decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de calzado, para poder darle lo necesario a su familia, él es casado y tiene dos hijas de 8 y 13 años. El amor por su familia lo ha incentivado a trabajar arduamente día a día y le ha ayudado a crecer con su negocio, que ha rendido frutos desde su inicio.

Ahora Ariel necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para surtir mejor su negocio y poder ofrecerle una mayor variedad a sus clientes, para continuar creciendo con su negocio, él ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y en la vida de la familia de Ariel, ellos agradecen sinceramente su apoyo.

loans.use: Buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Vidalia

texts.es:
Vidalia lives in downtown Guayaiby, a small village in Santaní. She is married and has 2 children and her husband works in a ginning factory. In order to help support the family, Vidalia started a microbusiness in her house: she opened a butcher's shop with which she has been helping her husband pay for the household expenses, especially for their children's education.

Vidalia's business is doing well, she opened it 5 years ago and over that period she saw an increase in her number of clients. Today, Vidalia would like to see her business grow. She wishes to buy live poultry so she can raise and slaughter them for sale in her house, with the help of her brother, who already has experience with butchering.

They need a $900 capital to buy chickens and build their own chicken coop so they can increase their sales. Vidalia has already calculated the costs and how much revenue the business would be getting and she is very excited, because the demand for poultry meat and eggs is very high and they can fetch good prices.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

La Sra Vidalia vive en el centro D. Guayaiby un pueblo D. Santaní, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos; su marido es empleado en una fábrica desmotadora. Para poder ayudar con los ingresos D. la casa, Vidalia, armó su propia microempresa en su casa, ella tiene una carnicería, con lo que ayuda a su marido a solventar los gastos D. la casa, especialmente los estudios D. sus hijos. Su negocio marcha bien, ya van 5 años desD. que monto su carnicería y con el tiempo se ha hecho D. muchos clientes. Hoy Vidalia quiere crecer y expandir su negocio, ella desea comprar aves vivas para poder criarlas y fanearlas en su casa para la venta, con la ayuda D. su hermano que ya tiene experiencia en el faneamiento D. animales. Necesitan un capital D. $ 900 para poder comprar gallinas y armar su corral con lo que ira ampliando sus ventas; ella ha calculado el costo y las utilidades que le generará su negocio y esta muy entusiasmanda pues la demanda D. carne D. aves y huevos es muy alta y se comercializa a muy buen precio.

loans.use: comprar gallinas y armar un corral para cria de aves

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Marco has a car that he uses as a taxi cab for a company called VIP in the city of La Paz.

He lives in the area of Pampahasi in the city of La Paz. This is his second request for a loan from IMPRO. His credit history is impecable since he paid his first loan on time. He will use the loan to fix the engine, to purchase radio supplies and to do a general check-up on his car.

His credit and work history make him a great candidate for another loan, and he has experience running his own business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Marco tiene un vehiculo que trabaja como radio taxi en la empresa VIP. De la ciudad de La Paz. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz. Es segunda vez que solicita un crédito a través de IMPRO. Su historial en nuestra institución lo califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la arreglo de motor, compra de radio de comunicación y un mantenimiento completo del vehiculo. Sus antecedentes crediticios y trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio.

loans.use: To fix taxi cab

loans.name: Folole

texts.en:
Folole joined the program recently. She is on her first loan of $300 US, and she is running a Pancake Business. She sells her pancakes at the school and also to the village people for morning tea. She sells seven days of the week including Sundays and Saturdays.

Her husband does not work and this will be a good source of income for not only them but also for their four children, who are in school. She is hoping that this business will really support her children in school so that they will be well-educated and have good futures.

loans.use: To buy flour, oil, a fryer, spoons and forks for her pancake business

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe is a woman who likes everything related to beauty/styling and, for this reason, she began to study the profession. She realized that this type of work is one that she can endeavor in with much success. She finished her studies and decided to start her own business, given they were short of funds since her husband had lost his job and they did not have the money to continue paying the school expenses of their two small children. So, with few tools but thanks to having studied the profession, she began to apply acrylic nails and cut hair. Many women were pleased with her services, and today she has a few more clients.

Despite the fact that more people frequent her business, there are more demands from her clientele. For this reason, she asks for a $650USD loan to be paid back over six months. With this money, Guadalupe would be able to buy furniture to improve her business and reflect a better image. With your help, Guadalupe will be able to grow her enterprise and help her children get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Guadalupe es una mujer a la que le gusta todo el mundo del estilismo, y por lo tanto comenzó a estudiar esta profesión, y se dio cuenta que este tipo de trabajos es el que ella puede realizar con gran éxito. Por lo tanto al terminar de estudiar decidió comenzar su propio negocio. Puesto que en su casa faltaba dinero, porque su esposo había perdido el trabajo y no tenían dinero para seguir pagando todos los gastos de la escuela de sus dos pequeños hijos. Y fue así como con un poco de herramientas que ya tenía gracias a que estudió la profesión, comenzó a aplicar uñas de acrílico y a cortar el pelo. Muchas mujeres quedaron satisfechas por su trabajo es por eso que hoy ya tiene un poco más de clientas.

Sin embargo mientras más personas son las que van a este negocio, más son las exigencias de su clientela, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $650 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Guadalupe podrá comprar muebles para que su estética sea más rentable y tenga una mejor imagen. Con tu ayuda Guadalupe podrá crecer su negocio y así sacar a sus hijos adelante.

loans.use: Purchase furniture for beauty salon.

loans.name: Suniah

texts.en: Suniah is a 60-year-old widow. Her husband passed away a long time ago, leaving her to work hard by herself to cover the family's daily needs. She sells vegetables at her stall, earning about US$ 11.50 per week. Previously, she sold other foods, but that business did not grow very well, so she has decided to concentrate on vegetable sales now. She is requesting a loan of US$ 125 to expand her little business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her little vegetable stall

loans.name: Ayesha's Group

texts.en: "I am a widow and I have lived all my life in Arifwala, Pakistan. I have six kids: three boys and three girls. Currently, two of my children attend school. I make and sell traditional hair ornaments known as Paranda. I want to increase my income by expanding my business. I am also requesting loans for my group members. Hameeda B. needs to buy cloth to sell. Amna B. wants to buy sheep for their livestock trading business.

loans.use: Expand my current business making hair ornaments

loans.name: Maria José

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Jose Rios is a native to the city of Leon. She runs a small business selling fruits and vegetables in the market La Terminal, in the beautiful city of Leon. Her business stands out because it is very popular and is visited by customers who sympathize with Maria because of her humble nature and attentiveness to her customers.

Mrs. Rios needs to purchase more fruits and vegetables from her wholesalers and this is why she is asking Ceprodel for a loan that would be used wholly for this purpose. It is important to point out that ever since she became involved in the loan process with Ceprodel she has been very punctual with her payments and consistent with agreed upon requirements and rules.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La señora Maria José R. originaria de la ciudad de León, se dedica al negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado la Terminal de esta bella ciudad. Su negocio se caracteriza por ser muy popular debido a que es muy visitada por clientes quienes se sienten muy identificada con ella por ser una muy humilde persona que atiende muy bien a sus clientes.

La necesidad de la señora R. es la compra de las frutas y verduras a sus proveedores y es por tal motivo que acude a CEPRODEL para que se le otorgue crédito y usarlo directamente en la compra de sus productos. Es de importancia destacar que desde que ha adquirido créditos con esta institución ha sido fiel con sus pagos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es:
The production of carrying bags has become the primary business and source of income for Leopoldo and his beloved family, including his two small children and his hard working wife. He started this business about a year and a half ago with the guidance and motivation provided him by his younger sister Elizabeth, who also runs a similar business. Every member of the family works tirelessly to make the business a success, and thanks to this effort they have been able to infiltrate the markets in the cities of Puno, Arequipa, Cuzco, and their native city of Juliaca. Now they are seeing such a great demand that they decided to expand their business and to take on 2 workers so that they will help with the unemployment problem in their country, and to increase their merchandise. With this in mind they come to you to request your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La confección de bolsas se ha convertido en la actividad que otorga el ingreso principal a Leopoldo y su querida familia que la integran sus 2 menores hijos y su emprendedora esposa. Inició este negocio hace aproximadamente un año y medio, gracias a los consejos y motivación de su hermana menor Elizabeth quien también está inmersa en este trabajo.Todos los miembros de su familia trabajan incansablemente para sacar adelante su taller, gracias a ello ha podido incursionar en los mercados de las ciudades de Puno, Arequipa, Cuzco y su ciudad natal Juliaca. Ahora al ver que tiene gran demanda decidió ampliar su taller y al mismo tiempo contratar 2 trabajadores para de esa manera disminuir la taza de desempleados de su país y aumentar la cantidad de su mercadería. Con ese propósito recurre a tI para solicitar tu desinteresado apoyo.

loans.use: Increase in capital to increase the production of carrying bags.

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Vũ Thị Tẹo, 60 years old, became a TYM member in 1998. At first, she bought waste material to resell to recycling companies. It was hard work physically, everyday she had to cycle a few dozens kilometers to neighboring villages & towns. She was making 3-5 USD a day but it was all hard work. Since she is getting old, she is not able to continue this work anymore. Now she makes bamboo baskets and other everyday use items and sells to the locals. She makes about 3 USD a day. Her children are grown up. They do help her out when she has difficulty making the weekly payment. This time she is requesting a loan of 575 USD to stock up on bamboo so that she won't have to pay high price by using credit.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Tẹo, 60 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1998. Khi bắt đầu tham gia, chị vay vốn đi thu mua phế liệu. Công việc khá vất vả, hàng ngày chị phải đạp xe đi vài chục cây số quanh thị trấn và các huyện lân cận. Nhờ chịu khó nên kinh tế gia đình có những chuyển biến tích cực. Thu nhập một ngày đi thu mua sắt vụn từ 3-5USD. Hiện nay, chị Tẹo đã nhiều tuổi nên không đi thu mua phế liệu được nữa. Chị dành vốn mua tre về đan rổ rá, thúng và các đồ dùng gia đình. Sản phẩm làm ra được bán cho nhân dân địa phương mang lại cho chị mỗi ngày 3USD. Hai con chị đều đã trưởng thành nên luôn hỗ trợ mẹ trong việc hoàn trả mỗi khi có khó khăn. Vòng vốn này chị Tẹo muốn vay thêm 575USD mua tre để đan. Như vậy chị sẽ không phải đi mua chịu nguyên liệu với giá cao.

loans.use: Buy bamboo

loans.name: Mohammad Sharif

texts.en: Mohammad Sharif lives in district 13 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a metal worker and works hard. He learned this business in Pakistan and he was there for more than 10 years. When he left Pakistan one year ago he started working in Kabul but he needed some money to complete his stock and further his business. He requested an individual loan to buy necessary  materials to able to make his life better in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials

loans.name: Homid

texts.en: K. Homid is 44 years old. He is married with an amazing daughter. Homid has been running his own café, cooking shish kebab for 14 years. His café is located close to his house. On average he services 20-25 clients a day. His wife and daughter help him with the business. Homid uses only the best inputs in his café. Thus the business is stable and brings considerable income for the family. This year is very important for Homid as he is going to arrange the wedding of his dearest daughter. Homid plans to expand his business to earn more money. With this purpose Homid requests $400 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. He is planning to purchase meat and coal for his café. This amount would help him accomplish his goals in a short time. Homid wants to thank everyone supporting him.

loans.use: To purchase meat and coal for his café

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru:
Ilhom O. is a resident of Yavan city. He is 29 years old, married, and has one child. He graduated from the institute and works in a middle school. In addition, he also has a business repairing computers. To develop his business, he would like to purchase a computer, which would help him expedite his services as well as create new jobs. To do so, he would take out a loan, which he plans to pay back the loan within six months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer.

Олимов Ильхом житель города Яван. Возраст 29 лет. Женат , имеет одного ребенка. Закончил институт. Работает в средней школе. Кроме того занимается ремонтом компьютеров. Для развития бизнеса хочет приобрести компьютер. Это поможет ему увеличить скорость обслуживания , а так же создать новые рабочие места. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of a computer

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
Jesusa is a member of the Señor de Huanca Communal Bank.

Jesusa is 38-years-old and married with 5 children. Jesusa lives in the Morro de Arica district where she owns a small chicken stand. She works at night, when her children are able to assist her. Jesusa began selling French fries with fried chicken at the door of her house, a trade she learned from a nephew who owns a chicken stand in the city of Lima. Additionally, Jesusa travels to fairs where she buys cereals to sell in the city of Ayacucho. She also has a car that she uses to transport passengers to the district of Vinchos.

Jesusa needs a loan of $350 (1,000 soles) for investing in the purchase of oil, potatoes, and various sauces.

Jesusa dreams of expanding her business, completing construction of her house, providing her children with everything they need, and having her children go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Jesusa es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca.

Jesusa es casada, tiene 38 años y 5 hijos, Jesusa vive en el barrio de Morro de Arica en donde tiene una pequeña pollería, atiende por las noches para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijas, actividad que aprendió de su sobrino que tiene una pollería en la ciudad de Lima, Jesusa inicio vendiendo salchipollos en la puerta de su casa. Además Jesusa viaja a las ferias de donde compra cereales que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho, Jesusa también tiene un carro que realiza transporte de pasajeros al distrito de Vinchos.

Jesusa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de aceite, papa y cremas variadas.

Los sueños de Jesusa son ampliar su negocio, hacer el acabado de su casa, darles toda las comodidades a sus hijos y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Purchase of oil, potatoes, and various sauces.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Elena es casada su esposo es trailero, tiene dos hijos. Ella inicio su negocio cuando los niños entraron a la escuela, ya que los gastos se empezaron a incrementar y con el sueldo de su esposo era difícil completar para solventar los gastos; entonces ella empezó a vender taquitos en la barda de la escuela de sus hijos, y así comenzó a hacer comidas en su casa y después venderlas, poco a poco ha aumentado sus clientes y ha logrado salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar una estufa que le permita hacer mayor cantidad de comidas y así incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Elena is married. Her husband is a truck driver and they have two children. She began her business when her children started school since their bills began to increase. With her husband's salary, it was difficult to cover all their expenses. So, she began to sell taquitos at the gate of her children's school. Then, she began to make food in her home and then sell it. Gradually, she has increased her number of customers and has been able to get ahead.

She needs a loan of US $300, which she will repay in four months, in order to purchase a stove that will allow her to make a greater quantity of food and therefore increase in her income.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a stove.

loans.name: Noun

texts.en: Noun S. was born in 1972 and is married with two children. She and her husband have a butchery stand at home that sells pork. In the early morning her husband has to buy pork from a butcher in his town and then the couple starts reselling it at their stand. With their business activity, they can collectively make $5/day of profit. Noun and her husband need more money to expand the quantity of their pork because right now the price of pork is slightly up and the demand is increasing.

loans.use: Noun would like to buy more pork for their business.

loans.name: Mirembe Mariam ’S Group

texts.en: Miriam is a leader of 5 members of a group.  She is 35 and married with 6 children aged between 5 and 18 years. All her children go to school.  Miriam takes care of her old parents. She resides and owns a three-roomed house where she is staying with five people.  They have electricity and piped water at home. The family gets two meals a day and rarely take tea.  Miriam works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala, dealing in second-hand towels and bed sheets   She uses public transport to and from work.  Miriam buys these items from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala city.  She sells to an average of 20 customers per day. Besides linens, she also sells airtime. Miriam sells to all categories of people and has been in this business for five years, working six days a week. She is faced with a challenge of seasonality and medication expenses. She has been with MCDT for four years working all with the same group mates and wants to use this loan to have permanent place to sell her merchandise. and she aspires to educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: To acquire  permanent business premises

loans.name: Saing

texts.en: Saing C., 53, is a widow who resides with four of her children in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She makes $2 a day selling porridge. She is also supported by two of her children who work in the garment factory and also collect palm juice. Saing C. would like to take out a loan of $600 to purchase wood for her children to use to boil the palm juice to refine palm sugar.

loans.use: To purchase wood to use as fuel for refining palm sugar

loans.name: Mawuenawo Eya

texts.fr:
Mme Mawuenawo Eya T. est née à Davié-Tékpo au Sud du Togo le 29 Novembre 1973. Mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants, elle est revendeuse de produits de premières nécessités, activité qui lui permet d’appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses du ménage.
Elle est constamment sollicitée par sa clientèle, ce qui le met souvent en rupture de stock. Pour résoudre ce problème, elle sollicite un financement pour s’approvisionner suffisamment en marchandises afin de pouvoir satisfaire pleinement ses clients. Ce financement augmentera ses recettes et ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Ms. Mawuenawo Eya T. was born on November 29, 1973 in Davié-Tékpo in southern Togo. She is a retailer of essential goods. This is a business that enables her to support her husband in covering household expenses. She is in constant demand by her customers which often leads to inventory shortages. To resolve this problem, she is requesting financing to get enough merchandise to meet their expectations fully. This financing will increase her receipts and her profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell staple goods

loans.name: Ath

texts.en: Mrs. Ath O. lives in the Toul Kandal Choerng Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and later re-sells at better prices. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more rice to resell. She hopes to increase her income and to improve the living conditions of her family with this loan. Her husband, Mr. En Kheng, is an assistant village chief. Mrs. Ath O. is a 54-year-old mother of four children, three of whom stay at home to do housework and help with their mother's business while the other is a construction worker. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice to keep in stock and later re-sell at better prices

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam has been a bites (bread and maandazi) seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 1 year. She belongs to the Nia Moja group loan (Group code 2011). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $60. Every day she works at her business from 7:15 a.m. She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more flour and cooking oil for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Maryam is 34 years old, married, and has one child.

loans.use: To buy more flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Cookery Sellers Group

texts.en:
This is Isatu S., Isatu S., Adama K. and Kathy K..  They named their group Cookery Women. This will be their fourth loan from SMT. Previous loans have made tremendous impacts in their lives. The last loan they received from Kiva through SMT was for Le 800,000.00 each. Now, they are requesting a loan of Le 1,000,000.00 for each to enable them to strengthen their businesses further.

Isatu S. (2nd from left) is the leader of this group. Isatu is forty years of age. She was born in Kupr Kalisa, Kambia district, in the northern part of Sierra Leone. She now resides in Makeni City together with her husband. She has two children. One is in Senior Secondary School II (JSS II) and the other is in Class 2.  Her husband is a businessman. 

Isatu sells cooked rice and has been in this business for over eight years now. With this loan, Isatu will buy cooking ingredients. She will buy five bags of rice, forty barters (five gallons make a barter) of palm oil (the most popular cooking), fish, onions etc. 

Currently, Isatu faces no major challenges worth noting in her business. Business is going fine; she is doing well in her business and loves doing it. With this loan, Isatu and members of the Cookery Sellers Group will feel good and happy, as it will enable them to improve their businesses further.

(Note: Two women in this group have the same name, Isatu S.)

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 32 year old married man with one child, living in Awkar, Mount Lebanon. He has been working as a home painter since 2000. Today, Charles is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy new painting equipment for his job.

loans.use: buy new painting equipment

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael A. is a fifty-eight year old married man and the father of five children: two sons and three daughters. Some are in the senior high while others are in the junior high schools. His wife trades to support him financially. Michael lives with his wife and children in a family house in a town called Achiase. Achiase is a farming and a busy trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Michael trades in agro-chemicals. He sells all kinds of agro-chemicals such as pesticides, insecticides, etc. and all kinds fertilizers. Michael sells in a store at the local lorry (truck) station. He procures the chemicals from nearby agricultural offices.

Michael has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure the chemicals in bulk. He is hopeful to give his children the best education possible.

loans.use: To procure agro-chemicals in bulk

loans.name: Jina

texts.en:
Jina is 34 years old. She is married. Jina has owned a small charcoal store and she has been a chips seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 10 years. She belongs to Subira in Mpaka group loan (Group code 2062). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately US$ 90. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and potatoes to add to her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and potatoes to add to her current stock

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo L. de 50 años de edad, reside en San Martín junto a su esposa y su única hija de 11 años de edad, la cual se dedica a estudiar. El posee un negocio en su lugar de residencia llamado “confecciones L.”, en el cual se encarga de hacer ropa para todas las edades. Lorenzo es muy reconocido en el lugar por su excelente trabajo y es preferido por la mayoría de personas en el lugar. Lorenzo solicita un préstamo con el fin de obtener el capital necesario para comprar más hilos, botones, telas, entre otros productos más, lo cual contribuya a mejorar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Lorenzo L. is 50 and lives in San Martín with his wife and their only daughter, who is 11 and goes to school. He has a business in his home which he calls "Confecciones L.," where he makes clothing for all ages. Lorenzo is very well-known in his community because of the excellent work he does, and he is preferred by the majority of the people there. Lorenzo is requesting a loan with the aim of obtaining the necessary capital to buy more thread, buttons, fabric, and other products to improve his work.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for his work

loans.name: Zahro

texts.en:
Zahro R. is 31 years old, a devoted mother living with her 3 children and her husband. She makes the most of an opportunity, such as when she started selling confectioneries in the food market of Isfara town. In this way, with the constant attention she gives almost all day long every day, she gets shoppers, which enables her to contribute to the home finances. This is an activity Zahro enjoys because she can rest from the hard labor in the countryside. She is motivated to do this work by the need to help support the family's finances, and she is able to take care of the education of her children who study in school. Zahro is requesting a loan with which she will invest in merchandise for her shop. She wishes to stock it with more products and offer the best every day. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to com,munities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase confectioneries to expand the range of goods.

loans.name: Kobèkun (Encaisser Tous). Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kobèkun est composé de sept femmes du quartier Koko de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso) qui se sont connues depuis des années. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et sont mariées et mères d’au moins 4 enfants. 
Elles mènent  comme activité principale la vente du bois de chauffe et le jardinage comme  activité secondaire.
Dans le souci d’augmenter la taille de leurs activités commerciales, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Après le premier prêt qui fut remboursé sans aucune difficulté, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter  quelques chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe dans les villages de Belesso Sirakélé et Tiesso, auprès des paysans, qui seront revendus à la maison au comptant et en détail à une clientèle composée de femmes, de boulangers etc.
Elles ont de l’expérience dans l’achat et la vente du bois de chauffe car elles sont équipées de charrettes à âne  et de conducteurs. Ainsi avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser en moyenne au cours du cycle 55 000 FCFA de bénéfice chacune. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt  de Soro Yiriwaso et faire face aux charges courantes de la famille. 
Dans l’avenir, le groupe compte obtenir  un prêt élevé pour pouvoir se procurer des chargements de camions remorques.
texts.en:
The group “Kobèkun” (everyone stands to gain) is composed of 7 women from the Koko neighborhood of the town of Koutiala (Sikasso region) who have known each other for years. They have an average age of 33, are married, and the mothers of at least 4 children.

Their primary business is selling firewood and secondarily, gardening. Wishing to increase the size of their businesses, the members decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After their first loan which was reimbursed without difficulty, they are on their second solidarity loan.

This loan will be used to buy several cartloads of firewood in the villages of Belesso Sirakélé and Tiesso, from the rural folk. The firewood will be sold out of their homes, for cash, retail, to a clientele composed of women, bakers, etc.

They have experience with buying and selling firewood, since they are equipped with donkey carts and drivers. With this new loan they each expect to make an average profit of 55,000 F CFA over the course of the loan cycle. This profit will be used to reimburse the interest on the Soro Yiriwaso loan and cover current family expenses.

In future, the group expects to obtain a larger loan so that they can get loads of wood in big trucks.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing firewood for resale

loans.name: Muhiba

texts.en:
K. Muhiba is married and has three children. She started as an entrepreneur by selling children's clothing in the central city market. Today, after 20 years, her business is the main source of income for her family and her husband and older son are actively involved, helping her with sales.

Muhiba is a very focused and balanced business owner. She is requesting a loan of $3000 USD to restock her inventory.
