She wishes to expand the range of goods and hopes that providing a good assortment of inventory at reasonable prices will attract many potential customers, helping her business to grow and expand for the future. Muhiba feels this is the only way to earn enough to ensure that her children can continue their education and have a bright future.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Naite

texts.en:
Naite A. M. is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of Vaiusu T. She is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Naite owns and operates a handicraft business. She sells fabric handicrafts to tourists and local community members. Naite has been engaged in this business for over 3 years. Naite joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This will be Naite's 4th loan from SPBD. She most recently repaid a loan of 2250 WST that she used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. She will use this loan of 2750 WST to purchase more raw materials and expand her business. About SPBD
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are ladies and are still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. Hannah runs a cold store. She supplies to food vendors in her community. Hannah procures the fish from nearby towns at moderate prices. She has been in business for over five years now and wants a loan to buy fresh fish in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: West Life Group

texts.en:
"West Life" is a group of 5 borrowers led by Evelyn D.. Evelyn is 30 years old and single. She has a seventeen-year old-son and she also cares for another child. Evelyn's dream of education sank due to the civil crisis in Liberia. She was forced to drop out of junior high school. She lives in the 19th Street Sinkor, a community close to downtown Monrovia.

Evelyn sells dry goods, such as rice, beans, bonnie (dried fish), cubes, and oil, to the residents of Sinkor. She started this business 6 years ago, with Ld$3000, which is about $50 USD. Evelyn kept her head high and her focus on her business because it is the only thing she can depend on to feed her family.

Evelyn’s good relationships with her customers made her succeed this much. She needs this loan to purchase more food to expand her business. Evelyn’s goal is to grow to the level of a shop and even bigger. And her dream is for her and her family to become successful.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe stands as a mother and father to her three children now that her husband has passed on. She is 63 years old and resides in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato where rice farming is one of the main livelihoods. Fe manages one and a half hectare of rice field herself. Her harvest reaches 80 to 100 sacks. To continue in her farming business, Fe needs additional financial support. She requested to loan Php10, 000. This loan will go to farm inputs and other farming necessities.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Mena Ekua

texts.en: Mena Ekua P. is divorced and has two children. She has no educational background.  Mena Ekua sells palm kernel oil. She buys palm nuts and processes them to get her oil at Elmina near Adabadze, which she has been doing since 2008. Mena Ekua uses her income in payment of school fees and utility bills.  Mena Ekua will use the loan to purchase more palm nuts to process into oil. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mena Ekua plans to save to reinvest.

loans.use: Ekua will use the loan to purchase more palm nuts to process into oil.

loans.name: Jonevan

texts.en:
26-year-old Jonevan is a rice farmer. He has a 5-year-old child with his wife Althea. He cultivates his land for rice crops and he is happy to share that his crops are flowering now. He wants to make sure that his crops will not dry out and die.

Right now, he does not have the capacity to fund his farm so he sought the help of Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a microfinance institution in the Philippines and a Kiva partner. He applied for Php 12,000. This loan will be very useful to Jonevan because he can now purchase fertilizers and other inputs for his farm to ensure an abundant harvest.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Dina Maria

texts.es: La Señora Dina, es una cliente nueva que viene por recomendación de su sobrina que tambien comenzo a trabajr con la institucion hace unas semanas atrás, la señora tiene una tienda en su domicilio pero tambien tiene su almacen en el centro de la ciudad, las ventas que tiene en este almacen son buenas, sobre todo con el convenio que tiene con el Ministerio de Gobierno para proveer de alimentos al Centro Penitenciario Femenino de Obrajes. La señora Dina es madre soltera y se dedica a este rubro hace ya seis años, con la ayuda de su familia en especial el de sus hermanas que la ayudan a con el niño y el trabajo es que el negocio a ido creciendo en ventas, ahora la misma institucion con la que trabaja le dio el visto bueno para que arme los canastones de fin de año de los empleados para lo que necesitaba el dinero con urgencia porque los productos que incluia en su canaston estaban siendo ofrecidos por sus clientes a precios bajos
texts.en:
Sra. Dina is a new client who came on the suggestion of her niece who began working with the organization several weeks previously. She runs a shop from her home as well as a store in the city center. Sales from this store are good, above all due to the agreement she has with the government ministry to supply food to the Obrajes Women's Prison. Sra. Dina is a single mother and has already dedicated herself to this work for six years with the help of her family and especially that of her two sisters who help her with the baby and the business, since sales have been growing.

She requires the loan urgently because the institution she has been working with gave her approval to make up New Year's baskets for its employees, and the products she includes in her baskets are being offered to customers at low prices.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for New Year's baskets

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos C. de 48 años de edad, reside en Nahuizalco en el departamento de Sonsonate, vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos. El posee una carpintería en su casa, en la cual trabaja por encargo elaborando diferentes productos hechos de madera. Carlos se ha dedicado a este trabajo gran parte de su vida y cuenta con una amplia experiencia es por ello que cuenta con muy buenas referencias. Carlos solicita un préstamo para poder comprar madera, pintura, clavos y otras cosas más las cuales utiliza para realizar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Carlos C. is a resident of Nahuizalco in the department of Sonsonate. He lives with his wife and three children. Carlos operates a carpentry workshop out of his home, where he is contracted to produce different items made of wood. He has dedicated much of his life to this line of work and has gained extensive experience. Carlos presents excellent references and will use his loan to buy wood, paint, nails, and other items he needs to complete his work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood, paint, nails, and other supplies

loans.name: Nelson Francisco

texts.es:
A la edad de 28 años, el caballero Nelson Pérez se dedica a trabajar arduamente con el fin de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación donde tiene que mantener a su familia compuesta por su esposa y sus dos hijos.

Actualmente se desempeña como guarda de seguridad en una empresa y se ha destacado por ser un padre ejemplar ya que se preocupa por el bienestar de sus hijos y ha logrado llevar el sustento a su mesa beneficiando a su familia con el alimento y a sus hijos con el estudio.

El crédito solicitado será invertido para gastos de la promoción de su pequeña hija ya que en estos días estará celebrando esta actividad porque su hija ha cursado satisfactoriamente su año escolar destacándose como muy buena alumna y es su responsabilidad apoyarle en la promoción en su escuela. 
Es por esta razón que espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito le será otorgado satisfactoriamente por la institución y así logrará el sueño de que su hija se promocione de la escuela.
texts.en:
At 28 years of age, Nelson Pérez strives to work hard in order to support his household, which consists of his wife and two children.

He currently works for a company as a security guard. Nelson has been highlighted as an exemplary father who is concerned about the wellbeing of his children. He has managed to provide food on the table for his family and give his children the chance to study.

The requested loan will be used to pay for the promotion expenses of his young daughter. Within the next few days, his family will be celebrating his daughter’s successful completion of another school year. She has stood out as a very good student and it is Nelson’s responsibility to provide for her school promotion. He is confident that this loan will be granted by the Institution so that he can achieve his dream of seeing his daughter promoted at school.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cover the expenses related to his daughter's school promotion

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie U. is a farmer in Sta. Josefa Agusan del Sur.  She has one child who is only three years old. She and her husband work from morning until sunset to ensure that they will have an abundant rice harvest because they take seriously the growing of their crop. 

She is hoping to receive a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. In this way, she will be able to improve the size of her harvest and income as well.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Llerme

texts.es: Llerme, es una mujer muy dinámica y respetuosa con sus compañeras, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 43 años, es madre de tres hijos, todos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a administrar su salón de belleza, esta actividad la realiza en un local alquilado, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica a ser chofer de un motocarro alquilado. LLerme forma parte del Banco Comunal “Damas del Oriente”, desde hace ocho años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en implementar su salón de belleza, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 500 soles, que será invertido en la compra de materiales para su salón de belleza. Llerme tiene el anhelo de tener su propio local e implementarlo más.
texts.en:
Llerme is a very dynamic woman who is respectful towards her companions. She lives in the Callería district in the region of Ucayali. She is 43 years old and the mother of 3 children, all adults. She operates her own beauty salon in a rented space. Llerme can count on the help of her husband, the chauffeur of a rental motorcar. Llerme has belonged to the “Damas del Oriente” Communal Bank for 8 years. Her first loan, for 300 Sols, was invested in launching her beauty salon. Now she needs a loan of 500 Sols, which will be invested in purchasing supplies for the beauty salon. Llerme's dream is to have her own shop and to expand it.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SUPPLIES FOR HER BEAUTY SALON

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 24-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Ali has owned a barber shop since 2006. He decided on going into this business because of his experience. Ali is talented at his work; he does it well and is aware of new styles of haircuts. His clients are people from his region. When he first started, he had some financial issues. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a chair and make some decorative changes in his shop. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase a chair and make some decorative changes in his shop

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Don Wilfredo es casado, padre de 4 hijos, 2 mayores de edad quienes le ayudan con el cuido de la finca y 2 menores de edad estudiando la primaria, habita en la comarca Salvadorita de Puerto Principe, jurisdiccion de Nueva Guinea, desde hace 35 años tiene como principal actividad la ganaderia y agricultura, está solicitando su 2do crédito a AFODENIC y espera ser beneficiado con el fondo kiva y realizar la  compra de dos vacas paridas, para tener la producción de leche, y poder comerciar productos lacteos y mejorar la raza lechera y de esta manera garantizar la alimentación y los ingresos económicos del nucleo familiar. Su finca presenta buenas condiciones tècnica para el desarrollo del hato, don Wilfredo es muy reconocido en su comunidad por su liderazgo, en su futuro espera mejorar la calidad de vida del nucleo familiar y aumentar su inventario ganadero.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is married and the father of 4 children: 2 of them are grown and help him take care of the ranch, and 2 are still in primary school. They live in Salvadorita County in Puerto Principe, in the jurisdiction of Nueva Guinea. For 35 years, Wilfredo's main occupation has been farming and ranching. He is requesting his second loan with AFODENIC and hopes to receive benefits from the Kiva fund so that he can purchase two cows which have given birth. This will allow him to produce milk on his farm, sell dairy products, and improve his dairy herd, thus ensuring that his family unit will have sufficient food and income. Wilfredo's ranch offers good technical conditions for the development of this herd. In his community, Wilfredo is highly respected for his leadership. In the future, he hopes to improve the quality of life for his family and increase his inventory of livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing milk cows

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is hopeful that, by starting a small business, she will be able to make a profit, which she can use to support some of her family's needs. This is especially true of her four children, whose ages range from one to nine years old. To support their education until college, she hopes to grow and stabilize her business.

Since her husband is a fisherman, she wanted to start a business selling fish by using the loan she is requesting from Kiva through ASHI. Aside from that, Anecita and her husband want to use the natural resources in their surroundings in order to earn money for their family. They live along the seashore in the municipality of Hamtic in Antique Province. Thus, fishing and selling fish is one of the most common livelihoods of the people.

loans.use: To purchase fish for resale

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoeun C. (pictured here), 32 and her husband, Mr. Hai Hok, have been married since 1993 and just have a young daughter. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Yoeun has been a garment factory worker for 10 years. Her husband has been selling piglets for four months. He buys piglets from the nearby districts and transports them to sell in other provinces.  

Yoeun is requesting her first loan of $1,200 to purchase more piglets for her husband to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: capital for businesses

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fuel to transport charcoal from the production site to her business center

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: EL SEÑOR JOSE LUIS SE DEDICA AL TRANSPORTE PUBLICO EN LA LINEA DE TAXI TRUFI 123, ES LA RUTA A LA ZONA DONDE EL VIVE USPA USPA,  TRABAJA COMO CHOFER 16 AÑOS Y CON MOVILIDAD PROPIA DESDE HACE 6 AÑOS, TIENE CASA PROPIA, ESTA CASADO Y TIENE 3 HIJOS, HA DEMOSTRADO SER RESPONSABLE CON LOS PAGOS DE SUS CUOTAS YA QUE TRANAJA CON LA INSTITUCION MAS DE 2 AÑOS YA QUE SE ENCUENTRA EN SU TERCER CICLO Y EL CREDITO SACO PARA LA COMPRA DE UNA CAJA MECANICA Y RADIADOR PARA SU MOVILIDAD, YA QUE LA CAJA DE SU VEHICULO TIENE FALLAS Y NO PERMITE REALIZAR BIEN SU TRABAJO. ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Jose Luis works in public transport on the Taxi Trufi route 123 to Uspa Uspa, where he lives. He has been working as a driver for 16 years, with own vehicle since six years ago. He is married with three children and owns a home. He has demonstrated his responsibility with repayments; he has been working with the institution for more than two years and is already in his third cycle. As the transmission on his vehicle is faulty and prevents him from doing his job properly, this loan is being used to buy a mechanical gearbox and a radiator for his vehicle. He is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust extended to him with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a mechanical gearbox, a radiator, and other items

loans.name: Liboria

texts.es:
La Socia pertenece al banco comunal “COLQUECANCHA”; Nuestra Socia vive en la comunidad de Raqchi perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba del departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Liboria, ella tiene 47 años la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijo; Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia trabaja vendiendo artesanía en el mirador de Raqchy, la socia junto a otras señoras socias venden en este punto turístico todo tipo de artesanías, ella compra lanas de diferentes colores y diseña diversos animales y paisajes imitando el lenguaje antiguo de los Inkas cuando utilizaban la iconográfica como medio de lenguaje popular. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar material y elaborar sus tejidos, una parte para su casa y otra para comprar un animalito vacuno aún no sabe que comprará si torito o vaca.

Nuestra socia agradece a todos los inversionistas que hacen  posible la realización de este sueño y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Liboria, age 47, belongs to the Colquecancha community bank; she lives in the community of Raqchi, Urubamba province, Cusco. She is married and has 4 sons. She does housework and retail; she sells handicrafts in the Raqchi viewpoint. She sells all sorts of handicrafts in this tourist spot, along with other bank members. She buys different coloured wools and designs a wide range of animals and landscapes, and in doing so she imitates the ancient language of the Incas, who used iconography as a form of common language. Liboria is requesting this loan to buy material and develop her weaving, work on her house and buy a small animal, either a bull or a cow. She is grateful to everyone who is making this dream possible an promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy weaving material, an animal and housing materials

loans.name: Nerida Geovana

texts.es: La Sra. Nerida Geovana F. R. de 39 años de edad es madre soltera. Vive en casa de su madre con sus hijos, el cual uno de ellos ya es independiente. Trabaja como obrera de planta en la empresa Iqf del Peru desde hace 8 años. Solicita el crédito para terminar de construir su casa ya que su madre le ha donado un terreno. Es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable que ha brindado una buena educación a sus hijos con mucho esfuerzo y pretende tener una mejor calidad de vida. Su sueño es poder concluir con la construcción de su casa. La Sra Nerida Geovana F. R., agradece la ayuda que le podamos brindar a trávez de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Ms. Nerida Geovana F. R., 39 years old, is a single mother. She lives in her mother's house with her children, one of whom is independent. She has been employed for 8 years as a factory worker for IQF [a business focusing on activities such as freezing and preserving food for export]. She is requesting this loan to finish construction of her house now that her mother has provided a piece of land to build on. She is a very hard working and responsible person who, through much effort, has provided a good education to her children and hopes to have a better quality of life. Her dream is to be able to complete the construction of the house. Ms. Nerida Geovana F. R. is grateful for the assistance that we have been able to provide her through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing improvements.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is married and has three children, aged 18 yrs, 16 yrs and 12 yrs. All of her children attend school. She has been operating her business of selling beans, ground nuts, sunflower and maize in a shop, to her neighbors and passersby. Her husband is employed at a restaurant and he supports his family financially.

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase a sack of beans, groundnuts and sunflower seeds. She faces the main challenges of theft and high competition. Dorcas hopes to have a wholesale business in the future and to supply her products in large volumes. She decided to work with Yehu so as to get a loan and improve her living standards. She rents a house with electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of beans, ground nuts, maize and sunflower.

loans.name: Gradi Plus Group

texts.en:
Adolphine W. is the leader of the Community Bank named “Gradi Plus” which is composed of 31 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Adolphine has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2007. She runs a general store to the Southwest of Kinshasa. She has acquired solid experience in this area and works hard with good management skills in order to realize her dream of one day opening a large store in her environment. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business that earns her $28 per week. She works to the best of her abilities and uses her contacts so that she might achieve her goals. 

Adolphine has already obtained twice and correctly repaid loans from the micro-finance institution, HOPE DRC.  She will increase her stock of merchandise with her loan from Kiva by buying women’s clothes and reselling them at a profit. 42 years old, Aldophine is married and the mother of four children, whose ages vary between 7 and 16 years old.  All of them attend school.

loans.use: increasing her stock by buying women’s clothes and reselling for a profit.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger L. is from the town of Banga. He is 50 years old and married with 4 grown children. To make a living, Roger farms corn for sale. Roger also grows hogs for fattening, and he hopes to expand this business.  Roger joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roger has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and now requests his 4th loan, for 12000 PHP, in order to purchase fertilizer and livestock feed.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and livestock feed.

loans.name: Assietou

texts.fr:
ASSIETOU LEY est une femme de 49 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WALIDANE depuis le 02 juin 2006. Elle a 06 fois de suite reçu de crédit

Elle fait de l’embouche bovine et la vente de charbon de bois. 

Son crédit lui permettra d’acheter deux bœufs et 200 sacs de charbon pour mieux développer son activité de commerce de charbon de bois et de l’embouche bovine.

Elle participe à la prise en charge de la famille, par exemple la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
Assietou LEY is a 40-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of WALIDANE since June 2, 2006. She has received six consecutive loans. Assietou fattens cattle and sells charcoal. Her loan will enable her to buy two heads of cattle and 200 sacks of charcoal in order to develop her business better. She helps to cover family expenses, for examples, food and health care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying two heads of cattle and 200 sacks of of charcoal

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en: Sarantuya J. is 26 years old and lives with her husband and four-year-old son in Hovd province of western Mongolia. She and her family live together in an apartment. Her husband is currently working in a thermal power station as an engineer. They are a young couple. Sarantuya has been working as a hairdresser at a hair salon since 2008 and has gained much experience. She plans to open her own cosmetics shop. Sarantuya is a clever woman and works very hard.  She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase cosmetic products for her newly opened cosmetics shop.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Floribeth

texts.en: Floribeth S. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 29 years old. Floribeth is separated from her spouse and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Floribeth buys and sells clothing and shoe products in the local community. Floribeth has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Floribeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Floribeth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Floribeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
Dorris is a single woman with two boys and one girl, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family.

For the past year Dorris has been selling shoes as retail and from home to her neighbours and passersby, her major challenge being seasonality. The availability of stock from suppliers in the market fluctuates. She hopes to develop this small-scale business and be able to start a hairdressing business in the future.

Dorris decided to join Yehu in order to get a loan to improve her business and the family's living standard. With this Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase a bundle of shoes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Reina De La Paz (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Reina de la Paz esta conformado por 10 mujeres quienes son muy alegres y ven la vida de una forma sencilla, trabajan a diario en busca del sustento de sus familias y están orgullosas con lo que han obtenido hasta ahora. Viven en diferentes parroquias de la ciudad, su población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. Estos campos tienen una vista espectacular de su bella naturaleza, donde se respira paz y tranquilidad.

La Señora María P. vive en la parroquia de Zhidmad. Este es su quinto crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y junto a sus amigas  comparten buenos momentos en cada reunión. Nuestra socia tiene de 32 años, es casada y tiene  4 hijos de 13, 11, 9 y 7 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas estudian en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuela de la comunidad. Su esposo se dedica a la construcción siendo de profesión albañil, con el trabajo duro de cada día han logrado construir su casa propia. 
Doña María hace 20 años comenzó a trabajar como empleada domestica y lo ejerce hasta el momento, trabaja solo algunos días  sin un horario fijo, los días que tiene libre se dedica a cuidar de sus animales como: cerdos, cuyes, gallinas. Hace un año tiene un kiosco y se da tiempo para atenderlo. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para su kiosco para ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad. Su meta es agrandar su casa.

La Señora Rosa B. vive en la comunidad de San Judas Tadeo que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle. Nuestra socia se encuentra recuperándose de una operación de cálculos al riñón. Trabaja en varias casas como empleada domestica actividad que la viene desempeñando hace 9 años, labora de lunes a viernes y sale del trabajo cuando termina su tarea. En su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos y cuyes a los cuales los vende en su comunidad o los consume junto a su familia. 
Doña Rosa tiene 51 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 16 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y hace poco y es quien le ha dado su primer nieto, vive en su casa y comparten los gastos del hogar, su segunda hija  estudia diseño grafico en el SECAP (Servicio Ecuatoriano de Capacitación Profesional). Su esposo trabaja como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendado.
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito, fue invitada por una amiga quien es socia activa de la banca comunal, con su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Reina de la Paz community bank is made up of 10 women who are very happy and see life in a simple way.  They work every day to support their families and they are proud with what they have achieved so far.  They live in different parishes in the town.  The people in their town work in crop and livestock farming.  These fields have a spectacular view of the town's natural beauty where peace and tranquility reign.

Mrs María P. lives in Zhidmad parish.  This is the fifth loan which she has had from the community bank and, together with her friends, they have a good time at each meeting.  She is 32 years old, married and has four children aged 13, 11, 9 and 7.  Her eldest two daughters attend high school and her youngest two children attend the local elementary school.  Her husband is in the building trade.  He is a bricklayer.  With hard work every day, they have managed to build their own home.

María began working as a cleaner 20 years ago and she is still doing this.  She only works some days and without regular hours.  When she has days free, she looks after her animals: pigs, guinea pigs and hens.  She has had a kiosk for one year and she spends time working there.  Her new loan will be used to buy products for her kiosk so that she can offer her customers a better range.  Her goal is to extend her house.

Mrs Rosa B. lives in the community of San Judas Tedeo which belongs to the parish of El Valle.  She is recovering from a kidney stone operation.  She works in a number of houses as a cleaner.  She has been doing this for 9 years, working from Monday to Friday.  She leaves work when she has finished her task.  At home she raises chickens and guinea pigs which she sells in her community or eats with her family.

Rosa is 51 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 18 and 16.  Her elder daughter is married and, not long ago, gave Rosa her first grandchild.  She lives in her house and they share household expenses.  Her younger daughter studies graphic design at SECAP (Ecuadorian Professional Training Service).  Her husband works as a private employee.  They don't have their own home and have to rent.

Rosa is requesting her second loan.  She was invited to join by a friend who is an active member of the community bank.  She will invest her new loan in the purchase of chickens and chicken feed.  Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: To buy provisions / chickens and animal feed

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en:
Katerina is divorced with two grown daughters. She is an entrepreneur from Beregovo, Western Ukraine. Katerina sells groceries in the food department of a local mall. She has been working in this sphere of trade for 8 years. Katerina has gained good knowledge in marketing and sales. She always offers fresh merchandise at affordable prices and has many loyal customers. Currently, Katerina has 15,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her monthly net profit amounts to 3,000 Grivnyas.  

Katerina is seeking a 10,000 Grivnya loan to increase her working capital and purchase additional food items for her kiosk. She is very customer-friendly. This timely financial support will be crucial for her as her small venture is the only source of income for her and her daughters.

loans.use: to increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Cosmas K. M., age 26, offers computer services such as printing, photocopying, and typesetting. He has been engaged in this business for three years.  He also operates a motorbike transportation business to boost his income. He has requested a loan of 80,000 Kes to buy computers and printers. 

Cosmas is married and is the father of one child. He aspires eventually to run his business on his own business premises instead of renting.

loans.use: To buy computers and a printer for his printing, photocopying, and typesetting business

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en:
Robelyn A. is from the town of Talibon. She is 38 years old. Robelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Robelyn owns & operates a business preparing and selling barbecue pork and chicken.

Robelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Robelyn is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to purchase meat and other supplies. This will be Robelyn's first loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase meat and other supplies

loans.name: Ilusion 2 Group

texts.es: La  foto fue tomada en la casa de la Sra. Ana Pérez M. ,tiene 48 años, estudio hasta 3ro de secundaria, es casada  y tiene 4 hijos varones. Ella es una integrante del grupo Ilusión 2, ubicado en San Martin Texmelucan puebla, en la foto se ve el compromiso del grupo; La Señora antes mencionada se dedica a vender desayunos en la escuela de su comunidad, también tiene una  pequeña tienda , la cual descuido por dedicarse mas en la escuela lo que en las mañanas y en la tarde vende pan desde hace 4 años.Solicita el préstamo para comprar aceite, enlatados y refrescos entre otros, comenta la Sra. Ana que quiere agrandar un poco su tienda;  sus clientes son la población en general y  Su negocio se encuentra sobre la carretera principal de la población. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente entusiasmada con la ilusión de salir adelante en su tiendita para un tener una mejor vida. Este crédito lo solicita para surtir más su pequeña tienda y a su vez mejorar su ventas de desayunos e incrementar sus ganancia e ir metiendo más artículos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in Mrs Ana Pérez M.' house.  Ana is 48 years old and studied up to the third year of high school.  She is married and has 4 sons.

Ana is a member of the 'Ilusión 2' group which is located in San Martin Texmelucan.  The photo shows the members of the group.  The lady we have just mentioned sells breakfasts in her local school.  She also has a small store and sells bread in the mornings and afternoons.  She has been doing this for 4 years.  She is requesting this loan to buy oil, canned goods and soft drinks, amongst other things.  Ana comments that she would like to extend her store a little.  Her customers are the town's residents in general and her business is located on the town's main road.  At the time of requesting this loan she feels excited about being able to get ahead in her store and have a better life.  She is requesting this loan to better stock her small store and, at the same time, improve her breakfast sales, increase her profits, and stock her store with more essentials.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban vive en una casa en anticretico en la zona Vilacota, área periférica de la ciudad de La Paz, es casado. El señor es chofer de transporte publico y su esposa es empleada domestica; así obtienen sus ingresos con los que se mantiene. Es la primera vez que presenta una solicitud de créditos.

El crédito solicitado será utilizado para refacción de la casa donde vive, para vivir más comodamente.

Por su estudio socio económico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito
texts.en:
Esteban lives in 'anticretico' (a special rental system particular to Bolivia).  His house is in Vilacota which is an area on the outskirts of the city of La Paz.  He is married.

Esteban is a public transport driver and his wife is a cleaner.  This is how they make the income that they use to support themselves.  

This is the first time that Esteban has requested a loan.  He will use his loan to refurbish his house so that he can live more comfortably.

Esteban's socio-economic profile qualifies him to receive a loan.

loans.use: To refurbish his home so that he can live more comfortably

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married man living with his wife and two young school-age children. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a perfume vendor from his house for more than 10 years. In parallel, he's been working as an agent for a local company since 2007. He is the only financial support for his family. It is frequent in Lebanon to have multiple jobs to handle family expenses. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $700 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase additional perfumes and cosmetics products so he can increase his sales and income. In the future, he is planning to open a perfume and gadgets shop.

loans.use: To purchase additional perfumes and cosmetics products

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 35 years old. She has seven children; the youngest is seventeen months old, and the eldest is fifteen years old. She is married, her husband is a farmer, and they are proud of meeting their family's needs.

Mariam has a hair salon and has been in this business for four years. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more hair products. She hopes to use her profits to buy food for her family and pay her children school fees.

loans.use: To buy more hair products to sell

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en: Agripina is 60 years old. She has one son and 9 grandchildren. She sells "chicha" a popular Peruvian drink made from maize, at the Mercado Playa Grau in Ayacucho. She is using her current loan of 1,050 soles to buy the raw ingredients to make chicha - sugar, maize, firewood and plastic bags to serve it in. Agripina has been with FINCA Peru for over 4 years now and enjoys the saving opportunities that they offer. She hopes to one day expand her business and open a stand in the market, selling spices and condiments.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize, firewood and containers

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma V. is from the town of Guibang, Gamu, Isabela. She is 51 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Elma owns and operates a furniture making business, making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Elma has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2007, Elma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Elma is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Elma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
La señora Fabiola es casada tiene 23 años de edad, apenas estudio hasta el nivel de primario, tiene 2 hijos. Fabiola vive con su esposo, tienen su vivienda en la zona de sud oeste  de la provincia Cercado del departamento de Cochabamba.

La señora Fabiola y su esposo se dedican a la producción de leche cruda, para la elaboración de quesillo, para su posterior comercialización en el mercado central de la ciudad de Cochabamba.

Las condiciones en las que viven son modestas, su vivienda cuenta con los servicios básicos, su ganado lo tiene en una propiedad aledaña a su vivienda. La señora Fabiola es una señora muy dedicada a su trabajo, pues ella y su esposo (sus hijos son muy pequeños aun) se levantan muy temprano todos los días para ordeñar las vacas y su posterior transformación en quesillo. Dedicandose durante el día al cuidado de las mimas, actividad en la que participa toda la familia.

La señora Fabiola solicita el crédito para la adquisición de una acción para ingreso al modulo lechero de su zona, y de esta manera tener asegurada el mercado para la leche que produce y tener los pagos asegurados de manera quincenal, ya que la elaboración de quesillo si bien le genera ingresos diarios, esto no le permite tener un ahorro. El ideal que tiene la señora Fabiola es que sus hijos puedan estudiar teniendo una buena alimentación y una vivienda segura.
texts.en:
Fabiola is married, 23 years old, only finished elementary school and has two children.  She lives with her husband, they have a home in the southeast area of the province of Cercado in the department of Cochabamba.

The conditions in which they live are modest, her house has basic services, she has cows in a space near her home.  Fabiola is a lady dedicated to her work, she and her husband (their kids are still very young) get up early every day to milk the cows and later transform the milk into cheese. During the day they take care of the cows, activity in which the whole family participates.

Fabiola requests a loan to acquire a stock to enter the dairy cooperative of her zone, and this way guarantee a market for the milk produced and have secured biweekly payments, even though the making of cheese generates daily income for her, it doesn't allow them to have savings.  Fabiola's wish is that her children study while living eating a healthy diet and in a safe home.

loans.use: to purchase stock to enter the dairy cooperative

loans.name: Maingi

texts.en:
Maingi is a married man with two children. He runs a butchery and a cafeteria to earn a living. He has been operating the business for four years and has employed three people.

He has been able to grow his business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya. He hopes to expand his business so that he can attract more customers. He has been guaranteed a loan of 60,000 Kes by his group members in Faulu Kenya. He will use the loan to buy meat, maize flour, cooking fat and baking flour.

loans.use: to buy meat, maize flour, cooking fat and baking flour.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Tep N. now resides in Siem Reap province. He is a 27-year-old single man who earns a daily income as a repairer of the machine that is used to link boats for local fishermen, and he also sells and rents the boat machine for additional profit. He currently lives with his father who has the same occupation. 

Tep N. is going to use his loan funds as capital in order to buy more additional machinery tools for resale.

loans.use: To buy additional machinery tools for resale
